tgt_text: kgoro e eletša batho bao ba nago le malwetši a go iphihla go ja dijo tša phepo, ba itšhidulle kgafetšakgafetša, ba laole kgatelelo ya bona ya monagano, ba obamele leano la bona la kalafo ya maphelo le go latela magato ka moka a thibelo ya malwetši.

src_text: if you are showing any symptoms, such as a fever, cough, or shortness of breath, contact the covid19 hotline on 0800 029 999 or whatsapp the word ‘hi’ to 0600 123 456.
tgt_text: mma yo a nago le bolwetše bja covid19 silusapho nyanda insaaf mohammed o re go bohlokwa kudu go maafrika borwa, kudukudu bao ba nago le malwetši ao a iphihlilego, go rwala maikarabelo go maphelo a bona.

src_text: a special tribute to our healthcare vukuzenzele unnamed the number of deaths from coronavirus recently passed the 2000 mark.
tgt_text: re gopola bašomedi ba rena ba tlhokomelo ya maphelo vukuzenzele unnamed palo ya moragorago ya mahu a go hlolwa ke coronavirus e fetile 2 000. godimo go bao ba lobilego maphelo a bona ke bašomedi ba tša maphelo, ditsebi tša go hloka bosodi mešomong ya bona bao ba hlokometšego bao ba lwalago, ebile e be e le bona ba thekgago le go homotša bao ba lego maokelong ba beetšwe thoko le ba malapa a bona.

src_text: among those who have lost their lives are healthcare workers, consummate professionals who cared for the ill, and were a support and comfort to those in hospital isolated from their families.
tgt_text: gore banna le basadi bao ba rwelego mošomo wo o bohlokwa wa go kgethega magetleng a bona ke bona bao ba fetelwago ke bolwetši bjo le go hlokagala ke taba ye hlobaetšago kudu.

src_text: that the men and women carrying out this most noble and sacred of duties are themselves falling ill and dying is a devastating blow.
tgt_text: ke bona batho ba matho mothomo ba go phenkgišana le leuba le.

src_text: they are on the frontline of fighting this pandemic.
tgt_text: ba šoma ka tlase ga kgatelelo ye kgolo ebile ba swanela ke go dula ba tshwenyegile megopolong ka ge ba tseba gore ba kotsing ya go fetelwa ke baerase ye.

src_text: they are working under great pressure and must carry the psychological strain of knowing they are at risk of contracting the virus.
tgt_text: ke bagale le bagalegadi ba makgonthe ba phenkgišano ya rena kgahlanong le coronavi rus.

src_text: they are the true heroes and heroines of our battle against coronavirus.
tgt_text: re hlompha bagale ba ba maafrika borwa bao ba tlogelago magae a bona, malapa a bona le baratwa ba bona gore ba tle mešomong tšatši ka tšatši ntle le go šitwa ba eya dikliniking, maokelong le mafelong a mangwe a tša maphelo.

src_text: we salute these brave south africans who leave their homes, families and loved ones to report without fail for duty every day in clinics, hospitals and other health facilities.
tgt_text: gona fao ba fana ka tlhokomelo ya bongaka, thekgo ya tša tsamaišo le ditirelo tše dingwe go swana le go hlwekiša le go fepa batho ka dijo.

src_text: there they provide medical care, administrative support and other services like cleaning and catering.
tgt_text: ge ba le gare ba phethagatša mešomo ya bona ya bokgoni, le rena bjalo ka setšhaba ke mošomo wa rena go ba šireletša le ba malapa a bona.

src_text: just as they perform what is their professional duty, we too have a duty to them and to their families.
tgt_text: maphelo le polokego ya bona a swanetše go tla pele.

src_text: their health and their safety must be paramount.
tgt_text: re a ba hlompha le go ba thekga bjalo ka banna le basadi bao ba laeditšego gore ba itokišeditše go bea maphelo a bona kotsing gore re tle re kgone go phela.

src_text: we honour them and uphold them as the men and women who have demonstrated they are prepared to risk their lives so that we may live.
tgt_text: gore ba kgone go dira mešo mo ya bona ye boimaima ba hloka thekgo le tšhireletšo ya rena ka kabo ya didirišwa tša tšhireletšo ya mmele (dippe).

src_text: for them to do their herculean work they need our support as well as protection through the provision of personal protective equipment (ppe).
tgt_text: ka thekgo ya sekhwama sa naga le dineelano tša go tšwa go maafrika borwa a mantši o tee ka o tee, dikgwebong, dithe ong le mebušong ye mengwe, re ile ra kgona go rekela bašomi ba ba bogale dippe.

src_text: with the support of the solidarity fund and donations from many individual south africans, businesses, foundations and other governments, we have been able to procure personal protective equipment for these brave frontline workers.
tgt_text: fao go bilego le tlhaelelo ya dippe, maokelo a rena a hlaganela seemo seo ka ponyo ya leihlo go netefatša gore didirišwa tšeo di ba gona.

src_text: where there have been shortages of ppe our hospitals are urgently attending to ensuring that they are available.
tgt_text: re tseba gore khumanego ya dippe ga se yona tlhotlo e le noši yeo bašomedi ba tša maphelo ba lebaganego le yona.

src_text: we know that access to ppe is not the only challenge our healthcare workers face.
tgt_text: go ralala naga ka bophara, dikliniki le maokelo di lebagane le tlhaelelo ya bašomi.

src_text: across the country clinics and hospitals are facing staff shortages.
tgt_text: bothata bjo bo gare bo a hlaganelwa.

src_text: this problem is being attended to.
tgt_text: go thekga mošomo wo bašo medi ba rena bao e lego ba mathomo ba go lwantšha bolwetši bjo ba o phethagatšago nageng ka bophara re romela ditona le batlatšatona seleteng se se nngwe le se se nngwe sa ka mo nageng go utolla ditlhotlo tša fao go ya ka fao batho ba itemogelago tšona dileteng tšeo le go šoma mmogo le makgotlataolo a profense a tša maphelo.

src_text: to support the work that our frontline workers are performing around the country we are deploying ministers and deputy ministers to each of the districts in the country to get a line of sight of specific challenges in these districts and to work with provincial health authorities.
tgt_text: re swanetše go šoma mmogo go šireletša maphelo a bohle e sego fela a bašomedi ba tša maphelo eupša a bašomedi ka moka.

src_text: we need to work together to safeguard the health of not just our frontline workers but the entire workforce.
tgt_text: go šetše go bile le mošomo wa bothakga wo dirilwego ke diyunione go ruta maloko a tšona ka taolo ya go fetelwa ke bolwetši le thibelo gotee le tlhweko.

src_text: there has already been sterling work done by unions in educating members around infection control and prevention and hygiene.
tgt_text: tšona diyunione tše di thekga gape mošomo wa kgoro ya mešomo le ya bašomi go swara ditekolo tša mafelo a mešomo go netefatša gore ditshepedišo tša maphelo le tša polokego di a hlongwa go bašomedi bao ba boelago mešomong.

src_text: they are also supporting the work of the department of employment and labour in conducting workplace inspections to ensure health and safety protocols are in place for returning workers.
tgt_text: tše ntši tša diyunion e tša bašomi le tšona di fana ka tshedimošo ya coronavirus go maloko a tšona mola bengmešomo ba le gare ka masolo a temošo.

src_text: many of our trade unions are also providing coronavirus information to their members and employers are running awareness campaigns.
tgt_text: ye nngwe ya dihlotlo tšeo di hlagetšego naga ya gaborena ke ka fao batho bao go hlatsetšwego gore ba nale coronavirus ba tlontlollwago ka gona.

src_text: one of the challenges that has emerged in our country is the stigmatisation of people who have proven positive with coronavirus.
tgt_text: bjalo ka setšhaba, re nale maikarabelo a mohlakanelwa a go fediša go tlontlollwa ga batho bao ba fetetšwego ke coronavirus .

src_text: as a society, we have a collective responsibility to stamp out the stig matisation of people infected with the coronavirus.
tgt_text: go bile le dipego tše hlobaetšago tša ka fao batho ka noši ba hlomarwago go tšwa fao ba tšwago le batho setšhabeng bao ba ipelaetšago kgahlanong le balwetši ba coronavirus ge ba amogelwa maokelong le dikiliniking tša kgauswi le bona.

src_text: there have been disturbing reports of individuals being ostracised from their communities and of communities protesting against coronavirus patients being admitted to local hospitals and clinics.
tgt_text: se se swanetše go fela.

src_text: this must stop.
tgt_text: go swana le ka fao re bilego ngatana ye tee go hlohleletša go amogelwa ga batho bao ba nago le hiv le go ema ka lentšu le tee go lwantšha hlaolo ya bona, re swanetše go laetša kwešišo, kgotlelelo, boleta, kwelano le kwelobohloko go bao ba fetetšwego ke baerase ye le ba malapa a bona.

src_text: just as we came together to promote acceptance of people living with hiv and stood firm against victimisation, we must show understanding, tolerance, kindness, empathy and compassion for those who are infected with this virus and for their families.
tgt_text: gothwe maitshwaro a a go tlontlollwa ga batho a hlohleletšwa ke poifo ya go fetelwa ke bolwetši le go hloka kwešišo.

src_text: it is said that this stigmatisation is driven by fear of con tracting the disease and lack of understanding.
tgt_text: tsela ye kaonekaone ya go fenya poifo ya rena ya tlhago ya bolwetši bjo le ya go fetelwa ke go latela ditshepedišo tša hlweko tšeo di lego gona.

src_text: the best way to overcome our instinctive fear of illness and contagion is to observe the hygiene protocols that are in place.
tgt_text: poifo ya go fetelwa ke bolwetši go hlatsetšwe gore e gona ebile ke ya makgonthe.

src_text: the fear of infection is wellfounded and real.
tgt_text: go le bjalo, re tseba seo re swanetšego go se dira go itšhireletša le go šireletša ba bangwe.

src_text: at the same time, we know what we have to do to protect ourselves and others.
tgt_text: re tseba gore baerasee ye e hlolwa ke eng le gore re ka dira eng go itšhireletša gore re se fetelwe.

src_text: we know what causes the virus and what we can do to protect ourselves from becoming infected.
tgt_text: re tseba gabotse gore re swanetše go šielana sekgala, go ipeela thoko le batho ba bangwe ge re kopane le bao ba fetetšwego le go ihlagiša maokelong ge re nale dika tša bolwetši bjo.

src_text: we know we have to maintain social distancing, to selfisolate if we have come into contact with those infected and to present to a hospital if we have symptoms.
tgt_text: re swanetše go tšwelapele go hlahlwa ke dintlha tša mannete e sego mabarebare.

src_text: we must continue to be guided by facts and not rumours.
tgt_text: nako yela ya gore mang le mang a bolele gore yena ga a tsebe motho yo a fetetšwego goba a amilwego ke coronavirus e fetile kgale.

src_text: the time when anyone could say they do not know anyone who is infected or affected by coronavirus has long passed.
tgt_text: ka nako ye, go feta mehla yohle, bagwera ba rena, ba malapa, bašomimmogo le baagišane ba hloka kwelobohloko le thekgo ya rena.

src_text: now, more than ever, our friends, families, colleagues and neighbours need our empathy and support.
tgt_text: mo matšatšing, dibekeng le dikgwedi tše tlago, re tla fela re ikhwetša re hloka tshepho le go boifa ge re bona palo ya bao ba fetetšwego le bao ba hlokagalago e hlatloga.

src_text: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we will at times find ourselves despondent and fearful as we see the numbers of people infected and dying continue to rise.
tgt_text: go ka direga gore seemo se gakale, eupša re nale bonnete bja gore go tla kaonafala.

src_text: it may be that things have gotten worse, but we are certain that they will get better.
tgt_text: boramahlale ba rena le baeletši ba dingaka ba re boditše gore kelo ya diphetelo e tla hlatloga ge re batamela nhlorwaneng ya rena ya diphetelo.

src_text: our scientists and medical advisers told us that the rate of infections will go up as we move towards our peak.
tgt_text: eupša nnete ke gore palo ye e tla theogela fase.

src_text: but it will certainly come down.
tgt_text: re gopola bašomedi ba rena ba tša maphelo bao ba lobilego maphelo a bona ba hlokometše balwetši.

src_text: we pay tribute to the healthcare workers who lost their lives caring for the sick.
tgt_text: ge re gopola mediro ya bona, a re netefatšeng gore rena le badudi ba gaborena re bolokegile ka go kgatha tema ya rena.

src_text: in their memory, let us keep ourselves and our fellow citizens safe by playing our part.
tgt_text: re tla fenya baerase ye le go aga setšhaba ka leswa.

src_text: we shall overcome this virus and rebuild our society.
tgt_text: re fetile mehleng ye boima ebile re fentše go yona.

src_text: we have seen darker times and we have prevailed.
tgt_text: re gopola bašomedi ba rena ba tlhokomelo ya maphelo vukuzenzele unnamed palo ya moragorago ya mahu a go hlolwa ke coronavirus e fetile 2 000. godimo go bao ba lobilego maphelo a bona ke bašomedi ba tša maphelo, ditsebi tša go hloka bosodi mešomong ya bona bao ba hlokometšego bao ba lwalago, ebile e be e le bona ba thekgago le go homotša bao ba lego maokelong ba beetšwe thoko le ba malapa a bona.

src_text: young farmer receives covid19 support vukuzenzele unnamed nomagcinandile suduka (27) is growing her family’s legacy and wealth by investing in agriculture.
tgt_text: molemi wa moswa o amogela thekgo ya covid19 silusapho nyanda molemi yo a sa thomago tša temo wa kua kapa bohlabela ke yo mongwe wa bao ba holegilego go tšwa sekhwameng sa mmušo sa kimollo ya coronavirus.

src_text: the o wner of 4 u and 4 me primary cooperative in mooiplaas village received support from the department of agriculture, land reform and rural development’s coronavirus (covid19) relief fund for her egg, livestock and vegetable farm.
tgt_text: nomagcinandile suduka wa mengwaga ye 27 o aga bohwa bja lapa la gabo le lehumo ka go beeletša temong.

src_text: the department has awarded r1.2 billion worth of vouchers to farmers in need.
tgt_text: mong wa kgwebo ya 4 u and 4 me primary cooperative kua motsaneng wa mooiplaas o amogetše thušo go tšwa sekhwameng sa kimollo sa coronavirus (covid19) sa kgoro ya temo, mpshafatšo ya naga le tlhabollo ya dinagamagae ka baka la polasa ya gagwe, ya mae gagwe, diruiwa le merogo.

src_text: suduka says her vouchers will help her grow the egg producing side of her business.
tgt_text: kgoro e fane ka dibaotšhara tša go bitša r1.2 bilione go balemi bao ba di hlokago.

src_text: "i received three vouchers totalling r19 000. a voucher for r12 000 to buy layer egg chickens, a voucher for r6 500 to buy feed and a r500 voucher to buy medicines.
tgt_text: suduka o bolela gore di baotšhara di tla mo thuša go godiša lehlakore la kgwebo ya gagwe la go tšweletša mae.

src_text: "she started her egg production farm by feeding her family’s traditional chickens with layer grower feed, which enables them to produce eggs without mating.
tgt_text: "ke amogetše dibaotšhara tše tharo tša go bitša r19 000. tšona ke baotšhara ya r12 000 go reka dikgogo tša go bea mae tse 100, baotšhara ya r6 500 ya go reka dijo tša dikgogo le baotšhara ya r500 ya go reka meryana.

src_text: her chickens now produce 50 eggs a day, which she sells weekly.
tgt_text: "o thomile polasa ya gagwe ya go tšweletša dikgogo ka go fepa dikgogo tša gae tša lapa la gabo ka dijo tša go di thwathwadiša mae, tšeo di di kgontšhago gore di thwathwatše mae ntle le gore di namelane.

src_text: suduka, who also farms with 73 goats, 25 sheep and 25 cows, started farming in 2015 after obtaining a public management n6 certificate from ikhala training and vocational education and training college.
tgt_text: dikgogo tša gagwe gabjale di tšweletša mae a 50 ka letšatši, gomme yena o wa rekiša beke ka beke.

src_text: after realising that there were not a lot of job opportunities out there, she decided to take over the family’s then subsistence farm and turn it into a profitable business.
tgt_text: suduka, yo le yena a tsenetšego tša temo ka dipudi tše 73, dinku tše 25 le dikgomo tše 25 o thomile tša temo ka 2015 morago ga go ikhweletša sethifikeithi sa n6 sa taolo ya mmušo go tšwa kholetšeng ya ikhala ya thutatiro le ya tlhahlo.

src_text: suduka says: "we grew up practising farming, so after graduating i decided to farm rather than look for a job."
tgt_text: morago ga go lemoga gore mešomo ga e kaalo, a tšea sephetho sa go tšea polasa yeo ka nako yeo e bego e dirišwa ke lapa la gabo go iphediša a e fetošetša go ba kgwebo ya go dira letseno.

src_text: this proved to be an inspired decision, as she has grown the number of goats and cows.
tgt_text: suduka ge a bolela o re: "re gotše re dira tša temo, ke moka morago ga go aloga ke tšeere sephetho sa go tsenela temo legatong la go inyakela mošomo."

src_text: suduka’s sixhectare vegetable farm produces maize, potatoes, peas and beans.
tgt_text: se se ile sa hlatsela go ba sephetho sa hlohleletšo, kudu ka ge a godišitše dipudi le dikgomo tša palo ya go bonagala.

src_text: the maize is planted on four hectares, the potatoes on one hectare and the peas and beans share the last hectare.
tgt_text: polasa ya suduka ya di hektara tše tshela ka bogolo e tšweletša mafela, matapola, dierekise le dinawa.

src_text: suduka has learnt a lot from covid19, especially that her best assets are her hands and hard work.
tgt_text: mafela a bjalwa dihektareng tše nne, matapola a bjalwa hektareng ye tee mola dierekisi le dinawa di bjalwa mo hektareng ya mafelelo.

src_text: tips on how to start a garden: make sure you know which plants your soil will support.
tgt_text: suduka o ithutile tše ntši go tšwa go covid19 , kuduku du ka gore thoto ye kaoneka one ke matsogo a gagwe le go šoma ga gagwe ka thata.

src_text: ready your garden by first ploughing the land more than once without planting.
tgt_text: molemi wa moswa o amogela thekgo ya covid19 silusapho nyanda molemi yo a sa thomago tša temo wa kua kapa bohlabela ke yo mongwe wa bao ba holegilego go tšwa sekhwameng sa mmušo sa kimollo ya coronavirus.

src_text: south africa acts to address ventilator shortage silusapho nyanda a locally developed ventilator will help patients with mild covid19 symptoms to breathe easier.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e tšea kgato ya go rarolla bothata bja tlhokego ya dithušagohema silusapho nyanda sethušagohema seo se dirilwego ka mo afrika borwa se tla thuša balwetši bao ba nago le dika tša magareng tša covid19 gore ba heme gabonolo.

src_text: the fight against the coronavirus disease (covid19) in south africa has been boosted with the production of the first ventilator made in the country.
tgt_text: ntwa kgahlanong le bolwetši bja coronavirus (covid19) ka afrika borwa e matlafaditšwe ke sethušagohema sa mathomo seo se dirilwego ka mo nageng.

src_text: the continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) ventilator helps patients with mild symptoms of covid19 to breathe easier by providing a mild level of oxygenated air pressure to keep their airways open.
tgt_text: sethušagohema sa continuous positive airway pressure (cpap) se thuša balwetši bao ba nago le dika tša magareng tša covid19 gore ba kgone go hema gabonolo ka go ba fa moya wa oksetšene gore o dire gore meelamoya ya bona e dule e bulegile.

src_text: the ventilator was designed by the council for scientific and industrial research (csir) in collaboration with a number of local partners and will be rolled out nationwide to patients showing respiratory distress in the early phase of covid19 infection.
tgt_text: sethušagohema se hlamilwe ke ba council for scientific and industrial research (csir) ka tšhomišano le e tšwelapele letlakaleng la 2o boloke afrika borwammogo re ka fenya coronaviruso bolokeg batšeakarolo ba se bakae ba mo gae, gomme e tla abelwa balwetši go phatlalala le naga bao ba nago le mathata a go hema mo legatong la mathomo la phetelo ya covid19.

src_text: "the air a person normally breaths has a 23 percent concentration of oxygen.
tgt_text: "moya woo motho ao hemago o na le dipersente tše 23 tša oksetšene.

src_text: the cpap ventilator can pump a higher amount of oxygen, helping a person breathe.
tgt_text: sethušagohema sa cpap se kgona go pompa oksetšene e ntšhi, gomme ya thuša motho go hema.

src_text: the cpap pumps continuous concentrated oxygen.
tgt_text: cpap e pompa oksetšene e sa emiše.

src_text: you can increase or decrease the amount of oxygen one is breathing in," says executive manager of csir future production: manufacturing martin sanne.
tgt_text: o ka oketša goba wa fokotša bontšhi bja oksetšene yeo motho a e hemago," gwa realo molaodiphethiši wa csir future production: manufacturing, elego martin sanne.

src_text: patients using the ventilator are connected via a face mask.
tgt_text: balwetši bao ba šomišago sethušagohema ba se lokelwa maskeng woo ba tla bego ba o apere oksetšene e gogwa go tšwa tankeng ya kgase gomme ya hlakantšhwa le moya wa tlhago ka gare ga sethušagohema, gomme go tloga moo o romelwa maskeng gomme wa hemelwa ka gare ke molwetši.

src_text: oxygen is drawn from an oxygen gas tank and is mixed with natural air in the ventilator, from where it is transmitted to the mask and breathed in by the patient.
tgt_text: sanne o bolela gore godimo ga go pompa moya wa go ba le oksetšene, cpap e thuša gape balwetši gore ba hemele ka ntle.

src_text: sanne says that in addition to pumping oxygenated air, the cpap also helps patients exhale.
tgt_text: sedirišwa sa cpap se ka šomišwa mafelong a tša maphelo a theknolotši ya godimo gape le ka mafelong a nakwana a bjalo ka maokelo a nakwana le mafelo a boipeelothoko.

src_text: the cpap device can be used in both hightech clinical environments and temporary settings, such as field hospitals and quarantine facilities.
tgt_text: sanne a re csir e tla be e kgonne go dira dithušagohema tše 10 000 ge kgwedi ya phato e fihla mafelelong.

src_text: sanne says the csir will have produced 10 000 ventilators by the end of august.
tgt_text: ka tšhomišano le siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya le yunibesithi ya cape town, csir e tšweleditše cpap go ya le ka melawana ya mokgatlo wa lefase wa tša maphelo.

src_text: working with siemens, simera, akacia, gabler, umoya and the university of cape town, the csir produced the cpap according to world health organisation standards.
tgt_text: dithušagohema tša mathomo di tla fiwa maokelo a mmušo ao a lego bothateng bja tlhokego ya didirišwa tša go lwantšhana le covid19.

src_text: the first batch of ventilators will be given to state hospitals experiencing pressure due to the unavailability of equipment to deal with covid19.
tgt_text: csir e thomile go šomana le cpap morago ga gore lefase le itemogele tlhokego ye kgolo ya dithušagohema.

src_text: the csir started working on the cpap after the world began experiencing an extreme shortage in ventilators.
tgt_text: "dikgweding tša hlakola le moranang go bile le tlhokego ya dithušagohema go tšwa go baabi ba tšona ba boditšhabatšhaba.

src_text: "around march and april, there suddenly became a short supply of ventilators from our international suppliers.
tgt_text: moo di bego di hwetšagala gona di be di bitša kudu, gomme ke moo mmušo o ntšhitšego thentara ya go dira dithušagohema," gwa realo sanne.

src_text: where you could get them, they were very expensive so government issued a tender for the production of ventilators," says sanne.
tgt_text: thentara yeo e be e le karolo ya protšeke ya bosetšhaba ya dithušagohema ya ka lefapheng la tša kgwebo, intaseteri le phadišano.

src_text: the tender was part of the government’s national ventilator project within the department of trade, industry and competition.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e tšea kgato ya go rarolla bothata bja tlhokego ya dithušagohema silusapho nyanda sethušagohema seo se dirilwego ka mo afrika borwa se tla thuša balwetši bao ba nago le dika tša magareng tša covid19 gore ba heme gabonolo.

src_text: help stop the spread of covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed our nation is con fronted by the gravest crisis in the history of our democracy.
tgt_text: thuša go emiša go phatlalala ga covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed setšhaba sa gaborena se lebagane le bothata bjo bogolo historing ya temokrasi ya rena.

src_text: for more than 120 days, we have succeeded in delaying the spread of a virus that is causing devastation across the globe.
tgt_text: mo matšatšing a go feta a 120, re atlegile go diteleng go phatlalala ga baerase yeo e hlolago masetlapelo lefaseng ka bophara.

src_text: but now, the surge in infections that we had been advised by our medical experts would come, has arrived.
tgt_text: efela gabjale go keka ga diphetetšo, fao re kilego ra eletšwa ke ditsebi tša bongaka gore go tlo ba gona, go fihlile.

src_text: more than a quarter of a million south africans have been infected with coronavirus, and we know that many more infections have gone undetected.
tgt_text: palo ya go feta kotara ya milione ya maafrika borwa e fetetšwe ke coronavirus, gomme ebile re a tseba gore diphetetšo tše dintšhi di iphihlile.

src_text: we are now recording over 12,000 new cases every day.
tgt_text: gabjale go netefatšwa diphetetšo tše diswa tša go feta 12 000 tšatši le lengwe le le lengwe.

src_text: since the start of the outbreak in march, at least 4,079 people have died from covid19.
tgt_text: esale go tloga mola bolwetši bjo bo phulegago ka kgwedi ya hlakola, go hlokofetše batho ba 4 079 ba bolawa ke covid19.

src_text: like the massive cold fronts that sweep into our country from the south atlantic at this time of year, there are few parts of the country that will remain untouched by the coronavirus.
tgt_text: bjalo ka maphoto a magolo a go tonya ao a budulelago ka nageng ya rena go tšwa ka lewatleng la south atlantic mo nakong ye ya ngwaga, go na le dikarolo di se kae tša ka mo nageng tšeo di ka se fihlelelwego ke coronavirus.

src_text: the coronavirus storm is far fiercer and more destructive than any we have known before.
tgt_text: coronaviruse kotsi le go ba šoro kudu go feta efe goba efe yeo e kilego ya ba gona.

src_text: it is stretching our resources and our resolve to their limits.
tgt_text: e tloga e tlaralatša mošomo wa didirišwa tša rena le maikemišetšo ka go fetišiša.

src_text: the surge of infections that our experts and scientists predicted over 3 months ago has now arrived.
tgt_text: go keka ga diphetetšo, elego seo se akantšwego ke ditsebi le boramahlale ba borena kgweding tše tharo tšeo di fetilego, go fihlile.

src_text: it started in the western cape and is now underway in the eastern cape and gauteng.
tgt_text: go thomile ka kapa bodikela gomme gabjale go tsene ka kapa bohlabela le ka gauteng.

src_text: yet, while infections rise exponentially, it is important to note that our case fatality rate of 1.5 percent is among the lowest in the world.
tgt_text: le ge go le bjalo, ge diphetetšo di golela godimo ka lebelo, go bohlokwa go lemoga gore palo ya mahu ya dipersente tše 1.5 ke ye nngwe ya dipalo tša fasefase lefaseng ge e bapetšwa le ya lefase ya dipersente tše 4.4. go ba fasefase ga palo ya mahu ka nageng ya gaborena go hlotšwe ke maitemogelo le boikgafo bja bašomedi ba tša maphelo gape le magato a tšhoganetšo ao re a tšeerego go hlabolla mokgwa wa tša maphelo.

src_text: this is compared to a global average case fatality rate of 4.4 percent.
tgt_text: le ge bontšhi bja batho ba gaborena ba tšeere magato a go thibela phatlalalo ya baerase, go na le bao ba sego ba dira bjalo.

src_text: we owe the relatively low number of deaths in our country to the experience and dedication of our health professionals and the urgent measures we have taken to build the capacity of our health system.
tgt_text: go na le ba bangwe bao ba hlokomologago melawana yeo e fetišitšwego ya go lwantšhana le bolwetši bjo.

src_text: even as most of our people have taken action to prevent the spread of the virus, there are others who have not.
tgt_text: mo kgabagareng ya leuba le, go tsena ka gare ga thekisi o se wa apara maske, go kopana le bagwera, go ya meletlong goba gona go etela meloko, go ka phatlalatša baerase gabonolo gomme gwa ba le go lobja ga maphelo.

src_text: there are some among us who ignore the regulations that have been passed to combat the disease.
tgt_text: bjo e ka no ba e le bolwetši bjoo bo hlolwago ke baerase, efela bo phatlalatšwa ke mekgwa le maitshwaro a batho.

src_text: in the midst of such a pandemic, getting into a taxi without a face mask, gathering to meet friends, attending parties or even visiting family, can too easily spread the virus and cost lives.
tgt_text: ka maitshwaro a rena – re le batho, malapa le ditšhaba – re ka kgona ebile re swanetše re fetole mokgwaphatlalalo wa leuba le ka mo nageng.

src_text: this may be a disease that is caused by a virus, but it is spread by human conduct and behaviour.
tgt_text: re swanetše re apare maske wa lešela woo o khupetšago nko le molomo nako ye nngwe le ye nngwe ge re e tšwa ka gae.

src_text: through our own actions – as individuals, as families, as communities – we can and we must change the course of this pandemic in our country.
tgt_text: re swanetše re tšwele pele go hlapa diatla ka meetse le sesepe goba sebolayaditwatši ka mehla.

src_text: we need to wear a cloth mask that covers our nose and mouth whenever we leave home.
tgt_text: re swanetše re tšwele pele go hlwekiša le go bolaya ditwatši mabatong ka moka a mafelo a bohle.

src_text: we must continue to regularly wash our hands with soap and water or sanitiser.
tgt_text: sa bohlokwa le go feta ke gore re swanetše re bule sekgoba sa dimitara tše pedi gare ga rena le batho ba bangwe.

src_text: we must continue to clean and sanitise all surfaces in all public spaces.
tgt_text: gabjale go na le bohlatse bjoo bo tšwelelago bja gore baerase ye e ka kgona le go fofa moyeng mo mafelong ao a tletšego batho ba bantšhi, ao a tswalegilego goba ao ka go ona moya o sa sepelego botse.

src_text: most importantly, we must keep a safe distance – of at least 2 metres – from other people.
tgt_text: ka lona lebaka le, re swanetše re hlabolle mafelo a setšhaba ao a tswalegilego ka pelapela, elego fao kotsi ya go fetelwa e lego godimo kudu.

src_text: there is now emerging evidence that the virus may also be carried in tiny particles in the air in places that are crowded, closed or have poor air circulation.
tgt_text: sephetho sa rena sa go tla ka kiletšo ya mosepelo ya bosetšhaba se thibetše phatlalalo ya diphetetšo mathomong ge ditirelo tša maphelo di be di se tša itokiša, elego seo se ka bego se hlotše tobo ye kgolo ya maphelo.

src_text: for this reason we must immediately improve the indoor environment of public places where the risk of infection is greatest.
tgt_text: ka nako yeo re bilego le yona, re tšeere magato a bohlokwa go matlafatša mekgwa ya go ikarabela ya tša maphelo.

src_text: our decision to declare a nationwide lockdown prevented a massive early surge of infections when our health services were less prepared, which would have resulted in a far greater loss of lives.
tgt_text: re šetše re dirile diteko tša coronavirus tša go feta dimilione tše pedi, gomme bašomedi ba tša maphelo ba šetše ba dirile diponego tša go feta dimilione tše 20. re dirile gore go be le mepete e 28 000 ya balwetši ba covid19 ka maokelong, gomme ebile re agile maokelo a nakwana go kgabaganya naga.

src_text: in the time that we had, we have taken important measures to strengthen our health response.
tgt_text: gabjale re na le mepete e 37 000 ya boipeelothoko mafelong a poraebete le a setšhaba go kgabaganya naga, gomme a itokišeditše go amogela bao ba sa kgonego go ipeela thoko ka magae.

src_text: we have conducted more than two million coronavirus tests and community health workers have done more than 20 million screenings.
tgt_text: re rekile le go aba dimilione tša didirišwa tša go itšhireletša maokelong, dikliniking le dikolong go kgabaganya naga, e lego tša go šireletša bašomedi bao ba šomago ka batho ba bantšhi.

src_text: we have made available almost 28,000 hospital beds for covid19 patients and have constructed functional field hospitals across the country.
tgt_text: re thwetše ebile re sa thwala baoki, dingaka le bašomedi ba tša tšhoganetšo ba tlaleletšo.

src_text: we now have over 37,000 quarantine beds in private and public facilities across the country, ready to isolate those who cannot do so at home.
tgt_text: re tšwela pele go ba le tšwelopele mo maitekelong a rena a go lwantšha covid19, efela tlhotlo ye kgolo e sa etla.

src_text: we have procured and delivered millions of items of personal protective equipment to hospitals, clinics and schools across the country to protect our frontline workers.
tgt_text: re šoma go kgabaganya diprofense go oketša palo ya mepete ya ka diwateng le ka tlhokomelong yeo e tseneletšego re direla balwetši ba covid19.

src_text: we have recruited and continue to recruit additional nurses, doctors and emergency health personnel.
tgt_text: sekgoba se a bulwa ka maokelong a mmalwa ka go se amogele balwetši bao ba sa hlokego thušo ya tšhoganetšo.

src_text: we continue to make progress in our efforts to deal with covid 19, but our greatest challenge still lies ahead.
tgt_text: go fetolwa gape le mafelo a mangwe ka maokelong go ba diwate tša tlaleletšo, gape le go agwa goba go oketšwa ga maokelo a nakwana.

src_text: across all provinces, we are working to further increase the number of general ward and critical beds available for covid19 patients.
tgt_text: re šoma go oketša kabo ya oksetšene, dithušagohema le didirišwa tše dingwe bakeng sa bao ba tlo hlokago tlhokomelo yeo e tseneletšego, go balwa le kabo ya oksetšene bakeng sa mabaka a mangwe.

src_text: ward capacity is being freed up in a number of hospitals by delaying nonurgent care, the conversion of some areas of hospitals into additional ward space and the erection or expansion of field hospitals.
tgt_text: re diriša ditheknolotši tša titšithale go matlafatša taetšo, go nyakana gape le go beela thoko balwetši, le go thekga bao diteko tša bona di laetšago ba fetetšwe.

src_text: we are working to increase supplies of oxygen, ventilators and other equipment for those who will need critical care, including by diverting the supply of oxygen from other purposes.
tgt_text: bjale ka ge re lebile sehloeng sa diphetetšo, re hloka go ba le tlhokomelo ye kgolo le go thatafatša magato ao a latelwago gabjale go fokotša lebelo la diphetetšo.

src_text: we are deploying digital technologies to strengthen the identification, tracing and isolation of contacts, and to provide support to those who test positive.
tgt_text: melawana ya mabapi le go apara dimaske e tla thatafatšwa.

src_text: as we now approach the peak of infections, we need to take extra precautions and tighten existing measures to slow down the rate of transmission.
tgt_text: bengmešomo, bengmabenkele le balaodi, baotledi ba dinamelwa tša bohle, gape le balaodi le beng ba meago efe goba efe ya setšhaba, gabjale ba tlamegile semolao go netefatša gore yo mongwe le yo mongwe yoo a tsenago ka moagong goba ka senamelweng sa bona o swanetše go ba a apere maske.

src_text: regulations on the wearing of masks will be strengthened.
tgt_text: dithekisi tšeo di tšeago maeto a kgauswi di a dumelelwa go rwala go fihlela dipersenteng tše lekgolo, mola tša maeto a matelele di se tša dumelelwa go feta dipersente tše masomešupa, gomme gona fao go latelwe melawana e meswa ya mabapi le dimaske, go bolaya ditwatši ka dinamelweng gape le go bula mafasetere.

src_text: employers, shop owners and managers, public transport operators, and managers and owners of any other public building are now legally obliged to ensure that anyone entering their premises or vehicle must be wearing a mask.
tgt_text: gabjale go na le bohlatse bjoo bo tletšego bja gore thekišo ya dinotagi e hlotše kgatelelo ye kgolo go maokelo, go akaretšwa le ka diyuniting tša maemo a tšhoganetšo le tša tlhokomelo yabao ba bakwago le badimo ka baka la dikotsi tša difatanaga, dikgaruru le mathata a go sepelelana le tšona.

src_text: taxis undertaking local trips will now be permitted to increase their capacity to 100 percent, while long distance taxis will not be allowed to exceed 70 percent occupancy, on condition that new risk mitigation protocols related to masks, vehicle sanitising and open windows are followed.
tgt_text: ka fao, re tšeere sephetho sa gore, go re re kgone go lota sekgoba seo se šetšego se le gona ka maokelong, gona thekišo, kabo le phatlalatšo ya dinotagi e tla fegwa go tloga gonabjalebjale.

src_text: there is now clear evidence that the resumption of alcohol sales has resulted in substantial pressure being put on hospitals, including trauma and icu units, due to motor vehicle accidents, violence and related trauma.
tgt_text: bjalo ka legato la tlaleletšo la go fokotša tlalelo ya maokelo, ga go na motho yoo a swanetšego go ba ka ntle mebileng go tloga ka iri ya senyane bošego go fihla ka iri ya bone ka masa.

src_text: we have therefore decided that in order to conserve hospital capacity, the sale, dispensing and distribution of alcohol will be suspended with immediate effect.
tgt_text: re tšea magato a re tseba gabotse gore ga a amogelege ebile a bea mapheko maphelong a batho, efela a swanetše gore a tšewe gore re kgone go feta sehloa sa bolwetši.

src_text: as an additional measure to reduce the pressure on hospitals, a curfew will be put in place between the hours of 9pm and 4am.
tgt_text: ga go na ka mokgwa woo re ka efogago lephoto la coronavirus, efela re ka kgona go fokotša tshenyo yeo le ka e hlolago maphelong a rena.

src_text: we are taking these measures fully aware that they impose unwelcome restrictions on people’s lives.
tgt_text: bjalo ka setšhaba, re a thekgana, re thekga le bao ba lwalago ebile re hlohleletša kamogelo ya batho bao ba phelago ka baerase ye.

src_text: they are, however, necessary to see us through the peak of the disease.
tgt_text: gabjale, le go feta peleng, re rwele maikarabelo a bao re phelago le bona.

src_text: there is no way that we can avoid the coronavirus storm.
tgt_text: re tla le fediša lephoto le.

src_text: but we can limit the damage that it can cause to our lives.
tgt_text: re tla bušetša naga ya gaborena maemong a mabotse a maphelo, gomme ebile re tla ba le tšwelopele.

src_text: as a nation we have come together to support each other, to provide comfort to those who are ill and to promote acceptance of people living with the virus.
tgt_text: thuša go emiša go phatlalala ga covid19 vukuzenzele unnamed setšhaba sa gaborena se lebagane le bothata bjo bogolo historing ya temokrasi ya rena.

src_text: celebrating women through economic inclusion vukuzenzele unnamed in august south africa celebrates women’s month.
tgt_text: go keteka basadi ka go ba go keteka basadi ka go ba akaretša ekonomingakaretša ekonoming vukuzenzele unnamed ka phato afrika borwa e keteka kgwedi ya basadi.

src_text: this occasion marks the anniversary of the day in 1956 when 20,000 women marched to the union buildings – a great sea of womankind speaking many languages, from different places and of all races.
tgt_text: tiragalo ye e dira matswalo a letšatši ka 1956 ge basadi ba 20 000 ba matšhetša union buildings – basadi ba bantši ba go bolela malema a go fapana, go tšwa mafelong a go fapana gomme ba mehlobo ka moka.

src_text: they were united in their demand for an end to the dreaded pass laws and for their right to live in freedom.
tgt_text: ba be ba kopane ka senyakwa sa bona sa go fediša melao ya dipasa le tokelo ya bona ya go phela ka tokologo.

src_text: the status and position of women in south africa today is vastly different to that faced by our mothers and grandmothers in 1956. we have come a long way in realising a south africa that is nonracial, nonsexist, democratic, prosperous and free.
tgt_text: maemo le kemo ya basadi ka afrika borwa lehono a fapana kudu le ao bommago rena le bokoko a rena ba bego ba phela ka fase ga wona ka 1956. re tšwa kgole gore re be le afrika borwa ya go hloka semorafe, ya go hloka kgethologanyo ya bong, ya go huma gape yeo e lokologilego.

src_text: there has been real progress in improving the lives of south african women in the economy, in the political sphere and in public life.
tgt_text: go bile le tšwelopele kudu mo go kaonafatšeng maphelo a basadi ba afrika borwa go ekonomi, lekala la dipolotiki le go bophelo bja setšhaba.

src_text: at the same time, we know there is so much further we still have to go.
tgt_text: go le bjalo, re a tseba gore re sa ya kgole.

src_text: women still face discrimination, harassment and violence, and bear the greatest brunt of poverty.
tgt_text: basadi ba sa lebane le kgethollo, tlhorišo le dikgaruru, gomme ba sa phela ka bohloki.

src_text: if we are to truly realise the promise of our constitution we have to tackle the economic and financial exclusion that makes women more vulnerable to abuse and violence.
tgt_text: ge e le gore ka nnete re nyaka go diragatša tshepišo ya molaotheo wa rena re swanetše go lwantšha dikgato tse di dirago gore basadi ba se be le letseno le tšhelete moo go dirago gore ba ikhwetše ba kgotleletše go hlorišwa le go bethwa.

src_text: we have joined a groundbreaking campaign that links us to global efforts to achieve gender equality by 2030. generation equality is an ambitious and transformative agenda to end discrimination and violence against women and for their equal participation in political, social and economic life.
tgt_text: re tsenetše lesolo la go ribolla leswika leo le re amantšhago le maitapišo a lefase a go fihlelela tekatekano ya bong ka 2030. tekatekano ya meloko ke agenda ya tlhohleletšo le phetogo go fediša kgethollo le dikgaruru kgahlanong le basadi le bana le go kgatha tema ka go lekana bophelong bja dipolotiki, leago le ekonomi.

src_text: as part of this campaign, we have joined two ‘action coalitions’, one for economic justice and rights and another against genderbased violence.
tgt_text: bjalo ka karolo ya lesolo le, re kopantše ‘ditirišano tša twantšho’ tše pedi, yenngwe ke ya toka le ditokelo tša ekonomi ge ye nngwe e le ya kgahlanong le dikgaruru tše di ekadilego ka bong.

src_text: both of these themes are critical to our own national agenda.
tgt_text: bobedi ditabakgolo tše di bohlokwa go agenda ya rena ya bosetšhaba.

src_text: eleven months since the emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide was implemented we have made progress in expanding support and care to survivors, and progress is being made in legal reforms to afford them greater protection.
tgt_text: dikgwedi tše 11 go tloga mola leano la twantšho la go arabela la tšhoganetšo go lwantšha dikgaruru tšeo di ikadilego ka bong le dipolao tša basadi (gbvf) ke banna le phethagatšwago go bonagetše tšwelopele go godiša thekgo le tlhokomelo ya bao ba phologilego, gomme go na le tšwelopele go kaonafatšeng molao go ba fa tšhireletšo ye kgolo.

src_text: during the month of august, we begin the implementation of the national strategic plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide.
tgt_text: mo kgweding ya phato, re thoma ka phethagatšo ya leano la peakanyo la bosetšhaba go lwantšha gbvf ke banna.

src_text: a key aspect of the plan is on ensuring greater women’s financial inclusion.
tgt_text: ntlha ya bohlokwa ya leano le ke go kgonthiša gore basadi ba bantši ba fiwa kudu menyetla mo ditšheleteng.

src_text: this is because economic inequality and social inequality are interconnected.
tgt_text: se ke ka gore go se lekalekane ga ekonomi le go se lekalekane ga leago go a sepelelana.

src_text: the economic status of women in south africa makes them more vulnerable to abuse.
tgt_text: maemo a basadi ka afrika borwa a ba dira gore ba be kotsing ya go hlorišwa.

src_text: we must therefore scale up support for women to enable them to become financially independent.
tgt_text: re swanetše go oketša thekgo ya basadi go ba kgontšha gore ba itirele tšhelete ya bona.

src_text: we have made a number of commitments under generation equality that will be given effect to through the national strategic plan.
tgt_text: re dirile maikgafo a mmalwa ka fase ga tekatekano ya moloko yeo e tla tšweletšago dipoelo ka leano la peakanyo ya bosetšhaba.

src_text: firstly, we are going to drive women’s economic inclusion through public procurement.
tgt_text: sa mathomo, re ya go tsentšha basadi mererong ya ekonomi ka go ba abela dithendara.

src_text: we have set the target of ensuring that at least 40 percent of goods and services procured by public entities are sourced from womenowned businesses.
tgt_text: re beile selebanywa sa go kgonthiša gore bonnyane dithoto le ditirelo tša go lekana 40% tšeo di rekilwego ke makala a setšhaba di tšwe dikgwebong tša basadi.

src_text: secondly, we are going to scale up support for womenowned smmes and for women who work in the informal sector or are unemployed.
tgt_text: sa bobedi, re ya go oketša thekgo go dismme tša basadi le go basadi bao ba nago le dikgwebo tša mo mebileng goba bao ba sa šomego.

src_text: this will include engagement with the financial sector to make financial services accessible and affordable for women.
tgt_text: se se tla akaretša go boledišana le makala a ditšhelete go dira gore ditirelo tša ditšhelete di fihlelelege le go rekega go basadi.

src_text: thirdly, we want to ensure more women have access to productive assets such as land.
tgt_text: sa boraro, re nyaka go kgonthiša gore basadi ba bantši ba na le dithoto tša bohlokwa go swana le naga.

src_text: it is essential that women are beneficiaries of the accelerate land reform programme.
tgt_text: go bohlokwa gore basadi e be baholegi ba lenaneo le potlakišitšwego la poelo ya mafase.

src_text: it is significant that of the r75 million in covid19 relief earmarked for farming input vouchers 53 percent of the beneficiaries will be rural women.
tgt_text: go bohlokwa gore go r75 milione ya diboutšhara tšeo di beetšwego kimollo ya covid19 ya kabo ya temo 53% ya baholegi e tla ba basadi ba magaeng.

src_text: we must ensure that women subsistence and smallscale farmers continue to receive support beyond the pandemic.
tgt_text: re swanetše go kgonthiša gore basadi ba balemi ba ka gae le ba bannyane ba tšwela pele go amogela thekgo ka morago ga leuba.

src_text: fourthly, we want to ensure that women are protected from genderbased violence in the workplace.
tgt_text: sa bone, re nyaka go kgonthiša gore basadi ba šireletšwa go dikgaruru tšeo di ikadilego ka bong mo mošomong.

src_text: in this regard, we will be working at a national and regional level towards the ratification of the ilo convention on violence and harassment in the workplace.
tgt_text: ka tsela yeo re tla ba re šoma legatong la bosetšhaba le la selete go tumelelano ya kopano ya ilo ka ga dikgaruru le tlhorišo mošomong.

src_text: it is said that freedom is not given, but taken.
tgt_text: go thwe tokologo ga e fiwe, eupša e a tšewa.

src_text: the emancipation of women is only words on paper unless it is matched by commitment from all sectors of society.
tgt_text: tokologo ya basadi ke mantšu fela ao a lego letlakaleng ntle le ge e ka bapetšwa ke boikgafo go tšwa go makala ka moka a setšhaba.

src_text: as we prepare for the reconstruction of our economy in the wake of the coronavirus pandemic, we have said that we cannot simply return to where we were before the outbreak of the virus.
tgt_text: ge re beakanya kagolefsa ya ekonomi ya rena mo tlhohlong ya leuba la coronavirus , re rile re ka se boele moo re bego re le gona pele ga go phulega ga baerase.

src_text: we must build a fundamentally different economy which, among other things, substantially improves the material position of women.
tgt_text: re swanetše go aga ekonomi ye bohlokwa ya go fapana le yeo re bego re na le yona yeo, gare ga dilo tše dingwe, e kaonafatšago maemo a bohlokwa a basadi.

src_text: this means that our investment in infrastructure must support not only the development of local industry, but also womenowned businesses.
tgt_text: se se ra gore peeletšo ya rena ka mananeokgoparara ga se ya swanela go thekga fela kaonafatšo ya diintasteri tša gae, eupša le dikgwebo tša basadi.

src_text: it must deliberately create employment opportunities for women in all stages of planning, financing, building and maintaining infrastructure.
tgt_text: e swanetše go hlola dibaka tša mešomo mo magatong ka moka a peakanyo, go thekga ka ditšhelete, go aga le go hlokomela mananeokgoparara.

src_text: by the same measures, as we scale up our public employment programmes, we must ensure that young women in particular are identified as participants.
tgt_text: ka tekanyo ya go swana ge re oketša thekgo ya mananeo a mešomo ya setšhaba, re swanetše go kgonthiša gore makgarebe kudu ba swanetše go ba bakgathatema.

src_text: in addition to an income, these programmes will provide them with an opportunity to acquire some of the skills and experience necessary to enter the mainstream economy.
tgt_text: godimo ga go hwetša letseno, mananeo a a tla ba fa sebaka go hwetša mabokgoni a mangwe le maitemogelo ao a hlokegago go kgatha tema ekonoming ye kgolo.

src_text: as much as it is government’s responsibility to provide economic opportunities for women and create an enabling framework for advancing gender equality, everyone in society needs to play their part.
tgt_text: le ge e le maikarabelo a mmušo go aba dibaka tša ekonomi go basadi le go hlola tlhako ya go kgontšha go tšwetša pele tekatekano ya bong, mang le mang mo setšhabeng o swanetše go kgatha tema ya gagwe.

src_text: businesses must support womenowned enterprises in the procurement of goods and services.
tgt_text: dikgwebo di swanetše go thekga dikgwebo tša basadi ka go reka mo go tšona dithoto le ditirelo.

src_text: they should employ more women and appoint more women to management positions.
tgt_text: di swanetše go thwala basadi ba bantši gomme ba thwale basadi ba bantši maemong a bolaodi.

src_text: this is all the more important considering that the private sector’s record on genderrepresentation at management level lags behind that of the public sector.
tgt_text: se se bohlokwa kudu go lebeletšwe gore rekoto ya lekala la praebete mo go kemedi ya bong legatong la taolo e šaletše morago go ya lekala la setšhaba.

src_text: this is an issue that is repeatedly raised in engagements i have had with a number of women’s business organisations.
tgt_text: ye ke taba yeo e tšweletšwago gantši mo dipoledišanong tšeo ke bilego le tšona le mekgatlo ye mmalwa ya dikgwebo tša basadi.

src_text: by equal measure, we must eliminate gender disparities in pay for men and women, and give effect to the principle of equal pay for equal work contained in the employment equity act.
tgt_text: gore re be le tekatekano re swanetše go fediša setlwaedi sa megolo ya go se lekane go ya ka gore motho ke monna goba mosadi gomme re lefa batho ba ba dirilego mošomo wa go swana ka go lekana go ya ka molao wa tekatekano ya mošomo.

src_text: women must also be protected from harassment and discrimination in the workplace.
tgt_text: basadi ba swanetšwe go šireletšwa go tlhorišo le kgethologanyo mošomong.

src_text: it is up to transport operators, university administrators, school governing bodies and religious organisations to create conditions for women and girls to travel, study and worship in safety.
tgt_text: ke maikarabelo a basepediši ba dinamelwa, balaodi ba diyunibesithi, makgotlataolo a dikolo le mekgatlo ya sedumedi go hlola maemo a a bolokegilego go basadi le basetsana go ka tšea maeto, go ya dikolong le go ya dikerekeng.

src_text: we must forge ahead with our efforts to eradicate chauvinism, sexism and patriarchy.
tgt_text: re swanetše go tšwela pele ka maitapišo a rena a go fediša go nyatšwa ga basadi ke banna, kgethollo ya basadi ke banna le go dira banna dihlogo.

src_text: it is these attitudes that enable the oppression of women.
tgt_text: ke mekgwa ye yeo e dirago gore go be le kgatelelo ya basadi.

src_text: it is up to us – both men and women – to affirm that a woman’s value, position and opinions are no less than that of a man.
tgt_text: go tšwa go rena – bobedi banna le basadi – go kgonthiša gore mohola wa mosadi, maemo le dikgopolo ga di fetwe ke tša monna.

src_text: it is up to us as parents and grandparents to treat and raise our sons and our daughters the same.
tgt_text: ke maikarabelo a rena bjalo ka batswadi le bokoko le borakgolo go swara le go godiša barwa le barwedi ba rena go swana.

src_text: it is up to us as men to reject and speak out against genderbased violence wherever we see it, even if it is against our friends, fathers or brothers.
tgt_text: go tšwa go rena bjalo ka banna go gana le go bolela kgahlanong le ditiragalo tša gbv ge re di bona, le ge e le gore di dirwa ke bagwera ba rena, bopapa ba rena goba bobuti ba rena.

src_text: let us be the generation that ends the oppression of women in all its forms, in our lifetime.
tgt_text: a re beng moloko woo o fedišago kgatelelo ya basadi ka mekgwa ya yona ka moka, mo maphelong a rena.

src_text: the brave generation of 1956 marched for us all.
tgt_text: moloko wa bagale wa 1956 o matšheditše rena ka moka.

src_text: we owe it to them, to ourselves and to future generations to not betray this noble legacy.
tgt_text: go keteka basadi ka go ba go keteka basadi ka go ba akaretša ekonomingakaretša ekonoming vukuzenzele unnamed ka phato afrika borwa e keteka kgwedi ya basadi.

src_text: back to work after covid19 a full guide allison cooper when can you return to work if you have tested positive for the coronavirus (covid19)?
tgt_text: go boela mošomong ka morago ga go kaonafala bolwetšing bja covid19 allison cooper naa o ka boela mošo mong neng ge o fe tetšwe ke coronavirus (covid19)?

src_text: the national institute for communicable diseases has the answers you need.
tgt_text: institute ya bosetšhaba ya malwetši a go fetela e na le dikarabo tšeo o di hlokago.

src_text: when i test positive for covid19, how long do i have to stay in isolation?
tgt_text: ge ke fetetšwe ke ge ke fetetšwe ke covid19covid19 , , ke swanetše go dula nako ye ke swanetše go dula nako ye kaakang ke ipeetše thoko?

src_text: people who test positive for covid19, but don’t have any symptoms, must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day they receive their positive test result.
tgt_text: kaakang ke ipeetše thoko?

src_text: those who have mild symptoms must remain in isolation at home or in a government isolation facility for 10 days, from the day their symptoms start.
tgt_text: batho bao ba fetetšwego ke covid19 , eupša ba se na maswao, ba swanetše go ipeela thoko ka gae goba ka lefelong la mmušo leo le diretšwego go hlokomela bao ba fetetšwego ke baerase lebaka la matšatši a 10, go tloga ka letšatši leo ba amogelago dipoelo tša gore ba fetetšwe ke baerase.

src_text: those who have severe disease, who have to go to hospital, must remain in isolation for 10 days, from when they are stable and don’t need oxygen anymore.
tgt_text: bao ba nago le maswao a mannyane ba swanetše go ipeela thoko ka gae goba ka lefelong la mmušo leo le diretšwego go hlokomela bao ba fetetšwego ke baerase lebaka la matšatši a 10, go tloga ka letšatši leo maswao a bona a thomilego.

src_text: how can a covid19 positive people transfer the disease to others?
tgt_text: bao ba nago le maswao a mašoro, bao ba swanelago go ya bookelong, ba swanetše go ipeela thoko matšatši a 10, go tloga ge ba le kaone ba se sa nyaka oksetšene.

src_text: according to health minister zweli mkhize, most people who have a mild infection can spread the virus for between seven to 12 days.
tgt_text: naa batho bao ba fetetšwego ke naa batho bao ba fetetšwego ke covid19covid19 ba ka fetetša bolweba ka fetetša bolwetši go batho ba bangwe bjang?

src_text: however, people who become very sick could be infectious and be able to transmit the virus to others for a longer period of time.
tgt_text: tši go batho ba bangwe bjang?

src_text: do i have to have another covid19 test, proving that i am negative, before i return to work?
tgt_text: go ya ka tona ya maphelo zweli mkhize, batho ba bantši bao ba nago le maswao a mannyane ba ka phatlalatša baerase nako ya gare ga matšatši a šupa le a 12. le ge go le bjalo, batho bao ba lwalago kudu ba ka fetetša ba bangwe gomme ba phatlalatša baerase go ba bangwe nako ye telele.

src_text: no.
tgt_text: naa ke swanetše go dira diteko naa ke swanetše go dira diteko tše dingwe tša tše dingwe tša covid19covid19 , tšeo , tšeo di bontšhago gore ga ke sa na di bontšhago gore ga ke sa na yona, pele ke boela mošomong?

src_text: retesting people who have experienced mild illness and have recovered is not recommended.
tgt_text: yona, pele ke boela mošomong?

src_text: a person is considered safe to return to work and come out of isolation if they are no longer infectious.
tgt_text: aowa.

src_text: this means they developed their first symptoms more than 10 days ago and have not had any symptoms for at least three days.
tgt_text: go dira diteko gape go batho bao ba itemogetšego maswao a mannyane gomme ba kaonafetše ga go bohlokwa.

src_text: in most cases, employees can return to work without testing again if: they have completed 10 days of mandatory quarantine or selfisolation.
tgt_text: motho o tšewa go ba a bolokegile go boela mošomong ge a feditše nako ya go ipeela thoko e bile a se sa hlwa a kgona go fetetša ba bangwe.

src_text: those who had moderate or severe symptoms undergo a medical evaluation.
tgt_text: seo se ra gore o bile le maswao a gagwe a mathomo matšatši a 10 a go feta gomme ga se a ba le maswao bonnyane matšatši a mararo.

src_text: they continue to practice personal hygiene and social distancing.
tgt_text: ka dinako tše dintši, bašomi ba ka boela mošomong ntle le go dira diteko gape: ba phethile matšatši a 10 a go beelwa thoko ga kgapeletšo goba go ipeela thoko.

src_text: the employer monitors the worker to ensure they do not regress.
tgt_text: bao ba bilego le maswao a magareng goba a mašoro ba ya tekolong ya kalafo.

src_text: they wear a mask, from the date of diagnosis for at least 21 days.
tgt_text: ba tšwela pele go hlapa le go se batamelane le batho ba bangwe.

src_text: i have tested negative but i still have symptoms.
tgt_text: bengmošomo ba lekola bašomi go kgonthiša gore ga ba boele morago.

src_text: what now?
tgt_text: ba apara sešira molomo le dinko, go tloga ka letšatši la phekolo sebaka se ka bago matšatši a 21. matšatši a 21. diteko di bontšhitše gore ga ke diteko di bontšhitše gore ga ke na bolwetši bjo eupša ke sa na na bolwetši bjo eupša ke sa na le maswao.

src_text: it is possible to get a false negative test result.
tgt_text: bjale go direga eng?

src_text: this means that your first test could be negative, but you could test positive at a later stage.
tgt_text: le maswao.

src_text: if you continue to have covid19 symptoms contact your healthcare professional.
tgt_text: bjale go direga eng?

src_text: what if i am still showing symptoms after 10 days?
tgt_text: go a kgonagala go hwetša dipoelo tšeo di fošagetšego tša gore ga o na bolwetši bjo.

src_text: it is common for patients to continue to have symptoms for longer than 10 days.
tgt_text: se se ra gore diteko tša mathomo di ka bontšha gore ga o na bolwetši bjo, eupša diteko tša ka morago di ka bontšha gore o na le bona.

src_text: full recovery may take several weeks.
tgt_text: ge o ka tšwela pele go ba le maswao a covid19 o ikgokaganye le setsebi sa tlhokomelo ya maphelo.

src_text: if you still have symptoms, seek advice from your healthcare professional.
tgt_text: naa go direga eng ge ke sa naa go direga eng ge ke sa bontšha maswao ka morago bontšha maswao ka morago ga matšatši a 10?

src_text: for more information about covid19, visit the national institute for communicable diseases’ website at www.
tgt_text: ga matšatši a 10?

src_text: nicd.
tgt_text: go tlwaelegile gore balwetši ba tšwele pele go ba le maswao go feta matšatši a 10. go kaonafala mo go feletšego go ka tšea dibeke tše mmalwa.

src_text: ac.
tgt_text: ge o sa na le maswao, nyaka maele go setsebi sa gago sa maphelo.

src_text: za, the covid19 free website at coronavirus.
tgt_text: go hwetša tshedimošo ka botlalo ka ga covid19 , eya wepsaeteng ya sehlongwa sa bosetšhaba sa malwetši a go fetela go www.

src_text: datafree.
tgt_text: nicd.

src_text: co, call the covid19 hotline number at 0800 029 999 or send a whatsapp to 0600 12 3456.
tgt_text: go boela mošomong ka morago ga go kaonafala bolwetšing bja covid19 allison cooper naa o ka boela mošo mong neng ge o fe tetšwe ke coronavirus (covid19)?

src_text: let’s keep each other safe vukuzenzele unnamed our country has moved to alert level 2 in our response to the coronavirus pandemic.
tgt_text: a re bolokegeng ka moka ga rena vukuzenzele unnamed naga ya gaborena e theošeditšwe go maemotemošo a bobedi mo magatong a rena a leuba la corona virus .

src_text: this has come as a relief to all south africans who have had to live under stringent restrictions for the last five months.
tgt_text: se se tlile bjalo ka kimollo go maafrika bo rwa ka moka bao ba ilego ba swanela ke go phela ka fase ga dikiletšo tše tiišeleditšwego letsogo dikgweding tše tlhano tša go feta.

src_text: it is a sign of the progress we are making in reducing new infections and demand on our health facilities.
tgt_text: maemo a ke taetšo ya kgatelopele yeo re e dirago go fokotša diphetelo tše diswa le tlalelo dinolofatšing tša rena tša maphelo.

src_text: it is also a very important development as we strive to restart our economy.
tgt_text: se sengwe ke gore ye ke kgatelopele ye bohlokwa kudu ge re le gare re kalokana le go thomiša ikonomi ya gaborena ka leswa.

src_text: but it is too soon to celebrate.
tgt_text: eupša e sale ka pela gore re ka keteka.

src_text: we are still very much in the middle of a deadly pandemic that has taken over 11,000 lives in south africa alone.
tgt_text: re sale ka gare ga leuba la go bolaya leo le tšeerego maphelo a 11 000 ka afrika borwa e le noši.

src_text: at more than half a million confirmed cases, we still have the fifth highest number of infections in the world.
tgt_text: ka diphe telo tšeo di netefaditšwego tša go feta seripa sa milione, re santše re nale palo ya godimodimo ya bohlano ya diphetelo lefaseng.

src_text: and there is always a chance of a resurgence of the disease.
tgt_text: e bile gape go nale kgonagalo ya go bowa gape ga bolwetši.

src_text: if we ever need a stark reminder of the need for vigilance, we should look to recent events thousands of kilometres away in new zealand.
tgt_text: ge eba re nyaka seo se ka re gopotšago gabotse ka bohlokwa ba go ntšha mahlo dinameng, re swanetše go lebelela ditiragalo tše hlagi lego malobanyana dikhilo mithara tše diketeteke kgole le rena go la new zealand.

src_text: three months since the country was declared coronavirusfree, new zealand is once again under lockdown.
tgt_text: dikgwedi tše tharo go tloga nakong ya ge naga yeo e tsebagaditšwe gore ga e na coronavirus , new zealand e tswaletše naga ka bophara gapegape.

src_text: although the latest outbreak was of relatively few cases, the government swiftly reimposed lockdown restrictions.
tgt_text: le ge e le gore go phulega ga diphetelo tšeo tša moragorago di be di se kaalo, mmušo o ile wa nanoga wa phethagatša gape dikiletšo tša go tswalelwa ga naga.

src_text: similar restrictions have had to be reimposed in several parts of europe as they experience a ‘second wave’ of infections.
tgt_text: dikiletšo tša go swana le tše di ile tša swanela ke go phethagatšwa ka leswa di karolong tše ntši tša yuropa ge naga ye e itemogela le photo la bobedi la diphetelo.

src_text: these experiences show just how swiftly things can change when it comes to covid19.
tgt_text: maitemogelo a a laetša ka fao dilo di ka fetogago ka lebelo ge go bolelwa ka covid19 .

src_text: it is a wakeup call to any among us who may harbour illusions that we are even close to seeing the end of this grave public health emergency.
tgt_text: se ke segopotšo go mang goba mang magareng ga rena yo a ka bego a na le kgopolo ye fošagetšego ya gore re kgauswi le go bona mafelelo a seemo sa mohuta wo se se mpe sa tšhoganyetšo maphelong a bohle.

src_text: certainly, there are signs of hope.
tgt_text: go ya nneteng, go nale dika tša go re tlišetša tshepho.

src_text: the number of new confirmed cases in south africa continues to decline.
tgt_text: palo ya diphetelo tše diswa tšeo di netefaditšwego mo afrika borwa e tšwelapele go theoga.

src_text: at the peak of the disease just one month ago, we were recording around 12,000 new cases a day.
tgt_text: nakong ya ge bolwetši bjo bo nyologetše godimodimo, re be re gatiša diphetelo tše diswa tša go balelwa 12 000 ka letšatši.

src_text: this has dropped to an average of around 5,000 a day over the past week.
tgt_text: palo ye e theogetše fase go fihla palogare ya go balelwa 5 000 ka letšatši bekeng ya go feta.

src_text: our recovery rate stands at 80 percent.
tgt_text: palo ya rena ya bao ba fodilego ke 80%.

src_text: as the country moves to alert level 2, many restrictions on social and economic activity have been lifted.
tgt_text: ge naga e theošetšwa go maemotemošo a bbedi, dikiletšo tše ntši ka ditira galo tša leago le tša ikonomi di fedišitšwe.

src_text: with this comes increased risk of transmission.
tgt_text: eupša se se tsamaišana le kotsi yeo e hlatlogilego ya diphetelo.

src_text: we now need to manage this risk and ensure the gains we have made thus far in containing the pandemic’s spread are not reversed.
tgt_text: go nyakega gore gabjale re laole kotsi ye le go netefatša gore diphenyo tšeo re di fihleletšego go fihla ka nako ye tša go bea phatlalalo ya leuba le ka fase ga taolo ga di bušetšwe morago.

src_text: the greatest threat to the health of nation right now is complacency.
tgt_text: kotsi ye kgolokgolo maphelong a setšhaba ka nako ye ke go iketla kudu.

src_text: it may be that we are now permitted to meet friends and family, to visit entertainment venues, to travel for leisure and to consume alcohol in restaurants, bars and taverns.
tgt_text: re a tseba gore gabjale re dumeletšwe go kopana le bagwera le ba malapa a rena, go etela mafelo a boithabišo, go tšea maeto a boiketlo le go nwa mabjala ka diresturenteng, dipareng le ka dithabeneng.

src_text: but as the old adage goes, just because you can, doesn’t mean you should.
tgt_text: eupša mmolelwana wa segologolo o re seo o se kgo nago ga go re o se dire.

src_text: many people who have the coronavirus do not have symptoms and may not even know they are infected.
tgt_text: batho ba bantši ba go ba le coronavirus ga ba laetše dika tša bolwetši ebile le bona ba kaba ba sa tsebe gore ba fetetšwe.

src_text: this is a sobering reality because it means that any of us could be infected right now and could unwittingly infect others.
tgt_text: ye ke nnete ya se bele ya go se leše di wela ka gobane e ra gore wo mongwe le wo mongwe wa rena a ka be a fetetšwe ka nako ye ebile a ka fetetša ba bangwe e se ka maikemišetšo.

src_text: this is particular the case when visiting relatives, especially the elderly and those with preexisting medical conditions that render them vulnerable to infection.
tgt_text: se se diragala kudu ge go etelwa meloko, kudukudu batšofadi le bao ba nago le malwetši a mangwe ao a bego a le gona mebeleng ya bona ao a ba dirago gore ba be kotsing ya go fetelwa.

src_text: it is also true for attending religious services or cultural activities.
tgt_text: nnete ke gore se se diragala gape ge batho ba e ya diko panong tša sedumedi goba ditiragalong tša setšo.

src_text: the ‘second wave’ of infections that several other countries have experienced is an everpresent possibility for us too.
tgt_text: lephoto la bobedi la diphe telo leo dinaga tše dingwe tše ntši di itemogetšego lona ke kgonagalo yeo e dulago e le gona le ka mo nageng ya rena.

src_text: although many restrictions have been lifted, it does not mean they will not return should we experience a significant rise in infections.
tgt_text: le ge e le gore tše ntši tša dikiletšo di fedišitšwe, ga go re gore di ka se boye gape ge go ka direga gore re itemogele tlhatlogo ye kgolo ya diphetelo.

src_text: this pandemic is a matter of life and death.
tgt_text: leuba le ke taba ya lehu le bophelo.

src_text: we need to adapt and we need to be vigilant.
tgt_text: re swanetše go tlwaela seemo ebile re swanetše go ntšha mahlo dinameng.

src_text: in the days, weeks and months that lie ahead, we must urgently focus our efforts on recovery.
tgt_text: mo matšatšing, dibekeng le dikgweding tše tlago, re swanetše gore ka pejana re lebiše šedi ya rena pholong.

src_text: our economy and our society has suffered a great deal.
tgt_text: ikonomi ya rena le setšhaba sa gaborena di tlaišegile kudu.

src_text: as we return to economic activity across almost all industries – and work to repair the damage done – we have a responsibility to not let our guard down as individuals, employers, communities, families, professionals, workers and citizens.
tgt_text: ge re le gare re boela ditiragalong tša ikonomi go kgabaganya diintasteri tša go lekana tšohle gotee le mošomo wa go lokiša fao go senyegilego, re nale mai karabelo a gore re se lahlele toulo bjalo ka motho ka noši, bjalo ka bengmešomo, bjalo ka setšhaba, bjalo ka malapa, bjalo ka ditsebi, bjalo ka bašomi le bjalo ka badudi.

src_text: none of us wants a return to the early days of extreme lockdown restrictions.
tgt_text: ga gona le ka o tee wa rena yo a nyakago go boela matšatšing a mathomo a dikiletšo tše bogale tša go tswalelwa ga naga.

src_text: we want to move on with our lives.
tgt_text: re nyaka go gatela pele ka maphelo a rena.

src_text: we want our friends and loved ones to remain healthy and safe.
tgt_text: re nyaka gore bagwera le baratwa ba rena ba dule ba phetše gabotse ebile ba bolokegile.

src_text: as a nation, let us continue to work together to ensure that we progress.
tgt_text: bjalo ka setšhaba, a re tšweleng pele go šoma mmogo go netefatša gore re gatela pele.

src_text: the move to alert level 2 of the lockdown is not a ‘free for all.’ the rules on social distancing, mask wearing, social gatherings and international travel remain.
tgt_text: go theošetšwa go maemotemošo a bobedi a go tswalelwa ga naga ga go re gore batho ba itirele ka go rata.

src_text: our success rests on our ability to abide by these regulations and to ensure that we each behave carefully and responsibly.
tgt_text: melao ya go šielana sekgala, go apara maseke, dikgobokano tša leago le maeto a boditšhaba e santše e le gona.

src_text: every time we are considering any form of nonessen tial activity, we should ask: what is the risk of infection to ourselves and to others?
tgt_text: katlego ya rena seemong se e godimo ga bokgoni ba rena ba go latela melao ye beilwego le go netefatša gore re itshwara ka tlhokomelo le ka maikarabelo.

src_text: where there is a risk, even a slight one, it is better not to do it.
tgt_text: nako le nako ge re gopola go dira tiragalo ya mohuta ofe goba efe ye sego bohlo kwa, re swanetše go ipotšiša potšišo ye: naa e kaba kotsi ya se ke efe go rena le ba thong ba bangwe?

src_text: let us proceed, as ever, with caution.
tgt_text: fao go nago le kotsi, le ge e kaba ye nnyane ka mokgwa mang, go kaone ge re ka ema ka yona.

src_text: let us keep each other safe.
tgt_text: a re bolokegeng ka moka ga rena vukuzenzele unnamed naga ya gaborena e theošeditšwe go maemotemošo a bobedi mo magatong a rena a leuba la corona virus .

src_text: protect our women and children vukuzenzele unnamed a year ago, almost to the day, thousands of wom en, men and children marched to parliament to protest against a spate of rapes and killings of women and girls.
tgt_text: šireletšang basadi le bana ba rena vukuzenzele unnamed ngwaga wo o feti lego, go nyaka go fihla lehono, diketekete tša basadi, tša banna le bana ba ile ba gwantela palamenteng go tliša ditšhupetšo kgahlanong le bothata bja go katwa le go bolawa ga basadi le bana.

src_text: at the time, the nation was reeling from the murders of uyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess and a number of other women who had lost their lives at the hands of brutal men.
tgt_text: ka nako yeo, setšhaba se be se sa tšhošitšwe ke go bolawa ga uyinene mrwetyana, leighandre jegels, jesse hess le ga basadi ba bangwe ba bantši bao ba lahlegetšwego ke maphelo a bona ka diatleng tša banna ba bašoro.

src_text: from all social backgrounds, young and old, students and working women, the peaceful protesters held aloft placards that read ‘enough is enough’ and ‘am i next?’.
tgt_text: go tšwa maemong a bona a go fapana, bafsa le batho ba bagolo, baithuti le basadi bao ba šomago, bagwanti bao ba bego ba dira ditšhupetšo ka khutšo ba be ba emišeditše godimo dipolakate tšeo di bego di ngwadilwe ‘enough is enough’ le ‘am i next?

src_text: the anguish and the anger was palpable that day.
as i received their clearly articulated demands, it was clear to me that we needed to act urgently and with determination.
tgt_text: bohloko le go befelwa ga bagwanti bao bo be bo le nyanyeng ka letšatši leo.

src_text: it was important to me that i did not respond with hollow words and empty promises.
tgt_text: ge ke amogela dinyakwa tša bona tšeo di bego di hlagišitšwe ka fao go kwagala ka gona, go bile nyanyeng go nna gore re swanetše go dira se sengwe ka tšhoganetšo le ka maikemišetšo.

src_text: a few days later, i called a joint sitting of parliament, where we announced a r1.6 billion emergency response action plan to combat genderbased violence and femicide (gbvf).
tgt_text: go bile bohlokwa go nna gore ke se ke ka fetola dinyakwa tše ka mantšu a go se kwagale le ka ditshepišo tšeo re ka se di phethagatšego.

src_text: over the six months of its implementation, public spending in various government departments was reprioritised to support interventions for care and support for survivors, for awareness and prevention campaigns, to improve laws and policies, to promote the economic empowerment of women, and to strengthen the criminal justice system.
tgt_text: matšatši a mmalwa ka morago ga fao, ke ile ka bitša tulo ya mohlakanelwa ya palamente, fao re tsebišitšego leanotiro la phetolo ya tšhoganetšo la r1.6 pilione ka nepo ya go lwantšha dikgaruru tša bong le polao ya basadi (gbvf).

src_text: and now we are on the cusp of the most farreaching legislative overhaul in the fight against gbvf.
tgt_text: mo dikgweding tše tshela tša go tsenya tirišong ga leanotiro le, go šomiša ditšhelete tša setšhaba ka dikgorong tša mehutahuta tša mmušo go ile gwa bewa pele ka leswa ka nepo ya go tsekga ditsenogare tša tlhokomelo le thekgo ya batšwasehlabelo, go masolo a temošo le a thibelo ya dikgaruru tše, go kaonafatša melao le melaotshepetšo, go tšwetša pele maatlafatšo ya basadi ka ekonoming, le go maatlafatša tshepedišo ya toka go bosenyi.

src_text: three key bills relating to gbvf have been introduced in parliament recently.
tgt_text: gomme mo lebakeng le re mo mafelelong a go hlama melao ye bohlokwa leswa ka nepo ya go lwantšha gbvf.

src_text: through the introduction of these bills, we are honouring the promise we made to the protestors last year and to all the women of this country.
tgt_text: melaokakanywa ye meraro ye bohlokwa ya go amana le dikgaruru tša bong (gbv) e tsebagaditšwe ka palamenteng mo nakong ye e sa tšwago go feta.

src_text: the three amendment bills are designed to fill the gaps that allow some perpetrators of these crimes to evade justice and to give full effect to the rights of our country’s women and children.
tgt_text: ka go tsebagatša melaokakanywa ye, re hlompha tshepišo yeo re e dirilego go bagwanti ngwageng wo o fetilego le go basadi ba naga ye ka moka.

src_text: these bills, once finalised, will help to restore the confidence of our country’s women that the law is indeed there to protect them.
tgt_text: melaokakanywaphetošwa ye meraro ye e hlametšwe go tloša sekgoba seo se dumelelago gore basenyi ba melato ye ba tšhabele toka le go phethagatša ka botlalo ditokelo tša basadi le bana ba naga ye.

src_text: the first is the bill to amend the criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act.
tgt_text: melaokakanywa ye, ge e šetše e phethilwe, e tla thuša go bušetša sekeng tshepo ya basadi ba naga ya rena ya gore molao o gona go ba šireletša.

src_text: this creates a new offence of sexual intimidation, extends the ambit of the offence of incest, and extends the reporting duty of persons who suspect a sexual offence has been committed against a child.
tgt_text: wa mathomo ke molaokakanywa wa go fetoša molaophetošwa wa bosenyi (wa melato ya thobalano le ye e amanago le ona).

src_text: it expands the scope of the national register for sex offenders (nrso) to include the particulars of all sex offenders.
tgt_text: se se dira gore tšhošetšo ka tša thobalano e be molato o moswa, o katološa mollwane wa molato wa go robalana le wa leloko, ebile o katološa maikarabelo a go bega melato ga batho bao ba belaelago gore go dirilwe molato wa thobalano wo o dirilwego kgahlanong le ngwana.

src_text: until now, it has only applied to sex offenders convicted of sex crimes perpetrated against children or persons with mental disabilities.
tgt_text: o oketša mollwane wa retšistara ya bosetšhaba ya basenyi ba tša thobalano (nrso) gore e akaretše le dintlha tša basenyi ka moka ba tša thobalano.

src_text: the time an offender’s particulars must remain on the register has been increased, and those listed on the register will have to disclose this when they submit applications to work with vulnerable persons.
tgt_text: go fihla mo lebakeng le, e be e dirišwa fela go basenyi ba tša thobalano bao ba bonwego molato wa bosenyi bja thobalano bjo bo dirilwego kgahlanong le bana goba kgahlanong le batho bao ba nago le bofokodi bja ka menaganong.

src_text: the bill also provides for the names of persons on the nrso to be publicly available.
tgt_text: nako yeo dintlha tša mosenyi di swanetšego go ba ka retšistareng e okeditšwe, gomme bao ba ngwadilwego ka gare ga retšistara ba tla swanela go tsebagatša se ge ba romela dikgopelo tša mošomo go ya go šoma le batho bao ba lego kotsing.

src_text: the criminal and related matters amendment bill tightens, among others, the granting of bail to perpetrators of gbvf, and expands the offences for which minimum sentences must be imposed.
tgt_text: molaokakanywa wo o hlagiša gore maina a batho bao ba lego ka nrso a hwetšagale setšhabeng.

src_text: the amendments impose new obligations on lawenforcement officials and on our courts.
tgt_text: molaokakanywaphetošwa wa bosenyi le melato ye e amanago le ona o tiiša, gareng ga tše dingwe, go fa peila go basenyi ba gbvf, ebile o oketša kotlo ya melato yeo gomme go na le lebakanako la fasana leo le beilwego la gore motho yo a bonwe go molato a romelwe kgolegong.

src_text: when a prosecutor does not oppose bail in cases of gbv, they have to place their reasons on record.
tgt_text: diphetošo tše di tliša ditlamego tše diswa go bahlankedi ba phethagatšo ya molao le go dikgorotsheko tša rena.

src_text: unless a person accused of gbv can provide exceptional circumstances why they should be released on bail, the court must order their detention until the criminal proceedings are concluded.
tgt_text: ge mosekiši a sa ganane le peila mabakeng a gbv , o swanetše go ngwala mabaka a bona.

src_text: in reaching a decision on a bail application, the courts are compelled to take a number of considerations into account.
tgt_text: ka ntle le ge motho yo a pharwago ka molato wa dikgaruru tša bong a ka fa mabaka ao a sego a tlwaelega gore ke ka lebaka la eng a swanetše go lokollwa ka peila, kgorotsheko e swanetše go laela gore a golegwe go fihla ge ditshepedišo tša bosenyi di phethwa.

src_text: they include pretrial reports on the desirability of releasing an accused on bail, threats of violence made against a survivor, and the view of the survivor regarding his or her safety.
