tgt_text: dikhamphani tša dikepe, kudu, di tšweleditše matshwe nyego ka ga pitlagano ya dilori le dinako tša go leta, go ditelega ga go fihla ga dikepe le dinako tša boemakepe, tlhokomelo ya go fokola ya didirišwa le ka kakaretšo tšweletšo ya fase ka boemakepeng.

src_text: my recent visit to the port was to check whether the commitments made in response to these concerns had been implemented.
tgt_text: ge ke be ke etetše boemakepe bjo kgauswanyane ke be ke eya go lekola ge e le gore maikgafo ao a dirilwego go matshwe nyego a a phethagaditšwe.

src_text: there has indeed been great progress over the past year in turning around the performance of the port, despite the impact of covid19.
tgt_text: ka nnete go bile le tšwelopele ye kgolo mo ngwageng wa go feta ka go fetoša go šoma ga boemakepe, le ge go na le khuetšo ya covid19 .

src_text: these efforts are already showing results in improved maintenance of equipment, reduced congestion, quicker turnaround times and increased use of rail instead of road transport.
tgt_text: maitapišo a a šetše a bontšha dipoelo go tlhokomelo ye e kaonafetšego ya didirišwa, pitlagano yeo e fokotšegilego, dinako tša go dira dilo tša lebe lo le tšhomišo ye e oketšegilego ya diporo go na le dinamela tša tseleng.

src_text: while this is important progress, there is still much work to be done to position durban as a worldclass port and as a hub port for the southern hemisphere.
tgt_text: le ge se e le tšwelopele ye bohlokwa, go sa na le mošomo wo montši woo o swanetšwego go dirwa go bea durban mae mong a go ba boemakepe bja maemo a godimo le bjalo ka boemakepe bja hapo ya he misfere ya borwa.

src_text: in recent years, the port has slipped from its position as first in africa to third, behind tangier in morocco and port said in egypt.
tgt_text: mo mengwageng ya kgau swanyane, boemakepe bo tlogile maemong a bjona a go ba bja mathomo ka afrika go ba bja boraro, ka morago ga tangier ka morocco le boema kepe bja said ka egepeta.

src_text: truck turnaround times have greatly improved.
tgt_text: dinako tša go fihla ga dilori e kaonafetše kudu.

src_text: similarly, the reliability of cargo handling equipment has improved to 80% and is heading towards at least 95% to meet international benchmarks.
tgt_text: gape, go tshepagala ga go šogana le morwalo go kaonafetše go ya go 80% gomme go lebile go 95% go fihlelela maemo a boditšhabatšhaba.

src_text: ship waiting times have reduced to impressive levels.
tgt_text: dinako tša go leta ga dikepe di fokotšegile go magato a go makatša.

src_text: these statistics may seem technical and obscure, but they have a direct impact on the growth of our economy and on the prices we pay as consumers.
tgt_text: dipalopalo tše di ka bo nala e le tša botsebi le go se kwešišagale, eupša di na le khuetšo ya thwii mo kgolong ya ekonomi le go ditefo tšeo re di lefago bjalo ka bareki.

src_text: we have made improving the efficiency of our ports a priority of operation vulindlela and have focused on rebuilding transnet, which is one of our valued stateowned enterprises.
tgt_text: re dirile gore go kaonafatša go šoma gabotse ga maemake pe a rena e be selo se bohlokwa sa operation vulindlela go mme re nepišitše go ageng lefsa transnet, yeo e lego ye nngwe ya dikgwebo tša mmušo tše bohlokwa.

src_text: the new management of transnet and its operating divisions are resolutely focused on turning the performance of the port around.
tgt_text: ba taolo ye mpsha ya transnet le dikarolo tša yona tša go šoma ba nepiša ka maikemišetšo a go fetoša go šoma ga boemakepe.

src_text: the management has ambitious and exciting expansion plans for all five of the port’s precincts.
tgt_text: ba taolo ba na le maano a go hlohleletša gape a go kgahliša a go atološa mafelo ka moka a mahlano a boemakepe.

src_text: these include the deepening of the maydon wharf channel to allow larger, modern vessels to enter the port, the infill of pier 1 and pier 2 to create additional capacity for con tainers and the development of a new container terminal in the point precinct.
tgt_text: wona a akaretša go katološa tsela ya maydown wharf go dumelela dikepe tša sebjale bjale tše dikgolo go tsena ka boemakepeng, go tswalela pier 1 le pier 2 go hlola bokgoni bja tlaleletšo bja ditšhelo le kaonafatšo ya lefelo la setšhelo le lefsa ka point precinct.

src_text: altogether, the expansion of infrastructure at the port will require r100 billion in new investment over the next decade and more.
tgt_text: ka moka, katološo ya infrastraktšha mo boemake peng bjo e tla nyaka dipeeletšo tše dimpsha tša go dira r100 bilione mo mengwageng ye mesome le ya go feta ye e tlago.

src_text: this will completely transform the port, expanding its capacity for container handling from 2.9 million units to more than 11 million units.
tgt_text: se se tla fetoša boemakepe go felelela, ya katološa bokgo ni bja bjona bja go šogana le setšhelo go tloga go diyuniti tše 2.9 milione go ya go diyuniti tše 11 milione.

src_text: these ambitious plans will require greater private sector participation and investment.
tgt_text: maano a a go hlohleletša a tla nyaka gore lekala la praebete le kgathe tema ya go bonala le ya dipeeletšo.

src_text: transnet, including the durban port, is an important national asset belonging to the people of south africa.
tgt_text: transnet, go akaretša boema kepe bja durban, ke thoto ye bohlokwa ya setšhaba yeo e lego ya batho ba afrika borwa.

src_text: partnerships with the private sector are crucial to bring new investment, technology and expertise to port operations and to modernise equipment and infrastructure.
tgt_text: ditirišano le lekala la prae bete di bohlokwa go tliša peeletšo ye mpsha, theknolotši le bokgoni go tshepedišo ya boemakepe le go mpshafatša didirišwa le infrastraktšha.

src_text: transnet is planning, for example, to advertise a concession later this year to build and operate the new point terminal.
tgt_text: transnet e beakanya, mohla la, go kwalakwatša kgwebo moragonyana ngwaga wo go aga le go sepetša lefelo la boemakepe le lefsa.

src_text: this will bring in private investment and improve the efficiency of container handling.
tgt_text: se se tla tliša peeletšo ya praebete le go kaonafatša bokgoni bja go šogana le setšhelo.

src_text: through our reform process we are steadily improving the efficiency of our ports and railways and unlocking massive investment in infrastructure.
tgt_text: ka tshepetšo ya rena re kaonafatša ka go latelana bokgoni bja maemakepe a rena le diporo gomme ba utolla peeletšo ye kgolo ka infrastraktšha.

src_text: this will not only lower costs and improve the competitiveness of our exports, but will create thousands of new jobs in the process.
tgt_text: se se ka se fokotše fela ditshenyagelo le go kaonafatša bokgoni bja maemakepe a rena, eupša se tla hlola mešomo ye mefsa mo tshepetšong.

src_text: through both operational improvements and structural reforms, durban port will reclaim its place as the bestperforming port in africa.
tgt_text: ka bobedi dikaonafatšo tša tshepedišo le phetošo ya sebo pego, boemakepe bja durban bo tla boela maemong a bjona a go ba boemakepe bja go šoma gabotse go feta ka moka mo afrika.

src_text: as part of our reconstruction and recove ry plan, we will continue to work tirelessly to expand infrastructure investment and transform our network industries.
tgt_text: bjalo ka ge e le karolo ya leano la rena la kagolefsa le mpshafatšo ya ekonomi, re tla tšwela pele go šoma ka maatla go oketša dipeeletšo mo infrastraktšheng le go fetoša intasteri ya rena ya manane.

src_text: if my visit to durban left one thing in my mind, it is that we south africans are capable of succeeding in projects of vast importance and scale.
tgt_text: ge leeto la ka durban le tlogetše selo se tee mona ganong wa ka, ke ka moo maafrika borwa ba kgonago go atlega diprotšekeng tše bohlokwa kudu le tše dikgolo.

src_text: our ambitions should match the size of our challenges.
tgt_text: maikemišetšo a rena a swanetše go sepelelana le bo golo bja ditlhohlo tše re nago le tšona.

src_text: with the progress we are making at the durban port, with the reinvigorated skills and capabilities that we have in transnet, we now have the wind in our sails.
tgt_text: ka tšwelopele yeo re e di rago mo boemakepeng bja durban, ka mabokgoni ao a matlafaditšwego le mabokgoni ao re nago le wona ka go trans net, bjale re tseleng ya maleba.

src_text: and we are moving at a rate of knots towards our destination.
tgt_text: boemakepe bja durban bo hlola dibaka tše dintšhi tša go thiba letšatši ka afrika borwa vukuzenzele unnamed kgauswanyane, ke etetše boemakepe bja durban go iponela ka bonna mošomo wo o dirilwego go dira gore boemakepe bo kgone go šoma gabotse gape bo be le mohola.

src_text: robust media more critical than ever vukuzenzele unnamed we live in a country where not just journalists but any member of the public is able to freely articulate their views, their opinions and indeed their dissatisfaction without fear of retribution.
tgt_text: bogaši bjo bo tiilego bo bohlokwa le go feta le peleng vukuzenzele unnamed re dula ka nageng yeo e lego gore ga se fela bagaši ba di taba eupša le gape leloko lefe goba lefe la setšhaba leo le kgonago go tšweletša maikutlo a lona, dikgopo lo le gape go se kgotsofale ga gagwe ka tokologo ka ntle le go tšhoga gore o tla tšhošetšwa.

src_text: we have come a long way from the days where social protest by artists attracted banning orders, and critical reporting by journalists risked imprisonment or the closure of publications.
tgt_text: re tšwa kgole go matšatši ao ditšhupetšo tšeo di bego di dirwa ke badiragatši di bego di fetolwa ka dikiletšo, fao go bega ditaba ka tsi nkelo ka bagaši go bego go tsenya bagaši kotsing ya go golegwa goba go tswalelwa ga dikgatišo tša bona.

src_text: recently, the organisation reporters without borders published the 2021 world press freedom index, a barometer of the state of media freedom across the globe.
tgt_text: mo nakong ye e sa tšwago go feta, mokgatlo wa babegi ba ditaba bao ba hlokago mollwane o gatišitše se ngwalwa sa dipalopalo sa tokologo ya bogaši lefaseng sa 2021, e lego seo se elago seemo sa bolokologi bja tša kgašo go ralala le lefase ka bophara.

src_text: overall, it was found that there has been a decline in public access to information and an increase in obstacles to news coverage in a number of countries.
tgt_text: ka kakaretšo, go hweditšwe gore go bile le go theogela fase ga phihlelelo ya setšhaba go tshedimošo le koketšego ya mapheko go kakaretšo ya ditaba ka dinageng tše mmalwa.

src_text: the report said that journalism is "totally blocked or seriously impeded" in 73 countries and "constrained" in 59 others.
tgt_text: pego ye e boletše gore bogaši bja ditaba bo "thibetšwe ka botlaloi goba bo šitišwa kudu" ka dinageng tše 73 gomme bo "gateletšwe" ka go tše dingwe tše 59. seo se hlobago boroko ke gore tokologo ya bogaši e phuhlame ka fase ga seemo sa leuba la covid19 , fao e lego gore dikiletšo tša mehutahuta tšeo di hlomilwego di ilego tša bonala di šomišwa go thibela ditiragalo tša bogaši ka mafelong a mmalwa.

src_text: what is worrying is that media freedom has deteriorated under the covid19 pandemic, with the various restrictions put in place having seemingly been used to curtail media activity in several places.
tgt_text: ka mo go pego ya mora gorago, afrika borwa e bile maemong a bo 32 go dinaga tše 180. pego ye e hlaloša seemo sa tokologo ya bogaši ka afrika borwa bjalo ka bjo bo "tiišeleditšwego gomme bo le kotsing".

src_text: in this latest report south africa ranked 32nd out of 180 countries.
tgt_text: e hlaloša gore le ge mo laotheo wa afrika borwa o šireletša tokologo ebile re na le setlwaedi seo se tiilego sa bogaši bja dinyakišišo, mapheko a mmalwa a sa šitiša bagaši go dira mešomo ya bona.

src_text: the index describes the state of media freedom in south africa as "guaranteed but fragile".
tgt_text: se se akaretša magato a semolao ao a tšewago kga hlanong le go tšea diswantšho mafelong a bohlokwa a bosetšhaba goba go bega ka ga merero ye e amanago le bohlodi bja tšhireletšego ya mmušo.

src_text: it notes that while the south african constitution protects freedom and we have an established culture of investigative journalism, a number of impediments still hinder journalists in the performance of their duties.
tgt_text: pego e lemoga gape gore go bile le tlhatlogo ya ditšhošetšo tša bagaši ba ditaba kudukudu ba basadi go kgašo ya setšhaba ka 2020. tšhošetšo ya mohuta woo ga e amogelege le gatee, ebile e tloga e le kotsi kudu ge e lebišwa go bagaši ba ditaba ba basadi gomme e fela e sepela mmogo le ditšhošetšo tša dikgaruru tša thobalano.

src_text: this includes legal injunctions against taking images of national key points or reporting on matters involving state security.
tgt_text: ye ke taba ye e hlobago boroko kudu gomme e ka se dumelelwe.

src_text: the report also notes an increase during 2020 of the intimidation of journalists, especially female journalists on social media.
tgt_text: go sa le bjalo, re ikgantšha kudu go tseba gore re na le bogaši bja tokologo bjo bo tii lego bjo bo kgonago go bega ditaba ka ntle le letšhogo goba go ratwa ke bao ba lego maemong a bolaodi, bjo bo kgonago go gaša ditaba tšeo di gogilego šedi tša nakong ya rena, le go fa setšhaba tshedimošo ye e nepagetšego, ya go se tšeye lehlakore.

src_text: such intimidation is totally unacceptable, but is particularly harmful when it is directed at female journalists and is occasionally accompanied by threats of sexual violence.
tgt_text: ka nakong yeo re šomago mmogo go aga ekonomi ya rena le setšhaba sa rena ka kgabagareng ya seemo sa le uba la coronavirus , bogaši bjo bo tiilego bo sa le bohlokwa le go feta le peleng.

src_text: this is a matter of great concern and cannot be allowed.
tgt_text: bogaši bja ka afrika borwa bo ralokile tema ye bohlokwa go utolla tše ntši tšeo re di tsebago mabapi le bogolo bja mannete bja go gogwa ga mmušo ka nko ka batho bao ba itirelago ba nnoši, ba go ba le bomenetša gammogo le dikhamphani tša bona.

src_text: at the same time, we take great comfort in the knowledge that we have a free, robust media that is able to report without fear or favour about those in power, about the most pressing social issues of our time, and to provide accurate, impartial information to the public.
tgt_text: ba kgonne go tšwetša pele bogaši bja bona bja ditaba le ge ba be ba tšhošetšwa, ba botšwa ditaba tša maaka le go hlaselwa.

src_text: at a time when we are working together to rebuild our economy and our society in the midst of the coronavirus pandemic, a robust media is more critical than ever.
tgt_text: bomenetša ga se fela tlhohlo yeo re lebanego le yona bjalo ka naga.

src_text: the south african media has played a pivotal role in uncovering much of what we know today about the true extent of capture of the state by selfserving, corrupt individuals and entities.
tgt_text: maphelo a ka me hla a maafrika borwa a sa amilwe ke bohloki, tlhokego ya tekatekano le tlhokego ya tlhabollo, kabo ya ditirelo ye e fokolago le tlhokego ya phihlelelo go menyetla.

src_text: they sustained their reporting even in the face of intimidation, disinformation and attacks on their person.
tgt_text: ge e le gore bogaši bo tla dula go phethagatša mai karabelo a bjona ka nnete go thekga temokrasi, bagaši ba rena ba ditaba ba swanetše go tšwela pele go bega ditaba tšeo di gogilego šedi ka ntle le letšhogo le go ratwa.

src_text: corruption is by no means the only challenge we face as a country.
tgt_text: kakaretšo ya bona ya ditaba ye e tšwelago pele e swanetše go akaretša di kgaruru tša bong, bosenyi ka ditšhabeng tša rena le bofokodi bja setšhabeng bja go swana le tšhomišobošaedi ya diokobatši.

src_text: the daily lives of many south africans are still affected by poverty, inequality and underdevelopment, poor service delivery and lack of access to opportunities.
tgt_text: bogaši bja rena bo swanetše go fa ka tshedimošo ye e nepagetšego le yeo e sa tšeego lehlakore, ka go kgontšha setšhaba go tšea diphetho se na le tshedimošo, gore se fihlelele dibaka le go kaonafatša maphelo a sona.

src_text: if the media is to remain true to its responsibility to support democracy, our journalists must continue to report without fear or favour on the other issues of the day.
tgt_text: ba swanetše go tšwela pele go tšweletša bogaši bja ditaba bjo bo putlago ditaba tšeo di gogilego šedi le tšeo di lego ka mathomong a dikuranta eupša le bjo bo tsenyago le tsogo go hlabolleng ga batho.

src_text: their sustained coverage must include genderbased violence, crime in our communities and social ills like substance abuse.
tgt_text: ba swanetše go bega bobedi ditaba tše botse le tše di sego tša loka, kgatelopele ye re bilego le yona le dtlhohlo tše re lebanego le tšona.

src_text: our media should provide accurate and impartial information, enabling the public to make informed decisions, to access opportunities and to improve their lives.
tgt_text: seriti ke selo se bohlokwa go tšwetša pele botshephegi magareng ga bagaši ba ditaba le setšhaba.

src_text: they should continue to produce journalism that goes beyond the headlines and front pages and that contributes to human development.
tgt_text: ge bagaši ba ditaba ba dumela go šomišwa goba gore dintlo tša bona tša bogaši di šomišwa go lwa dintwa tša dipolotiki goba go hwetša dintlha legatong la dikgahlego tša bona, seriti sa bona se theogela fase.

src_text: they should report both the good news and the bad news, the progress we make and the challenges we face.
tgt_text: ge bagaši ba ditaba ba phatlalatša ditaba tšeo di sego tša nepagala goba tšeo ba tsebago gore ke maaka, setšhaba se lahlegelwa ke tshepo go bona.

src_text: credibility is key to sustaining trust between journalists and the public.
tgt_text: ke kgahlegong ye kaone ya bohle bao ba ratago naga ye le go duma gore e atlege gore bogaši bo thekgwe, le gore bo se ke bja šitišwa mošomong wa bjona.

src_text: when journalists allow themselves or their platforms to be used to fight political battles or settle scores on behalf of vested interests, their credibility suffers.
tgt_text: bjalo ka setšhaba, a re tšweleng pele go šoma mmo go go šireletša tokologo ya bogaši bja ka nageng ya rena re na le maikemišetšo.

src_text: when media disseminate stories that are inaccurate or that they know to be false, the public loses faith in them.
tgt_text: bogaši bjo bo tiilego bo bohlokwa le go feta le peleng vukuzenzele unnamed re dula ka nageng yeo e lego gore ga se fela bagaši ba di taba eupša le gape leloko lefe goba lefe la setšhaba leo le kgonago go tšweletša maikutlo a lona, dikgopo lo le gape go se kgotsofale ga gagwe ka tokologo ka ntle le go tšhoga gore o tla tšhošetšwa.

src_text: israel, palestine urged to emulate sa by pursuing peace vukuzenzele unnamed our experience with the democratic transition is a lesson about the power of empathy, negotiation and compromise.
tgt_text: israele le palestina di kgothaletšwa go etšiša afrika borwa ka go phegelela khutšo vukuzenzele unnamed maitemogelo a rena ka go feto gela go temokra si ke thuto ye bohlokwa ka ga kwelobohloko, ditherišano le go dumelela na ka tše dingwe tša dipee lo bakeng sa tšwelopele.

src_text: the escalating situation in israel and palestine affirms once more what we south africans know too well, that intractable conflicts can only be solved through peaceful negotiation.
tgt_text: maemo ao a befelago pele ka israele le palestina a tiišetša gape seo rena re le maafrika borwa re se tse bago botse, gore dikgohlano tše boima di ka rarollwa fela ka ditherišano tša go ba le khutšo.

src_text: it also demonstrates that unless the root causes of a conflict are addressed, in this case the illegal occupation by israel of palestinian land and the denial of the palestinian people’s right to selfdetermination, there will never be peace.
tgt_text: maemo a a laetša le gore ntle le gore lebakalegolo la dikgohlano le rarollwe, e lego go ipha ga israele naga ya palestina ka mo go sego molaong le go ganela mapa lestina tokelo ya boipušo, go ka se tsoge go bile le khutšo.

src_text: the latest violence was sparked by an israeli court decision to evict a group of families from their homes in the sheikh jarrah neighbourhood in east jerusalem to make way for israeli settlements.
tgt_text: dikgaruru tša moragorago di hlotšwe ke sephetho sa kgoro ya tsheko ya israele sa gore go hudušwe malapa magaeng a bona lefelong la sheikh jarrah bohlaba bja jerusalema gore maisraele a tle a dule lefelong leo.

src_text: the sight of men, women and children being evicted from the homes their families have lived in for generations brings back painful collective and personal memories for the majority of south africans – of forced removals and land dispossession.
tgt_text: diswantšho tša banna, basadi le bana bao ba hudušwago magaeng ao meloko ye mentši ya malapa a bona e dutšego gona di buša megopolo ya ditiragalo tše bohloko menaganong ya bontši bja maafrika borwa – tša go hudušwa ka kgapeletšo le go amogwa naga.

src_text: it was a pain and humiliation faced by my own family, and by many south african families.
tgt_text: ke bohloko le lenyatšo leo le ilego la laetšwa lapa la gešo le malapa a mangwe a mantši a afrika borwa.

src_text: my family was forcibly moved to different parts of the country on two occasions.
tgt_text: lapa la gešo le ile la hudušwa makga a mabedi ka kgapeletšo, le hudušetšwa dikarolong tša go fapafapana tša naga.

src_text: being forced from one’s home at gunpoint is a trauma not easily forgotten and is carried across generations.
tgt_text: go gapeletšwa go huduga ntlong ya gago ke batho bao ba itlhamilego ka dithu nya go hlola lebadi le legolo monaganong leo le sa folego gabonolo, gomme le dula le le gona melokong ye e latelago.

src_text: as a country, we are still living with the residual effects of the callous acts carried out in the name of apartheid spatial planning.
tgt_text: bjalo ka naga re sa phela ka mabadi a go hlolwa ke melao ye sehlogo yeo e beilwego ka leina la go fa batho madulo ka tshepetšo ya kgethologanyo.

src_text: for all who believe in equality, justice and human rights, we cannot but be moved and indeed angered, at the pain and humiliation being inflicted on the palestinian people; for it echoes our own.
tgt_text: bohle bao ba dumelago go tekatekano, toka le ditokelo tša batho, ga go ka moo ba ka se angwego le go befedišwa ke bohloko bja lenyatšo leo le laetšwago mapalestina; ka lebaka la gore bo swana le bjo re bo kwelego.

src_text: israel’s actions are a violation of international law.
tgt_text: ditiro tša israele ke kgatako ya molao wa boditšhabatšhaba.

src_text: they show a total disregard for successive united nations security council reso lutions that call for an end to the occupation of palestinian land and for the fulfilment of the rights of the palestinian people.
tgt_text: ba laetša go se hlomphe ditumelelano tša go latelelana tša lekgotla la polokego la dinagakopano, tšeo di rego go emišwe go tšea naga ya palestina le gore go phethagatšwe ditokelo tša mapalestina.

src_text: since israeli security forces launched assaults on worshippers at alaqsa mosque in jerusalem, the violence has now engulfed the gaza strip, large parts of the west bank and a number of israeli cities.
tgt_text: mola madira a polokego ka israele a hlaselago bara pedi moskeng wa al aqsa ka jerusalema beke ya go feta, dikgaruru bjale di aparetše gaza strip, dikarolo tše ntši tša west bank le ditoropo kgolo tše malwa tša israele.

src_text: it has claimed the lives of dozens of people, including children.
tgt_text: di hlotše mahu a batho ba bantši, go akaretšwa le bana.

src_text: it is also deeply troubling that israeli forces destroyed a multistorey building that housed a number of media organisations, sending a chilling message to media reporting on the violence.
tgt_text: go a tshwenya le gore madira a israele a šwalalantše moago wa mabato a mantši wa dikhamphani tša bobega ditaba, e le tsela ya go romela molaetša wa go tšhoša go babegaditaba bao ba begago ka dikgaruru tše.

src_text: the senseless and continued israeli bombardment of gaza will have devastating consequences for more than two million people who have been suffering under an illegal israeli blockade for 14 years.
tgt_text: ditlhaselo tše tša go laetša go hloka kelello ga israele tša go tšwela pele go hlasela gaza ka dithuthupi di tla ba le ditlamorago tše bohloko go batho ba go feta dimilione tše pedi bao ba dutšego ba tlaišega ka tlase ga bothopša bja israele moo e thibetšego go tsena le go tšwa tikologong ya bona mengwaga ye 14. re ipiletše go bohle bao ba amegago gore ba kgethe thi belo, ba hlomphe maphelo a batho, le go emiša bonaba bjo.

src_text: we call on all parties involved to show restraint, to respect human life and to cease the current hostilities.
tgt_text: re le afrika borwa re ikgafa go tšea karolo maitapišong a boditšhabatšhaba ao a nepišitšwego go tsošološo ya ditshepetšo tša dipolitiki tšeo di tlago iša tlhamong ya palestina ya go sepela ka thelelo, yeo e tlago swarišana le israele ka khutšo, gape ya mellwane ya go lemogwa ke lefase ka bophara.

src_text: as south africa, we are committed to being part of international efforts aimed at reviving a political process that will lead to the establishment of a viable palestinian state existing sidebyside in peace with israel and within internationally recognised borders.
tgt_text: tharollo ya go fihlelelwa ke dinaga ka bobedi e tla dula e le kgetho ye kaonekaone bakeng sa batho ba israele le palestina, gomme re swanetše go dula re e thekga.

src_text: the twostate solution remains the most viable option for the peoples of israel and palestine and must continue to be supported.
tgt_text: ka nako yeo mašole a israele a bego a hlasela barapedi ka moskeng wa al aqsa, rena ka afrika borwa re be re beakanyetša segopotšo sa mengwaga ye lekgolo mola polao ya batho ka bontši ya bulhoek e diregago lefelong la badumedi ka ntabelanga profenseng ya kapa bohla bela.

src_text: just as israeli security forces were attacking worshippers at the alaqsa mosque, we in south africa were preparing to commemorate the centenary of the bulhoek massacre at a religious site in ntabelanga in the eastern cape.
tgt_text: ka la 24 mopitlo 1921, mašole a mmušo wa bokolo neale ao a bego a itlhamile ka dithunya tša metšhene le tša go thetha ka maotwana, a ile a thuntšha barapedi gomme ba bolaya batho ba palo ya go feta 160 le go gobatša ba palo yeo e nyakilego go fihla go 130. polao ye ya batho ka bontši e tšwelediše pepeneneng sehlogo, e sego fela sa sepho disa sa mmušo wa kopano ya afrika borwa, eupša le sa tshepetšo ya kgethollo ya mmala wa letlalo, yeo sepho disa se bego se laetšwe go e tšhireletša.

src_text: on 24 may 1921, colonial security forces armed with machine guns and artillery opened fire on worshippers, killing more than 160 people and wounding nearly 130. the massacre laid bare the brutality not only of the police force of the union of south africa, but also the racist system that it was charged to uphold.
tgt_text: go no swanala le dikgo hlano tša tikologong ya sheik jarrah, sehlogo seo se diregilego bulhoek e be e se fela mabapi le dikgohlano tša tikologong; segolothata e be e le ka lebaka la go amogwa naga ka kgapeletšo, go tšea naga ka sekoloneale, kgetho llo ya semorafe, le kgatelelo ka tirišo ya dikgoka kgahla nong le bao ba nago le me bono goba dikgopolo tša go se sepelelane le tša mmušo.

src_text: just like the dispute in the sheik jarrah neighbourhood, the atrocity at bulhoek was not just about a local dispute; it was fundamentally about the forced dispossession of land, about colonial occupa tion, about racial discrimi nation and about the violent suppression of dissent.
tgt_text: ge re lekodišiša bothata bja ka middle east kudukudu re nepišitše tlaišego ya ma palestina, go ka thuša gore re gopole mantšu a selby msimang, yo mongwe wa maloko a batlhami ba african national congress.

src_text: as we reflect on the crisis in the middle east and particularly on the suffering of the palestinian people, we would do well to recall the words of selby msimang, a founding member of the african national congress.
tgt_text: morago ga dipolao tša batho ka bontši bulhoek o ile a ngwala a re: "histori e laeditše gore moya wa motho ka tlhago o kgona go hlano gela bohlokatoka".

src_text: in the aftermath of the bulhoek massacre he wrote: "history has shown that the human soul naturally revolts against injustice".
tgt_text: ditšhupetšo le go hlanoga ga maafrika borwa bao ba dikilego ba gateletšwe ba hlanogela bokoloneale le mmušo wa kgethollo, di laeditše nepagalo ya seporo feto se.

src_text: the protests and the revolt of the oppressed people of south africa against colonialism and apartheid proved the veracity of this prophecy.
tgt_text: bjalo ka barati ba tokologo le toka, re ema le mapale stina ge ba dutše ba phegelela boipušo; re ema le bona le ge ba gana go amogwa ditokelo tša bona bjalo ka batho, le go gana go amogwa seriti sa bona.

src_text: as lovers of freedom and of justice, we stand with the palestinian people in their quest for selfdetermination, but also in their resistance against the deprivation of their human rights and the denial of their dignity.
tgt_text: israele le palestina di kgothaletšwa go etšiša afrika borwa ka go phegelela khutšo vukuzenzele unnamed maitemogelo a rena ka go feto gela go temokra si ke thuto ye bohlokwa ka ga kwelobohloko, ditherišano le go dumelela na ka tše dingwe tša dipee lo bakeng sa tšwelopele.

src_text: sa strives to realise the vision of the constitution vukuzenzele unnamed sixty years ago, on 31 may 1961, apartheid south africa became a republic, cutting its ties with the british empire.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e phegelela go phethagatša pono vukuzenzele unnamed mengwaga ye 60 ya go feta, ka la 31 mopitlo 1961, afrika borwa ya kgethollo e bile repa bliki, ya kgaola kamano ya yona le mmušo wa britain.

src_text: while a ‘republic’ is generally defined as a state in which supreme power is held by the people and their elected representatives, this was not the case in south africa.
tgt_text: mola 'republiki' ka kakaretšo e hlaloswago bjalo ka pušo yeo ka gare ga yona maatla a mantši a swerwego ke batho le baemedi ba bona bao ba kgethilwego, ka afrika borwa go be go se bjalo.

src_text: the constitution of the apartheid republic pledged allegiance to god, "who gathered our forebears together from many lands and gave them this as their own".
tgt_text: molaotheo wa repabliki ya kgethollo o be o botegela modimo, "yoo a kgobokeditšego borakgolokhukhu ba bona go tšwa dinageng tše ntši wa ba fa naga ye bjalo ka ya bona ba le tee".

src_text: it was a constitution written by and for a racial minority, and it used faith to justify tyranny.
tgt_text: e be e le molaotheo woo o ngwadilwego ke ba merafe ye mennyane le go ingwalela ona, gomme o šomišitše tumelo go thekga pušo e šoro.

src_text: it outlined the administration of government, providing that only white people were eligible to vote and serve as public representatives.
tgt_text: molaotheo wo o be o hlaloša tshepedišo ya mmušo, o bolela gore ke bathobašweu fela bao ba nago le maswanedi a go bouta le go ba baemedi ba setšhaba.

src_text: it contained no bill of rights.
tgt_text: molaotheong wo go be go se na molao wa ditokelo.

src_text: the country’s majority was relegated to a footnote towards the end of its 121 provisions, in a section titled ‘administration of bantu affairs, etc.’.
tgt_text: bontši bja badudi ba naga dihlokwa tša bona di be di sa tšeelwe hlogong bjalo ka ge di beilwe fase go ya mafelelong a mabakatheo a 121 a molaotheo wo, ka gare ga karolo ya go bitšwa ‘tshepedišo ya merero ya bathobaso, bjalobjalo.’mo molaetšeng wa go gašwa thelebišeneng, tonakgolo hf verwoerd o rile: "re nyaka tlhabollo ya go nanya ya morafe wo mongwe le wo mongwe wa rena go ya lehlakoreng le itšeng.

src_text: in a televised message, prime minister hf verwoerd said: "we seek the gradual development of each of our groups in a certain direction.
tgt_text: mo tabeng ye, thušo yeo re e hlokago ke ya go bušwa ke mothomošweu.

src_text: here the solution is openly sought by retaining the white man’s guiding hand.
tgt_text: ""re thaba kudu go ba setšhaba se se kopanego," o begetše lefase bjalo.

src_text: "we are very happy to be a united people," he declared to the world.
tgt_text: eupša nnete e be e le gore ga re setšhaba se se kopanego.

src_text: but the reality was that we were not a united people.
tgt_text: re be re le badudi ba naga yeo ditokelo tša batho ba bangwe, khumo le bophelo bja bona di lego matsogong a morafe wo mongwe.

src_text: we were inhabitants of a country where one’s rights, prospects and life expectancy was determined by one’s race.
tgt_text: mengwagasome ye mebedi, molao wa molaotheo wa repabliki wa afrika borwa wa 1961 e be e le tokomane ya semolao ya kgatelelo ya setšhaba sa afrika borwa sa go batamela 90%.

src_text: for two decades, the republic of south africa constitution act of 1961 was the legal impetus for the repression of nearly 90% of the south african population.
tgt_text: segopotšo se sa go se thabiše se diregile ka kgwedi ye tee le ye re ketekilego segopotšo sa bo25 sa kamogelo ka lekgotla la molao la molaotheo wa rena wo moswa wa temokrasi, woo e bilego bohlatse bja nnete bja setšhaba sa nnete se se kopanego.

src_text: this unhappy anniversary took place in the same month that we celebrated the 25th anniversary of the adoption by the constitutional assembly of our new democratic constitution, which became the birth certificate of a real united nation.
tgt_text: bjale re na le molao wo motee wa setšhaba se setee.

src_text: now we have one law for one nation.
tgt_text: mmogo, re ikgethetše mokgwa wa mmušo woo o fago tlhalošo ya nnete go kgopolo ya repabliki.

src_text: together, we have chosen for ourselves a system of government that gives true meaning to the concept of a republic.
tgt_text: re boletše gore ka gare ga repabliki ya rena ya temokrasi, batho bohle ba a lekana pele ga molao ebile ba na le tokelo ya tšhireletšo ya go lekana le kholego ya molao.

src_text: we have said that in our democratic republic, everyone is equal before the law and has the right to equal protection and benefit of the law.
tgt_text: lehono afrika borwa ke naga yeo tshepedišo ya toka e beilwego diatleng tša dikgorotsheko tšeo di ikemego le boahlodi bjoo bo laolwago fela ke molaotheo.

src_text: south africa today is a country where the administration of justice is vested in independent courts and a judiciary that is subject only to the constitution.
tgt_text: re phela ka gare ga naga fao bohle ba nago le tokelo ya go ya dikgorotshekong go kgotsofatša ditokelo tša bona.

src_text: we live in a country where everyone has the right to approach the courts for the fulfilment of their rights.
tgt_text: re dula ka nageng yeo ditšhaba di kago tleima semolao naga yeo ba tlošitšwego go yona ka kgapeletšo, le fao batho goba malapa a šireleditšwego kgahlanong le khudušo ye e sego ya semolao go tšwa magaeng a bona.

src_text: we live in a country where communities can stake a legal claim on land they were forcefully moved from, and where individuals or families are protected against arbitrary eviction from their homes.
tgt_text: re dula ka nageng yeo bohle ba dumeletšwego go phethagatša ka tokologo setšo sa bona.

src_text: we live in a country where everyone is permitted to freely practise their culture and traditions.
tgt_text: ke naga yeo mang le mang a nago le tokelo ya go ipelaetša ka tokologo mererong ya mekgatlo ya leago, ya sepolitiki le mererong ye mengwe ka nageng.

src_text: it is a country where anyone can freely protest in support of social, political and other causes anywhere.
tgt_text: tokelo ya molaotheo wa rena e theilwe godimo ga mmušo wo o nago le maikarabelo, fao boetapele bja mmušo bo ikarabelago bahlankeding ba palamente e lego bona kemedi yeo e kgethilwego ke batho go ba emela ka palamenteng.

src_text: our constitutional dispensation is premised on accountable government, where the executive is answerable to the people and where parliament is representative of the people.
tgt_text: ke naga yeo molao o šomago ka go lekana go badudi ba bangwe le ba bangwe.

src_text: it is a country where the law applies equally to any citizen.
tgt_text: bjale re na le mmušo wa batho, wo o šomelago batho, wo gape o bušwago ke batho.

src_text: we now have a government of the people, for the people and by the people.
tgt_text: ge pušo ya kgethollo e be e bontšha ka makoko molaotheo wa yona wa semorafe lefaseng ka moka mengwaga ye 60 ya go feta, e be e nagana gore e tla kgotlelela.

src_text: when the apartheid regime triumphantly paraded its racist constitution to the world 60 years ago, it had misplaced confidence that it would endure.
tgt_text: ka gare ga lengwalo la go ya go verwoerd le le sego la fetolwa kgwedi pele ga ge repabliki e hlongwa, nelson mandela o be a tiišetša kgano ya mokgatlo wa tokologo ya gore ga ba nyake go ba le repabliki yeo e bušwago feela ke bathobašweu.

src_text: in an unanswered letter to verwoerd a month before the republic was declared, nelson mandela affirmed the liberation movement’s rejection of the forcibly imposed white republic.
tgt_text: o rile ga go na molaotheo goba mohuta wa mmušo wo o kwanelwago ka ntle ga go kgathatema ga batho ba maafrika wo o tla retwago gore o na le botho.

src_text: he said that no constitution or form of government decided without the participation of the african people would enjoy moral validity.
tgt_text: go bile fela bjalo, ga go na mokgwa woo o šitišago ditokelo tša batho woo o kago kgotlelelwa.

src_text: indeed no system that entrenches the systematic denial of people’s rights can be sustained.
tgt_text: le ge e le gore e bile mengwagasome ya ka godimo ga ye meraro pele dinyakwa tša mokgatlo wa tokologo di fihlelelwa, mafelelong re fihleletše tokologo ya rena.

src_text: though it would be over three decades before the demands of the liberation movement were met, we eventually won our freedom.
tgt_text: ge re lahlela molaotheo wa kgethollo ka ditlakaleng tša histori, re ineetše go molaotheo wo moswa le go maitshwaro a maswa.

src_text: in relegating the apartheid constitution to the dustbin of history, we committed ourselves to a new constitution and a new set of values.
tgt_text: ge ke be ke eme ka lefoko lekgotla la molaotheo mengwaga ye 25 ya go feta, ke rile molaotheo wa rena o swanetše go se be mantšu fela ao a ngwadilwego pampiring; eupša o swanetše go ba kgonthe maphelong a setšhaba sa rena.

src_text: when i addressed the constitutional assembly 25 years ago, i said our constitution must become more than words on a page; it must become a reality in the lives of our people.
tgt_text: ntle le gore re dire bjalo, tokomane ye ya kgatelopele le khuetšo ye kgolo e tla dirwa gore e se sa ba ya maleba le mohola.

src_text: unless we do so, this progressive and revolutionary document will be rendered irrelevant and meaningless.
tgt_text: re tšere sephetho kgale gore re nyaka go ba setšhaba sa mohuta mang.

src_text: we have long decided what kind of society we want to be.
tgt_text: ke setšhaba seo se hlomilwego ka gare ga seriti sa batho, tekano, tokologo le go se kgetholle.

src_text: it is a society rooted in human dignity, equality, freedom and nondiscrimination.
tgt_text: lebaka la kotara ya ngwagakgolo re be re šoma go aga setšhaba se se bjalo.

src_text: for a quarter of a century we have worked to build such a society.
tgt_text: re dirile kgatelopele ye e sa ganetšegego, eupša re sa ntše re na le ditlhohlo tše ntši ebile go sa ntše go na le mošomo wo montši wo o swanetšego go dirwa.

src_text: we have made undeniable progress, but we still have many challenges and there is much work still to be done.
tgt_text: ge re keteka segopotšo sa kamogelo ya molaotheo wa rena wa temokrasi, a re gopoleng gore re tšwa kgole bjang fao re bego re le ka fase ga mmušo wa semorafe, wa tirišompe, wo o re amogilego dithoto le dinaga le wo o kilego wa re bea ka fase ga kgatello.

src_text: as we mark the anniversary of the adoption of our democratic constitution, let us remember what a decisive break it was with the system underpinned by racism, exploitation, dispossession and oppression that had come before.
tgt_text: gape a re gopoleng gore go mo magetleng a rena go dira gore pono ye e lego ka gare ga molaotheo wa rena e be ya nnete.

src_text: let us also remember that it is up to us to make the vision contained in our constitution a reality.
tgt_text: afrika borwa e phegelela go phethagatša pono vukuzenzele unnamed mengwaga ye 60 ya go feta, ka la 31 mopitlo 1961, afrika borwa ya kgethollo e bile repa bliki, ya kgaola kamano ya yona le mmušo wa britain.

src_text: the youth are our greatest asset vukuzenzele unnamed on june 16th 1976, the youth of soweto and other parts of the country rose up against the iniquity of bantu education.
tgt_text: bafsa ba bohlokwa kudu go rena vukuzenzele unnamed ka la 16 phupu 1976, bafsa ba soweto le ba ka dikarolong tše dingwe tša naga ba ile ba ikemela kgahlanong le tlhokego ya tekatekano ye e bego e bakwa ke seo se bitšwago thuto ya bathobaso (bantu education).

src_text: on that day and in the days that followed, many lost their lives.
tgt_text: ka letšatši leo le ka matšatši ao a latetšego, batho ba bantši ba ile ba lahlegelwa ke maphelo.

src_text: they were killed by a callous regime that had little regard for black lives and thought nothing of opening fire on unarmed, uniformed schoolchildren.
tgt_text: ba ile ba bo lawa ke mmušo wo mošoro wo o bego sa kgathalelego maphelo a bathobaso le go se nagana selo ge o thuntšha bana ba sekolo bao ba bego ba se ba itlhama ba bego ba apere yunifomo.

src_text: these events hardened international opinion against the apartheid regime and gave further impetus to the liberation struggle.
tgt_text: ditiragalo tše di ile tša maatlafatša maikutlo a bodi tšhabatšhaba kgahlanong le mmušo wa kgethologanyo le go tsenya letsogo go tšwela pele go ntwa kgahlanong le kgethologanyo.

src_text: young people have always been at the forefront of social protest, from the antiauthoritarian protests in latin america in the late 1950s, to the protests across africa in the late 1960s.
tgt_text: bafsa ga ba thome go eta pele megwanto ya setšhaba, go thoma ka megwanto ya go lwantšha bobušanoši ka latin america ka mengwa geng ya bo 1950, le ka me gwanto ya go ralala le afrika ka bophara ka mengwa geng ya bo 1960. histori ka go tshephagala e bega seabe seo se kgathi lwego ke moloko wa bafsa ba 1976 go lesolo la baithuti la boditšhabatšhaba le ntlha kemo ya lona kgahlanong le kgatelelo le tlhokego ya toka.

src_text: history faithfully records the contribution of the generation of 1976 to the international student movement and its stance against oppression and injustice.
tgt_text: tiragalo ye e sego ya ka ya bonwa yeo e diregilego mengwaga ye 45 ye e fetilego e tšwela pele go ketelwa go ralala le afrika le lefaseng ka bophara.

src_text: this historic event 45 years ago continues to be commemorated across africa and the world.
tgt_text: ka fao go tloga go kweša bohloko ge tsebo ya ditiragalo tša la 16 phupu di hwelela go bafsa ba maafrika borwa.

src_text: it is therefore disturbing that knowledge of june 16th is diminishing among young south africans.
tgt_text: se se tloga se le ka tsela yeo gareng ga bao ba bitšwago moloko wa z, goba bafsa bao ba belegwego magareng ga ngwaga wa 1997 le 2015. dinyakišišo tša maikutlo ka ga maafrika borwa tša 2019/2020 tšeo di phatlaladitšwego ke lekgotla la dinyakišišo ka ga dithu tamahlale tša batho di hweditše gore palo ye e lego kgauswi le 40% ya moloko wa z ga se ya kwa ka ga ditiragalo tša histori tša la 16 phupu.

src_text: this is particularly so among the socalled generation z, or young people born between 1997 and 2015. the 2019/2020 south african social attitudes survey published by the human sciences research council found that close to 40% of generation z has not heard of the historical events of june 16th.
tgt_text: persente ya go lekana le ye e kwele ka ga yona eupša e tseba gannyane goba ga e tsebe selo ka ga yona.

src_text: a similar percentage has heard about it but knows very little or nothing about it.
tgt_text: le ge go le bjale, dinyakišišo di hweditše gape gore bafsa ba moloko wo ba lokologile go ithuta ka ga ditiragalo tša historing tše bohlokwa ebile ba dumela go bohlokwa bja tšona bjo bo tšwelago pele.

src_text: nevertheless, the survey also found that young people of this generation are open to learning about key historical events and believe in their continued importance.
tgt_text: re swanetše go dira tše ntši bjalo ka naga go netefatša gore molaetša wa 1976 o fetišwa ka botshephegi.

src_text: we need to do more as a country to ensure that the message of 1976 is transmitted faithfully.
tgt_text: a ke maikarabelo mmogo a mmušo, dikolo, dihlongwa tša thuto ya godingwana, batswadi, malapa, baopedi, badiragatši, le batho ka moka setšhabeng.

src_text: this is a collective responsibility of government, schools, tertiary institutions, parents, families, musicians, artists, and all of society.
tgt_text: moloko wo o belegwego ka morago ga kgethologanyo o feleleditše o hweditše naga yeo e nago le molaotheo wa temokrasi le fao ditokologo tše bohlokwa di šireleditšwego.

src_text: the generation that was born after apartheid ended inherited a country with a democratic constitution and where fundamental freedoms are protected.
tgt_text: dibaka tšeo bafsa ba bathobaso ba nago le tšona lehono bobedi di fapana kudu ebile di kaonafaditšwe kudu.

src_text: the opportunities young black people have today are both vastly different and greatly improved.
tgt_text: go dira gore kanegelo ya la 16 phupu e phele ke segopotšo go moloko wa lehono ka ga ditšhitelego tše kgolo tšeo di dirilwego go hwetša tokologo ya bona.

src_text: keeping the story of june 16th alive is a reminder to today’s generation of the great sacrifices made to secure their freedom.
tgt_text: letšatši la bafsa ke segopotšo sa maatla a magolo le tšhoganetšo ya gore bafsa ba swanetše go itirela bokamoso bjo bokaone.

src_text: youth day is a reminder of the immense power and agency that young people have to create a better future for themselves.
tgt_text: mathata a bafsa ka afrika borwa ke a mantši lehono.

src_text: the struggles of young people in south africa today are many.
tgt_text: bafsa ba tšwetše pele go eta pele ntwa ya go lwela ditokelo tša bona, ba ka be ba lwela thuto ya bona goba ba le kgahlanong le ditiro tša go se nyakege setšhabeng tša go swana le dikgaruru tša bong.

src_text: young people have remained at the forefront of activism, whether in pursuit of free education or against social ills like genderbased violence.
tgt_text: lehono se segolo seo bafsa ba se lwelago ke tlhokego ya mešomo, yeo e mpefetšego kudu ka fase ga seemo sa leuba la covid19.

src_text: today the greatest struggle young people wage is against unemployment, which has worsened under the covid19 pandemic.
tgt_text: go hlomela bafsa dibaka tše ntši, le go fihlelela dibaka tše, ke selo seo mmušo o se beilego pele kudu.

src_text: creating more opportunities for young people, and access to these opportunities, is government’s foremost priority.
tgt_text: se sengwe le se sengwe seo re se dirago bjalo ka mmušo se tsenya letsogo go kaonafatšeng maphelo a bafsa.

src_text: everything that we do as a government contributes towards improving the lives of young people.
tgt_text: go lwantšhaba le tlhokego ya mešomo go bafsa go nyaka gore re akgofiše kgolo ya ekonomi, kudukudu ka makaleng ao a nyakago bašomi ba bantši, le go aga bokgoni bja mmušo gore o kgone go phethagatša mošomo wa ona wa tlhabollo.

src_text: tackling youth unemployment requires accelerating economic growth, particularly in labourintensive sectors, and building the capability of the state to fulfil its developmental role.
tgt_text: re tšwetša pele lenaneo le ka go diriša ditsenogare tšeo di nepišitšwego.

src_text: we are also driving this agenda through targeted interventions.
tgt_text: tšona di akaretša tlhohleletšo ya tlhomo ya mešomo ka mopresidente, yeo e fanego ka dibaka tša mešomo le thekgo ya go iphediša ga bafsa ba bantši.

src_text: these include the presidential employment stimulus, which has provided work opportunities and livelihoods support for many young people.
tgt_text: re tsebagaditše semmušo mehutahuta ya magato a tlaleletšo a go hloma dibaka tša mešomo, a go maatlafatša tlhabollo ya mabokgoni, a go thekga bafsa bao ba hlomago dikgwebo le go kgontšha go kgatha tema ka botlalo ga bafsa ka ekonoming.

src_text: we have launched a range of additional measures to create opportunities, enhance skills development, support young entrepreneurs and enable the full participation of young people in the economy.
tgt_text: se se akaretšwa go hlongwaga netweke ya bosetšha ba ya taolo ya dibaka, ya bafsa ba afrika borwa, go dira gore go be bonolo gore bafsa ba bone le go fihlelela dibaka le go hwetša thekgo ye e bonagalago gore ba hwetša dibaka tša go tsena ka mmarakeng wa bašomi.

src_text: this includes the establishment of a national pathway management network, sa youth, to make it easier for young people to view and access opportunities and receive active support to find pathways into the labour market.
tgt_text: tšona di gareng ga dilo tšeo di beilwego pele ke tsenogare ya mopresidente ya tlhomo ya mešomo ya bafsa ya mopresiudente, yeo e tsebagaditšwego dibeke pele ga ge re tsena go kiletšo ya mesepelo ngwageng wo o fetilego yeo bjale mo leba keng le e tsenego go phetha gatšo ka botlalo.

src_text: these are among the priorities of the presidential youth employment intervention, which was launched just weeks before we entered a national lockdown last year and which is now entering full implementation.
tgt_text: tsenogare ya mipreside nte ya tlhomo ya mešomo ya bafsa e hlomilwe go kwešišo ya gore go raro lla mathata a tlhokego ya mešomo ka bafsa e nya kago gore go be le mona gano wa maithomelo le tirišano ye e tiilego go ralala le setšhaba.

src_text: the presidential youth employment intervention was built on the understanding that addressing the youth unemployment crisis requires innovative thinking and strong partnerships across society.
tgt_text: maikemišetšo a yona mafelelong ke go mekgwa ye e šomago, e ka ba ka tlhabo llong ya mabokgoni goba ka go melawana ye e šomago ya mmaraka wa bašomi, le go di beakanya gore di fihlelele batho ba bantši ka fao go kgonagalago.

src_text: its ultimate objective is to find models that work, whether in skills development or active labour market policies, and to scale these rapidly to reach as many young people as possible.
tgt_text: se bohlokwa kudu ke gore, e lemoga gore bafsa ba swanetše go ba bohlokwa go matsapa a mangwe le a mangwe a go thekgalenaneo la tlhomo ya mešomo ya bafsa.

src_text: most importantly, it recognises that young people must be at the centre of any effort to boost youth employment.
tgt_text: bafsa ke thoto ya rena ye bohlokwa, le sebetša sa rena se segolo mo ntweng ye.

src_text: young people are our greatest asset, and our greatest weapon in this fight.
tgt_text: re reta kgotlelelo ya mofsa yo mongwe le yo mongwe yo a kgathago tema ya gagwe go aga le go hlabolla naga ye.

src_text: we salute the resilience of every young person playing their part to build and develop this country.
tgt_text: bafsa ba rena ba ithaopa ka ditšhabeng tša rena, ba aga naga ya rena ka go diriša tlhohleletšo ya tlhomo ya mešomo ka mopresidente, ba itirela dikgwebo tša bona le go ithuta gore ba be ba bakaone bophelong.

src_text: they are the young people volunteering in our communities, building our country through the presidential employment stimulus, running their own businesses and studying to better themselves.
tgt_text: ke bafsa bao ba itirelago bokamoso bja bona gomme ba dira seo ba na le ba malapa a bona.

src_text: they are the young people who are forging their own path and bringing their families along with them.
tgt_text: re reta bafsa bao ba tšwe lago pele go kaonafatša maphelo a bona.

src_text: we salute young people who keep working to improve their lives.
tgt_text: bafsa ba kgatha tema ya bona; ba hloka mmušo, le ka nnete setšhaba ka moka, gore se kgatha tema ya sona.

src_text: young people are doing their part; they need government, and indeed all of society, to do ours.
tgt_text: naga ya rena e mo see mong se boima kudu, eupša re šoma letšatši le lengwe le le lengwe go katološa dikholofelo tša rena.

src_text: our country is going through the most difficult of times, but we are working daily to expand the frontiers of hope.
tgt_text: re bona go tšwelela ga kgolo ya ekonomi, gomme re na le boitshepo bja gore se se tla tliša dibaka tše kaone go bohle.

src_text: we are seeing the green shoots of growth in our economy, and are confident this will translate to better opportunities for all.
tgt_text: bafsa ba bohlokwa kudu go rena vukuzenzele unnamed ka la 16 phupu 1976, bafsa ba soweto le ba ka dikarolong tše dingwe tša naga ba ile ba ikemela kgahlanong le tlhokego ya tekatekano ye e bego e bakwa ke seo se bitšwago thuto ya bathobaso (bantu education).

src_text: soes must drive economic growth and transformation vukuzenzele unnamed for some years now, south africa’s stateowned enterprises (soes) have mostly been associated in the public eye with state capture, financial mismanagement and inefficiency.
tgt_text: disoe di swanetše go laola kgolo ya ekonomi le phetogo vukuzenzele unnamed bjale e šetše e le me ngwaga ye mma lwa ye dikgwebo tša mmušo (disoe) mo setšhabeng di amantšhwa le ditiragalo tša go goga mmušo ka nko le tšhomi šobošaedi ya ditšhelete le go hloka bokgoni.

src_text: in addition to needing regular bailouts from government, some of the country’s biggest and most important stateowned companies have been struggling to meet their mandates.
tgt_text: godimo ga go kgopela thušo gantši go mmušo go di ntšha ka gare ga dikoloto, tše dingwe tša dikhamphani tše dikgolo tša mmušo tše gape di lego bohlokwa di dutše di palelwa ke go phethagatša ditaolelo tša tšona.

src_text: these soes should be at the forefront of economic and social transformation.
tgt_text: disoe tše di swanetše go ba tšona tšeo di etilego pele phetogo ya ekonomi le leago.

src_text: they are responsible for providing the infrastructure and the services on which the economy depends, whether it be in the generation of electricity, commuter transport, water provision, freight logistics or telecommunications.
tgt_text: ke maikarabelo a tšona go aba infrastraktšha le ditirelo tšeo ekonomi e e thekgilego go tšona, e ka ba ka magorong a tšweletšo ya mohlagase, dinamelwa tša bašomi, kabo ya meetse, taolo ya dinamelwa tša merwalo goba dikgokagano tša megala.

src_text: our approach to state ownership is informed by the need for the effective functioning of key network industries, such as energy and ports, and by the need to ensure that the basic needs of all south africans, particularly the poor, can be met.
tgt_text: mokgwa wa rena go dithoto tša mmušo o hlahlwa ke tlhokego ya go šoma ga dii ntasteri tša mananeo a mago lo a enetši le maemakepe, le ka tlhokego ya go kgonthiša gore dinyakwa tša motheo tša maafrika borwa ka moka, kudu bahloki, di a fihlelelwa.

src_text: we firmly believe that public ownership is necessary in critical sectors of the economy and that the country needs robust soes that are able to drive economic growth and transformation.
tgt_text: re tshepa kudu gore go ba beng ba thoto ya mmušo go a hlokega mo makaleng a bohlokwa a ekonomi le gore naga e hloka disoe tše maatla tšeo di kgonago go sepetša kgolo ya ekonomi le phetogo.

src_text: this is particularly the case in the delivery of public goods such as electricity and water, where soes are able to pursue a developmental mandate in the public interest as opposed to a purely commercial one.
tgt_text: se gantši se ba bjalo mo go abeng dithoto tša mmušo tša go swana le mohlagase le meetse, moo disoe di kgonago go latela taolelo ya kaonafatšo mo kgahlagelong ya setšhaba kgahlanong le ye e lego fela ya kgwebo.

src_text: that is why we have made it a priority of this government to turn these companies around to root out corruption, improve their governance and enable them to play the role they should in driving economic growth and employment creation.
tgt_text: ke ka moo re dirilego gore go be bohlokwa go mmušo wo go fetoša dikhamphani tše go tumola bomenetša ka medu, go kaonafatša taolo ya tšona le go di kgontšha go kgatha tema yeo di swanetšego go e kgatha ka go sepetša kgolo ya ekonmi le go hlola mešomo.

src_text: to this end, we have embarked upon a number of reforms to strengthen these soes so that they can produce the results that the country needs and expects.
tgt_text: go fihla gonabjale, re thomile dikaonafatšo tše mmalwa go matlafatša disoe tše gore di tšweletše dipoelo tšeo naga e di nyakago gape e di letetšego.

src_text: one of the most important reforms is in the energy sector.
tgt_text: ye nngwe ya diphetogo tše bohlokwa e ka lekaleng la enetši.

src_text: we have begun the process of restructuring eskom into three different soes, responsible for generation, transmission and distribution, respectively.
tgt_text: re thomile tshepetšo ya go beakanya lefsa eskom ka diseo tše tharo tša go fa pana, mo ye nngwe e tla bago le maikarabelo a tšweletšo ya mohlagase, ye nngwe yaba le maikarabelo a kgokagano gomme ya mafelelo yaba le maikarabelo a phatlalatšo, ka tatelano yeo.

src_text: this is because the previous structure of eskom was illsuited for a changing energy landscape.
tgt_text: se ke ka lebaka la gore sebopego sa go feta sa eskom se be se se maleba go fetoša maemo a enetši.

src_text: it had become inefficient and costly and was not sufficiently transparent.
tgt_text: se be se palelwa ke go šoma gape se hloka tšhelete ye ntši kudu ebile se be se sa beye dilo pe peneng mo go lekanego.

src_text: the establishment of a transmission entity in particular will mean that eskom will be able to purchase power from a broader range of providers, both private and public.
tgt_text: go hlongwa ga lekala la kgokagano kudu go tla ra gore eskom e tla kgona go reka mohlagase go baabi ba bantši ba ditirelo, bobedi ba praebete le ba setšhaba.

src_text: this will improve transparency, increase competitiveness and promote the purchase of lowestcost electricity.
tgt_text: se se tla kaonafatša go bea dilo pepeneng, sa oketša phadišano ya katlego le go hohleletša go reka mohlagase wa theko ya fase.

src_text: through the renewable energy independent power producers programme, there has been significant private investment in energy generation.
tgt_text: ka lenaneo la tšweletšo ya mohalagase la go ikema la enetši ya go tšošološwa, re bone legoro la praebete le dira dipeeletšo tše dintši tša go tšweletša mohlagase.

src_text: with the proposal to raise the licencing exemption for embedded generation – where companies produce electricity for themselves and other commercial users – from 1mw to 100mw, we can expect even more private investment.
tgt_text: ka tšhišinyo ya go oketša go se akaretšwe ga laesense ya tšweletšo ye e tsentšwego – moo dikhamphani di tšweletšago mohlagase wa tšona le badiriši ba bangwe ba kgwebo – go tšwa go 1mw go ya go 100mw, re ka letela peeletšo ya praebete ye nngwe ye ntši.

src_text: this is vital at a time when the country is suffering from severe and sustained electricity shortages and where neither eskom nor the state is able to invest in new generation capacity.
tgt_text: se se bohlokwa ka nako yeo naga e lego bothateng bjo bo šoro bja go hlaelela mohlagase wa go swarelela le moo eskom goba mmušo ba ka se kgonego go beeletša go maatla a tšweletšo a mafsa.

src_text: importantly, these reforms will give eskom the space to address its financial and operational challenges.
tgt_text: se bohlokwa, dikaonafatšo tše di tla fa eskom sebaka sa go šogana le ditlhohlo tša ditšhelete le tirišo.

src_text: another critical reform is the establishment of the national ports authority as an independent subsidiary of transnet.
tgt_text: kaonafatšo ye nngwe ye bohlokwa ke go hlongwa ga taolo ya maemakepe a setšhaba bjalo ka tlaleletšo ya go ikema ya transnet.

src_text: this a crucial part of transnet’s broader strategy to revitalise our logistics infrastructure.
tgt_text: se se karolo ya bohlokwa ya peakanyo ye kgolo ya transet ya go mpshafatša infrastraktšha ya go rwala dithoto.

src_text: transnet plans to invest r100 billion over the next five years in upgrading its infrastructure across the ports system.
tgt_text: transnet e nyaka go beeletša r100 bilione mo mengwageng ye mehlano ka go kaonafatša infrastraktšha mo mafelong ka moka a maemakepe.

src_text: this will make our ports more efficient and our exports more competitive, and benefit the entire economy.
tgt_text: se se tla dira gore maemakepe a rena a šome gabotse le dikišontle tša rena di be le mohola, gomme se se tla hola ekonomi ka moka.

src_text: for the ordinary consumer, it will mean reduced prices in the long term for many of our goods.
tgt_text: se se tla hola bareki ka go ba fokoletša ditefišo ge ba reka dithoto mo nakong ye e tlago.

src_text: for our exporters, it will mean greater competitiveness in global markets.
tgt_text: se se tla hola baišantle ba rena ka ge se tla ba thuša gore ba kgone go rekišetša mebaraka ye megolo lefaseng.

src_text: as our exports grow, our economy will expand and create more jobs.
tgt_text: ge kišontle ya rena e gola, ekonomi ya rena le yona e tla gola ya hlola mešomo ye mentši.

src_text: more efficient ports will make the entire economy work better – and as port volumes increase, jobs will be created at the ports themselves.
tgt_text: maemakepe a bo kgoni a mantši a tla dira gore ekonomi ka moka e šome gabotse – gomme ge bontši bja maemakepe bo oketšega, go tla hlolega mešomo mo maemakepeng ka bowona.

src_text: establishing the national ports authority as a transnet subsidiary with its own board will, among other things, mean that revenues generated by the ports can be used to replace old equipment and upgrade and expand our ports, work which has been delayed for more than a decade.
tgt_text: go hlola taolo ya maemakepe a setšhaba bjalo ka tlaleletšo ya transnet ka boto ya yona, gare ga tše dingwe, e ra gore matlotlo ao a dirilwego ke maemakepe a ka šomišwago go fetoša didirišwa tša kgale le go mpshafatša le go katološa maemakepe a rena, e lego mošomo wo o ditelegile ka sebaka sa go feta mengwaga ye lesome.

src_text: among other things, these reforms will encourage greater private investment in the country’s economic infrastructure.
tgt_text: gare ga tše dingwe, di mpshafatšo tše di tla hlo hleletša legoro la praebete go dira dipeeletšo tše dintši go infrastraktšha ya ekonomi ya naga.

src_text: some people have expressed concerns that this will diminish the importance or reduce the value of soes.
tgt_text: batho ba bangwe ba tšweleditše matshwenyego a gore se se tla tšeela mmušo maatla goba sa fokotša mohola wa disoe.

src_text: in fact, the contrary is true.
tgt_text: gabotse, se ga se nnete.

src_text: these reforms will ensure that while strategic infrastructure remains firmly in state hands, our soes will become more efficient and the industries they support will become more competitive.
tgt_text: dimphsafatšo tše di tla kgo nthiša gore ge infrastraktšha ye e beakantšwego e dula ka polokego ka diatleng tša mmušo, disoe tša rena di tla šoma ka bokgoni gomme diintasteri tšeo di di thekgago di tla kgona go phadišana ka katlego kudu.

src_text: equally, these reforms are important to ensure that soes implement their broader developmental mandates to support all citizens and the economy.
tgt_text: go no swana, dimpshafatšo tše di bohlo kwa go kgonthiša gore disoe di phethagatša ditaolelo tša tšona tša kaonafatšo ya go phatlalala go thekga badudi ka moka le ekonomi.

src_text: our policy remains that soes must play a crucial developmental role in supporting the growth of our economy.
tgt_text: dipholisi tša rena le bjale di sa re disoe di swanetše go kgatha tema ye bohlokwa go thekga kgolo ya ekonomi ya rena.

src_text: our task is to place them on a sound footing, so that they can serve their ultimate shareholders – the south african people.
tgt_text: disoe di swanetše go laola kgolo ya ekonomi le phetogo vukuzenzele unnamed bjale e šetše e le me ngwaga ye mma lwa ye dikgwebo tša mmušo (disoe) mo setšhabeng di amantšhwa le ditiragalo tša go goga mmušo ka nko le tšhomi šobošaedi ya ditšhelete le go hloka bokgoni.

src_text: support for businesses and workers vukuzenzele unnamed starting and building a business is a lot like raising a family.
tgt_text: mmušo o thekga dikgwebo le bašomi vukuzenzele unnamed go thoma kgwebo le go e godiša go swana kudu le go godiša lapa.

src_text: it takes time, patience, con stant support and consistent nurturing from infancy to maturity.
tgt_text: e nyaka nako, bopelotelele, thekgo ka dinako tšohle le go e hlabolla ntle le go taboša go tloga ge e sa thoma go fihla ge e ikema ka boyona.

src_text: for many business owners, seeing a business that you grew from scratch struggling to survive, or even being forced to close its doors, is heartbreaking.
tgt_text: go bengdikgwebo ba bantši, go bona kgwebo yeo o e godišitšego go tloga mathomong e goga ka kgara, goba e gapeletšega go phu hlama, ke lerumo pelong.

src_text: since the onset of the covid19 pandemic, this has sadly been the situation facing many businesses both large and small, not just in our country but around the world.
tgt_text: go tloga mola go thomang leuba la covid19, ka madimabe ke sona seemo seo dikgwebo tše ntši, tše kgolo le tše nnyane, di le baganego le sona ebile seemo se ga se diragale fela ka mo na geng ya gaborena eupša se direga lefaseng ka bophara.

src_text: the pandemic and the meas ures we have had to take to contain the spread of the virus have had a detrimental impact on businesses.
tgt_text: leuba le, gotee le magato ao re ilego ra swanela ke go a latela go laola go phatlalala ga baerase ye a bile le ditlamorago tše mpe godimo ga dikgwebo.

src_text: in dealing with the pandemic we have sought to adopt an evidencebased approach in both policy and practice, con sidering scientific research, clinical expertise and capabil ities, and impact on all sectors of the population.
tgt_text: mo matsapeng a rena a go kalokana le leuba le, re ile ra diriša lemanoga la go ikala godimo ga tshedimošo le bo hlatse bjo kgobokeditšwego go bobedi pholisi le go phe thagatšwa ga yona, go sekegela diphatišišo tša saenthefiki, tsebo le mabokgoni a tša booki, le ditla morago tša lemanoga le mafapheng ka moka a setšhaba.

src_text: we have sought to have a balance between saving lives and preserving livelihoods.
tgt_text: re lekile ka fao re ka kgo nang go hlola tekatekano magareng ga go phološa ma phelo a batho le go šireletša mekgwa ya bona ya go iphediša.

src_text: we have sought to mitigate the impact of the successive lockdown restrictions on people’s livelihoods, or risk a second and possibly worse epidemic of poverty and hunger in future.
tgt_text: re lekile ka fao re ka kgo nang go fediša ditlamorago tša dikiletšo tša mesepelo ka go latelana go lebeletšwe mekgwa yeo batho ba iphedišago ka yona, go se dire bjalo re be re sena kgetho ge e se fela go ipea kotsing ya go welwa ke leuba le lengwe gape leo go ka kgona galago gore le be le šoro kudu ebago leuba la bohloki le la tlala kamoso.

src_text: in the earliest days last year, we introduced measures such as the covid temporary employer/employee relief scheme (ters), the covid19 loan guarantee scheme and various mechanisms to support small businesses to provide immediate and shortterm relief to burdened employees and business owners.
tgt_text: mo matšatšing a mathomo a ngwaga wa go feta, re tsebagaditše magato a go swana le setlamo sa covid19 sa nakwana sa kimollo ya bengmešong/bašomedi (ters), setlamo sa covid19 sa kgonthišišo ya dikadimo le magato a go fapafa pana a go thekga dikgwebopotlana le go aba kimollo ya semee tseng le ya nakwana go bašo medi le bengdikgwebo bao ba tlaletšwego.

src_text: in addition, the special covid19 social relief of distress grant and broadening access to existing social grants provided lifelines to indigent individuals and families.
tgt_text: godimo ga mo, thušo ya tšhelete ya moswananoši ya kimollo ya masetlapelo a covid19 setšhabeng le go dira gore dithušo tša tšhelete ya leago di atišwe nageng ka bophara e thušitše go hola bahloki ka o tee ka o tee le malapa.

src_text: through these interventions we were able to mitigate the worst effects of the pandemic, preventing the closure of many businesses and the loss of even further jobs.
tgt_text: ka magato a re kgonne go bea ka fase ga taolo ditlamorago tše šoro tša leuba le, ra efoga go tswalelwa ga dikgwebo tše ntši le go loba mešomo ye mengwe ye mentši.

src_text: they pro vided a firm foundation for the economic reconstruction and recovery plan that we launched in october last year.
tgt_text: ka magato a re bile le motheo wo tieletšego wa leano la kagolefsa ya ikonomi le go boetšwa sekeng ga yona leo le tsebaga ditšwego ka diphalane ngwaga wa go feta.

src_text: as part of that plan, we introduced the presidential employment stimulus to provide income and livelihood support to millions of beneficiaries.
tgt_text: bjalo ka karolo ya leano le, re tsebagaditše tsošološo ya mešomo ka mopresidente go fana ka letseno le thekgo ya mekgwa ya go iphediša go thuša dimi lione tša batho bao ba holegilego lenaneong le.

src_text: through the stimulus, over 300 000 young people have been placed as school assistants.
tgt_text: ka lona lenaneo le la tsošološo ya mešomo, baswa ba go feta 300 000 ba thwetšwe bjalo ka bathuši ba ka dikolong.

src_text: more than 100 000 subsistence farmers are registered on the firstever database of its kind where they have access to technical support.
tgt_text: balemi ba go iphediša ka temo ba go feta 100 000 ba ngwadišitšwe ka gare ga lenaneo la mathomothomo la go swana le le noši fao ba kgonang go fihlelela thekgo ya sethekniki.

src_text: more than 30 000 young people have been given opportunities in the cultural, creative and sports sectors.
tgt_text: baswa ba go feta 30 000 ba filwe menyetla mafapheng a setšo, boihlamelo le dipapadi.

src_text: young professionals have been given opportunities in infrastructure development, healthcare, environmental conservation and a number of other sectors.
tgt_text: baswa ba go ba le tsebo ba filwe me nyetla tlhabollong ya mananeo kgoparara, tlhokomelo ya ma phelo, pabalelo ya tikologo le mafapha a mangwe a mantši.

src_text: there are promising indi cations that our economy is steadily recovering, with growth and job creation in a number of sectors, from manufacturing to mining to agriculture.
tgt_text: go nale ditaetšo tšeo di holofetšago tša gore ikonomi ya rena e ya kaonafala, ka kgolo le ka hlolego ya mešomo mo mafapheng a mantši, go thoma ka bohlami, tša meepo go fihla ka temo.

src_text: at the same time we know that this ‘bigger picture’ is cold comfort to workers and business owners who have suffered immeasurably over the past year and a half, and were hoping to see their situa tions improve as the economy slowly opened up.
tgt_text: go le bjalo re tseba gabotse gore segolothata tabeng ye ke go se dudišege ga bašomedi le bengdikgwebo bao ba hlorišitšwego go se lekane le selo tekanong ya go feta ngwaga le seripa, ebile ba be ba thoma go ba le tshepho ya go bona maemo a bona a kaonafala ge ikonomi e be e bulwa ka go nanya.

src_text: the rapid rise in infections being fueled by the new delta variant necessitated the imposing of tighter restric tions on the movement of persons, on the operation of certain businesses and on public gatherings, among others.
tgt_text: tlhatlogo ya go gola ka lebelo yeo e gakatšwago ke mohuta wo moswa wa baerase wa delta e dirile gore go be maleba go hloma dikiletšo tše tiišeditšwego letsogo ka leemaema la batho, ka go bulwa ga dikgwebo tše itšego le ka di kgobokano tša batho setšhabeng, magareng ga tše dingwe.

src_text: these were not been easy decisions to make, mindful of their impact on people’s livelihoods.
tgt_text: go be go se bonolo go tšea diphetho tše, ka ge go be go hlokometšwe ditlamorago tša tšona godimo ga mekgwa yeo batho ba iphedišago ka yona.

src_text: just as we did at the beginning of the pandemic, we engaged in deliberations with all social partners, business, labour and civil society to see what financially sustainable measures we could intro duce to support businesses and individuals in distress at this time.
tgt_text: go swana le ka fao re dirilego ka gona ge leuba le le thoma, re tsenetše dipoledišano le badirišani ba rena ka moka setšhabeng, dikgwebo, bašomi le mekgatlo ye lego setšha beng go bona gore ke magato a fe a go swarelela a ditšhelete ao re ka a tsebagatšago go thekga dikgwebo le batho ka noši tlalelong ye ba lego go yona ka nako ye.

src_text: the negotiations at the national economic development and labour council resulted in consen sus that the most practical and financially sustainable measure that can provide urgent relief is extending the covid19 ters scheme to sectors that have been affected by the adjusted level 4 restrictions.
tgt_text: ditherišano tša lekgotla la bosetšhaba la tlhabollo ya ikonomi le bašomi le dirile gore go fihlelelwe kwano ya gore magato ao a ka phethagalago gabonolo le a ditšhelete tša go swarelela tšeo di ka re tlišetšago kimollo ya ka pejana ke go oketša nako ya setlamo sa ters sa co vid19 go mafapha ao a angwego ke dikiletšo tšeo di fetošitšwego tša maemo a bone.

src_text: to support businesses whose operating licenses and per mits expired between march 2020 and june 2021, we are extending their validity until 31 december 2022. in addition, new business licenses or permits that are issued from the 1 july will also be valid until 31 december 2022, and no license fee will be payable.
tgt_text: go thekga dikgwebo tšeo e lego gore dilaesense le diphemiti tša tšona tša go šoma di feletšwe ke nako magareng ga hlakola 2020 le phupu 2021, re oketša nako ya tšona ya go ba molaong go fihla ka la 31 manthole 2022. godimo ga mo, dilaesense tše difsa tša dikgwebo goba diphemiti tšeo di lokolotšwego go thoma ka la 1 mosegamanye le tšona di tlo ba molaong go fihla ka la 31 manthole 2022, ebile go ka se lefišwe ditefišo dife goba dife tša dilaesense tšeo.

src_text: over the past year, we have also been working consist ently to protect vulnerable workers whose jobs were at risk, particularly in hardhit sectors like retail, food and beverage and the metals industry.
tgt_text: mo ngwageng wa go feta, re be re šoma ka tsela ye swanago go šireletša bašomedi bao ba lego kotsing bao mešomo ya bona e lego kotsing, kudu kudu mafapheng ao a amegilego kudu go swana le bobapatši, dijo le dino le intasteri ya tšhipi.

src_text: through processes facili tated by the commission for conciliation, mediation and arbitration, some 58 000 jobs have been saved.
tgt_text: ka ditshepedišo tšeo di sepe tšwago ke khomišene ya poelano, bonamodi le ditherišano (ccma), go phološitšwe mešomo ye ka bago 58 000. ka baka la ge leuba le le sa laetše gore le ka fela ka yona nako ye, dikgwebo le bašomi ba santše ba le kotsing.

src_text: with the pandemic show ing no immediate signs of ending, businesses and work ers remain vulnerable.
tgt_text: se se kgonagetše ka baka la dikwano tšeo di tsenetšwego le setšhaba tšeo di tšwelago pele go phethagala gore mmušo, dikgwebo le bašomi ba kgone go šoma mmogo go šire letša bašomi le dikgwebo kga hlanong le ditlamorago tša leuba le ikonoming ya naga.

src_text: it is thanks to the social com pacts we continue to forge that government, business and labour have been able to work together to buffer work ers and businesses from the pandemic’s harsh economic impacts.
tgt_text: gabjale, seo se tlago pele ga tšohle ke go phološa maphelo, le go netefatša gore re fana ka thekgo ye maleba, ka mo re ka kgonang ka gona, go efoga gore dikgwebo tše dingwe di tswalelwe le go efoga go loba mešomo ye mengwe ye mentši.

src_text: for now, our priority is saving lives, and ensuring that we provide the necessary support, within our means, to prevent more businesses closing down and more jobs being lost.
tgt_text: mmušo o thekga dikgwebo le bašomi vukuzenzele unnamed go thoma kgwebo le go e godiša go swana kudu le go godiša lapa.

src_text: inclusive communities critical to sa’s success vukuzenzele unnamed while the violence and destruction that engulfed parts of kwazulunatal and gauteng recently caused much damage to property and livelihoods, it also had a huge impact on the cohesion of our communities.
tgt_text: ditšhaba tše di kopanego di bohlokwa go katlego ya afrika borwa vukuzenzele unnamed le ge dikgaruru le tshe nyo tšeo di phulegi lego dikarolong tša kwazulunatal le gau teng kgauswanyana di hlotše tshenyo ye kgolo go thoto le mešomo, di bile gape le khuetšo ye kgolo go kopano ya ditšhaba tša rena.

src_text: this was most evident in the tragic events that took place in and around phoenix in ethekwini.
tgt_text: se se hlatsetšwe ka diti ragalo tša masetlapelo tšeo di diragatšego phoenix le ethekwini.

src_text: during some of the worst unrest in our democracy, and in a climate already thick with suspicion and paranoia, people that had lived sidebyside in relative peace turned on each other.
tgt_text: nakong ya dikhuduego tše mpe le go feta ka temokra sing ya rena, le klaemete yeo e šetšego e tletše ka dikgo nono le matšhogo, batho bao ba bego ba phela mmogo ka khutšo ba hlanogelane.

src_text: there is still much we have to unearth about the events that took place.
tgt_text: go sa na le tše ntši tšeo re swanetšego go di utolla ka ditiragalo tšeo di diragetšego.

src_text: the proliferation of fake news, doctored images and incorrect information has made it difficult to separate fact from fiction.
tgt_text: koketšego ya ditaba tša maaka, phetošo ya diswantšho le tshedimošo ya maaka di dirile gore go be bothata go aroganya ditaba tša nnete le tša maaka.

src_text: but we do know from official reports and personal accounts that people were racially profiled at illegal roadblocks, some people were pulled out of cars and beaten, and some were humiliated and degraded.
tgt_text: eupša re a tseba go tšwa go dipego tša semmušo le maikarabelo a batho gore batho ba be ba thiba ditsela ka lebaka la semorafe, batho ba bangwe ba be ba ntšhwa ka difatanageng tša bona gomme ba bethwa, gomme ba bangwe ba tlontlolotšwe le go nyatšwa.

src_text: several people were killed.
tgt_text: batho ba mmalwa ba bolailwe.

src_text: much of what has happened is the inevitable outcome when people take the law into their own hands.
tgt_text: bontši bja tše di diragetšego ke dipoelo tšeo di bego di se a letelwa tšeo batho ba e tšeelago molao matso gong.

src_text: vigilantism will not be tolerated in this country.
tgt_text: go itšeela malao matsogong go ka se kgotlelelwe ka mo nageng ye.

src_text: it is criminal and it is dangerous.
tgt_text: ke bosenyi gape go kotsi.

src_text: now that calm has been restored to the affected areas, our law enforcement agencies are investigating all acts of criminality.
tgt_text: bjale ka gore go okobetše mo mafelong ao a amegilego, mekgatlo ya rena ya phethagatšo ya molao e nyakišiša ditiro ka moka tša bosenyi.

src_text: a team of detectives has been assigned to deal with the murders and are working closely with local communities.
tgt_text: sehlopha sa banyakišiši se filwe mošomo wa go šogana le babolai gomme ba šomi šana kudu le badudi lefe long leo.
