src_text: before lodging a complaint with the gepo, a person must send a written complaint to either the gepf, the government pensions administration agency (gpaa) or their employer, and give them a chance to settle the matter.
tgt_text: "o swanetše go ba fa matšatši a 30 go phošolla phošo ye o e bonego.

src_text: "you must allow them 30 days to correct the issues that you identified.
tgt_text: ge, ka morago ga matšatši a 30, bothata bja gago bo tšwela pele go se rarollwe, o ka romela ngongorego ya gago go maditsela," gwa hlaloša ramabulana.

src_text: if, after 30 days, your issues remain unresolved, you can submit a complaint to the ombud," explains ramabulana.
tgt_text: maditsela a ka se amogele taba yeo ge e le gore go šetše go na le diphatišišo tša semmušo tšeo di dirwago go gongwe mabapi le yona.

src_text: the ombud cannot accept a case if there is already an official investigation underway elsewhere.
tgt_text: "mo dibekeng tše pedi go tloga ka letšatšikgwedi leo ngongorego e amogetšwego ka lona, gepo e tla šoma [taba yeo] gomme ya tsebiša mongo ngoregi ge eba e tla kgona go dira diphatišišo le go tšea sephetho ka ga taba yeo.

src_text: "within two weeks from the date that the complaint is received, the gepo will consider [the case] and inform the complainant whether it can investigate and decide on the matter."
tgt_text: go tliša dingongorego go gepf go nolofaditšwe vukuzenzele unnamed maloko, bašomi bao ba tšwelego phenšene le ba holegi ba sekhwama sa phenšene sa bašomi ba mmušo (gepf) bjale ba na le mo ba ka llelago gona ge e le gore ga se ba thabišwa ke tirelo ye ba e hwetšago.

src_text: asidi fast tracks school infrastructure more matshediso nkululeko ralo primary school is a good example of how positive results can be achieved when communities and government work together.
tgt_text: asidi e potlakiša phethagatšo ya infrastraktšha ya sekolo more matshediso nkululeko ralo primary school ke mohlala wo mobotse wa ka moo go ka fihlelelwago dipoelo tše dibotse ge setšhaba le mmušo ba šoma mmogo.

src_text: the school, based in mthatha in the eastern cape, first started operating in a garage at the home of community member nkululeko ralo, who it is named after.
tgt_text: sekolo, seo se lego mthatha ka kapa bohlabela, se thomile go šoma ka kara tšheng ka legae la le lengwe la leloko la setšhaba e lego nkululeko ralo, yoo se theeletšwego ka yena.

src_text: over the years, the school moved a number of times as it expanded.
tgt_text: mo mengwageng ya go feta, sekolo se hudugile gantši ka ge se gotše.

src_text: however, learners and teachers never had the benefit of proper facilities until recently, when they walked through the doors of their new, stateoftheart school.
tgt_text: le ge go le bjalo, barutwana le barutiši ga se ba ka ba ba le sekolo sa maleba go fihla gonabjale, ge ba tsena ka mabati a sekolo sa bona se sefsa sa sebjalebjale.

src_text: the school was completed as part of the accelerated schools infrastructure delivery initiative (asidi), which was launched by the department of basic education in 2011. the initiative aims to replace schools that compromise the safety of learners and staff, due to a lack of proper infrastructure, water, sanitation and electricity.
tgt_text: sekolo se phethilwe bjalo ka karolo ya lenaneo la phetha gatšo ya potlako ya infrastraktšha ya dikolo (asidi), leo le thakgotšwego ke kgoro ya thuto ya motheo ka 2011. maikemišetšo a lenaneo le ke go fediša dikolo tšeo di beago maphelo a barutwana le bašomi kotsing, ka lebaka la go hloka infrastraktšha ya maleba, meetse, kelelatšhili le mohlagase.

src_text: to date, asidi has built 266 schools, provided 886 schools with sanitation, 1 030 with water and 372 with electricity.
tgt_text: go fihla lehono, asidi e agile dikolo tše 266, ya abela dikolo tše 886 kelelatšhila, tše 1 030 tša tsentšhetšwa meetse gomme tše 372 tša tsentšhetšwa mohlagase.

src_text: the learners of nkululeko ralo primary school now have proper classrooms and access to a resource centre, science laboratory, multipur pose and a nutrition centre.
tgt_text: gonabjale barutwana ba nkululeko ralo primary school ba na le diphapoši tša maleba le senthara ya methopo ya go ithuta, laporotori ya saense, senthara ya mešomontši le phepo.

src_text: a shared vision principal koleka gilman is passionate about improving education in mthatha.
tgt_text: go ba le pono ya go swanahlogo ya sekolo koleka gilman o na le lerato la go kaonafatša thuto ka mthatha.

src_text: her dream to start a school for her community began in 1988, and the following year, she began sharing her vision with the community.
tgt_text: toro ya gagwe ya go thoma sekolo setšhabeng sa gabo e thomile ka 1988, gomme ngwaga wa go latela, a thoma go abelana pono ya gagwe le setšhaba.

src_text: "our community was highly populated with a lot of children of schoolgoing age who had nowhere to go for education.
tgt_text: "setšhaba sa rena se be se na le bana ba bantši ba mengwaga ya go thoma sekolo bao ba bego ba se na moo ba ka tsenago sekolo gona.

src_text: my vision was welcomed by community member nkululeko ralo, who offered his home garage to be used as a school," says gilman.
tgt_text: pono ya ka e ile ya amogelwa ke leloko la setšhaba nkululeko ralo, yoo a re filego karatšhe ya legae la gagwe gore re e šomiše bjalo ka sekolo, "gwa realo gilman.

src_text: she adds that ralo went on to organise a container from telkom and it was used as an additional classroom.
tgt_text: a tlaleletša ka gore ralo o tšwetše pele go beakanya ntlwana ya go thetha go tšwa telkom gomme ya šomišwa bjalo ka phapoši.

src_text: ralo also arranged with two members in his community to offer their garages as additional classrooms.
tgt_text: ralo o beakantše gape le maloko a mabedi mo setšhabeng sa gabo go thuša ka dikaratšhe tša bona gore di šomišwe bjalo ka diphapoši tša tlaleletšo.

src_text: ralo sadly passed away in 2004. in 1994, the school moved to the eli spilkin hall, which was built by local businessman eli spilkin.
tgt_text: ka manyami ralo o hlokofetše ka 2004. ka 1994, sekolo se ile sa ya holong ya eli spilkin, yeo e agilwego ke rakgwebo wa mo motseng eli spilkin.

src_text: "in the same year, we received mobile toilets from the provincial department of education.
tgt_text: "ka ngwaga wona woo, re amogetše dintlwana tša boithomelo tša go thetha go tšwa kgorong ya thuto ya profense.

src_text: i then looked [for] and applied for a site where we would eventually build our school.
tgt_text: ke ile ka nyaka gomme ka dira kgopelo ya lefelo moo re tla agago sekolo.

src_text: we received five hectares of land in 1998," says gilman.
tgt_text: re amogetše dihektare tše hlano tša naga ka 1998," gwa realo gilman.

src_text: three temporary classrooms were donated to the school by a nonprofit organisation called kats and spaks, and the community built five mud classrooms.
tgt_text: mokgatlo wa go se dire letseno wo o bitšwago kats and spaks o abetše sekolo diphapoši tša nakwana tše tharo, gomme setšhaba sa aga diphapoši tše hlano tša seloko.

src_text: throughout the years, gilman continued to advocate for the school to be improved and eventually, five classrooms were received from the eastern cape premier’s office.
tgt_text: mo mengwageng ya go feta, gilmana o tšwetše pele go thekga sekolo gore se kaona fatšwe gomme mafelelong, se amogetše diphapoši tše hlano go tšwa ofising ya tonakgolo ya kapa bohlabela.

src_text: in 2014, things took a positive turn when the department of basic education, through asidi, issued a tender to build nkululeko ralo primary school.
tgt_text: ka 2014, dilo bile kaone kudu ge kgoro ya thuto ya motheo, ka tšhomišo ya asidi, e ntšha thentara ya go aga moago wa nkululeko ralo primary school.

src_text: "construction started in 2018 and the school was completed in 2021, thanks to asidi," says gilman.
tgt_text: "sekolo se thomilwe go agwa ka 2018 gomme sa phethwa ka 2021, ditebogo go asidi," gwa realo gilman.

src_text: inspiring teaching and learning basic education deputy minister reginah mhaule says the department wants to ensure that the physical infrastructure of every school inspires learners to attend school and learn, and educators to teach.
tgt_text: go hlohleletša go ruta le go ithuta motlatšatona wa thuto ya motheo reginah mhaule o re kgoro e nyaka go kgonthiša gore sebopego sa sekolo se sengwe le se sengwe se hlohleletša barutwana go tsena sekolo le go ithuta, le barutiši go ruta.

src_text: "the building of this school is government’s way of restoring dignity to rural and underprivileged schoolgoing children and their teachers," she adds.
tgt_text: "go aga sekolo se ke mokgwa wa mmušo go buša seriti go bana bao ba tsenago dikolo tša magaeng le tšeo di se nago didirišwa tša go ithuta le barutiši ba bona," a tlaleletša.

src_text: a member of the school governing body, nomuntu dlengane, says the new school will motivate tea chers and learners to reach their full potential.
tgt_text: leloko la lekgotlataolo la sekolo, nomuntu dlengane, o re sekolo se sefsa se tla hlohleletša barutiši le baithuti go fihlelela bokgoni bja bona ka botlalo.

src_text: "our learners’ attitudes and selfconfidence have already improved due to the new infrastructure.
tgt_text: "maitshwaro le boitshepo bja barutwana ba rena di šetše di kaonafetše ka lebaka la infrastraktšha ye mpsha.

src_text: this will also help us maintain social distancing in our classrooms so that we can eliminate the spread of the coronavirus disease," says dlengane.
tgt_text: se se tla thuša gape gore barutwana le barutiši ba se batamelane kudu ka diphapošing gore re fokotše go phatlala ga bolwetši bja coronavirus," gwa realo dlengane.

src_text: the school has 489 learners, 14 teachers, and two administration clerks.
tgt_text: sekolo se na le barutwana ba 489, barutiši ba 14, le bangwaledi ba taolo ba babedi.

src_text: it caters for grades r to 7 and is a nonfee paying school.
tgt_text: asidi e potlakiša phethagatšo ya infrastraktšha ya sekolo more matshediso nkululeko ralo primary school ke mohlala wo mobotse wa ka moo go ka fihlelelwago dipoelo tše dibotse ge setšhaba le mmušo ba šoma mmogo.

src_text: nsfas funding deadline looms sphelele ngubane students and youth from disadvantaged and workingclass backgrounds are encouraged to apply for funding from the national student financial aid scheme (nsfas).
tgt_text: letšatši la mafelelo la go dira dikgopelo tša thekgo ya nsfas le a batamela sphelele ngubane baithuti le bafsa go tšwa malapeng a go hloka le ba a go gola megolo ya fase ba hlohlele tšwa go dira dikgopelo tša thekgo go setlamo sa thušo ya ditšhelete tša thuto sa setšhaba (nsfas).

src_text: according to the department of higher education and training, nsfas funding is available to youth who have already completed their schooling or are already studying at any level in a higher education institution.
tgt_text: go ya ka kgoro ya thuto ya godimo le tlhahlo, thekgo ya nsfas e hwetšwa ke baithuti bao ba šetšego ba feditše sekolo goba ba šetše ba ithuta legatong le lengwe le le lengwe institušeneng ya thuto ya godimo.

src_text: they can apply for funding from nsfas to study at a public university or a technical and vocational education and training (tvet) college, but must do so before the closing date on 7 january 2022. applicants must be: south african citizens or permanent residents who want to register or are already studying at a public university or tvet college; south african social security agency grant recipients; from households with a combined household income not exceeding r350 000 per year.
tgt_text: ba ka dira kgopelo ya thekgo go nsfas go ithuta yunibesithing ya mmušo goba kholetšheng ya go ithutela tša theknolotši le mešomo ya diatla (tvet), eupša ba swanetše go dira seo pele ga letšatšikgwedi la go tswalela ka la 7 pherekgong, 2022. bakgopedi ba swanetše go ba: badudi ba afrika borwa goba badudi ba go ya go ile bao ba nyakago go ngwadiša goba ba šetše ba ithuta yunibesithing ya mmušo goba khole tšheng ya tvet; bao e bego e le baamogedi ba mphiwafela wa mokgatlo wa tšhireletšo ya leago wa afrika borwa; ba etšwa lapeng leo letseno la bona ge le hlakane le sa fetego r350 000 ka ngwaga.

src_text: a brighter future nhlakanipho mkhize (26) is a qualified electrician, thanks to nsfas funding, which paid for his studies at umfolozi tvet college in kwazulunatal.
tgt_text: bokamoso bja go phadima nhlakanipho mkhize (26) ke ramehlagase yo a dumeletšwego, re leboga thekgo ya nsfas yeo e lefetšego dithuto tša gagwe mo umfolozi tvet college ka kwazulunatal.

src_text: mkhize, from richards bay, obtained a national certificate (vocational) electrical infrastructure construction in 2017. in addition to campusbased learning, he also had to complete workplace training and pass a trade test.
tgt_text: mkhize, go tšwa richards bay, o hweditše national certificate (vocational) electri cal infrastructure construction ka 2017. go tlaleletša go ithuta ka khamphaseng, o ile a swanela ke go dira tlhahlo ya mošomong gomme a tšwelele go teko ya mošomo.

src_text: early on in his studies, mkhize had the opportunity to put what he learnt into practice, ensuring that he gained confidence in the basic skills he was developing.
tgt_text: mathomong mo dithutong tša gagwe, mkhize o bile le sebaka sa go diriša seo a ithutilego sona mošomong, a kgonthiša gore o ba le boi tshepo ka mabokgoni a motheo ao a ithutago.

src_text: "as a firstyear student, i was already attending to electricity problems in my community.
tgt_text: "bjalo ka moithuti wa ngwaga wa mathomo, ke be ke šetše ke lokišana le mathata a mohlagase mo setšhabeng sa gešo.

src_text: umfolozi tvet college provided us with both theory and practice.
tgt_text: umfolozi tvet college e re file bobedi teori le tirišo.

src_text: "the advantage tvet students have is not just exposure, but also a compulsory workplacebased learning component to certify that they are competent before receiving their qualification," he says.
tgt_text: "kholego yeo baithuti ba tvet ba nago le yona ga se fela maitemogelo, eupša gape ke karolo ya kgapeletšo ya go ithuta mošomo lefelong la mošomo go kgonthiša gore ba na le bokgoni pele ba amogela mangwalo a bona a thuto," a realo.

src_text: like many south african youth who come from underprivileged backgrounds, mkhize knew he wanted to pursue a career in engineering, but no one in his family could afford college fees.
tgt_text: go swana le bafsa ba bantši ba maafrika borwa bao ba tšwago malapeng a go hloka, mkhize o tsebile gore o nyaka go latela mošomo wa boentšenere, eupša go be go se na yo a ka kgonago go mo lefela ditefo tša kholetšheng ka lapeng la gabo.

src_text: "when i became aware of the nsfas funding, i knew it would lead to where i wanted to go – being an engineer," he says.
tgt_text: "ge ke se na go tseba ka thekgo ya nsfas, ke ile ka tseba gore e tla nkiša moo ke nyakago go ya gona – go ba moentšenere," a realo.

src_text: mkhize’s threeyear nsfas funding paid for his books, tuition and transport, and he received a personal care allowance.
tgt_text: letšatši la mafelelo la go dira dikgopelo tša thekgo ya nsfas le a batamela sphelele ngubane baithuti le bafsa go tšwa malapeng a go hloka le ba a go gola megolo ya fase ba hlohlele tšwa go dira dikgopelo tša thekgo go setlamo sa thušo ya ditšhelete tša thuto sa setšhaba (nsfas).

src_text: work together to strengthen democracy vukuzenzele unnamed as south africa entered the new year, we were confronted by two pro found events that remind ed us, in different ways, of what brings us together as a people.
tgt_text: go šoma mmogo go matlafatša temokrasi vukuzenzele unnamed bjalo ka ge afrika borwa e tsene ngwa geng wo moswa, re be re lebane le ditiragalo tše pedi tše kgolo tšeo di re gopoditšego, ka ditsela tša go fapana, seo se re ko panyago bjalo ka batho.

src_text: on the first day of 2022, the nation gathered in spirit to bid farewell to arch bishop desmond tutu at st george’s cathedral in cape town.
tgt_text: ka letšatši la mathomo la 2022, setšhaba se kopane moyeng go laelana le mopišopomogolo desmond tutu kerekeng ya st george’s cathedral go la cape town.

src_text: it was a moment of great sadness as we recalled the life and contribution of a beloved compatriot who was, in many ways, the moral conscience of our nation.
tgt_text: e be e le nakwana ya ma nyami a magolo ge re be re gopola bophelo le seabe sa modudi yo a rategago yoo e bego e le, ka ditsela tše ntši, motho wa maitshwaro a mabotse wa setšhaba sa rena.

src_text: at the same time, his funeral was a celebration of the values he stood for.
tgt_text: go sa le bjalo, poloko ya gagwe e be e le keteko ya di kgopolo tše a bego a di emela.

src_text: it was a celebration of the great unity and diversity of our people, and a reminder of the sacrifices made by so many to achieve our democracy.
tgt_text: e be e le keteko ya botee bjo bogolo le phapano ya setšhaba sa rena, le segopotšo sa ditahlegelo tše di dirilwe go ke batho ba bantšintši go fihlelela temokrasi ya rena.

src_text: on the second day of 2022, the country watched on in horror as a huge fire engulfed our parliament, just a hundred metres from where we had gathered the day before to pay our last respects to archbishop tutu.
tgt_text: ka letšatši la bobedi la 2022, naga e bogetše ka manyami ge mollo wo mogolo o fiša palamente ya rena, dimetara tše lekgolo fela go tloga moo re bego re kgobokane gona letšatši pele ga moo go fa tlhompho ya rena ya mafelelo go mopišopomogolo tutu.

src_text: we are relieved that there was no loss of life and that noone was injured in the fire.
tgt_text: re imologile gobane ga go na tahlegelo ya bophelo le gore ga go na yo a gobetšego mollong woo.

src_text: we are extremely gra teful to the firefighters who battled the blaze and finally extinguished it.
tgt_text: re leboga kudu borasetimamollo bao ba katanego le go tima mollo gomme mafelelong ba kgona go o tima.

src_text: the investigations into the cause of the fire are now underway.
tgt_text: dinyakišišo tša seo se hlotšego mollo bjale di tšwela pele.

src_text: we need to ensure that these investigations are thorough and concluded without delay.
tgt_text: re swanela go kgonthiša gore dinyakišišo tše ke tše di tseneletšego ebile di phethwa ka pelapela.

src_text: the country needs to know what happened.
tgt_text: naga e nyaka go tseba seo se diregilego.

src_text: arrangements are being made to ensure that the work of parliament can continue even if the buildings cannot be used.
tgt_text: dipeakanyo di a dirwa go kgonthiša gore mošomo wa palamente o ka tšwelapele le ge e le gore meago e ka se šomišwe.

src_text: it is vital that parliament continues to consider and pass laws that will transform society and continues to provide oversight and ensure accountability as government works to implement the mandate it received from the people.
tgt_text: go bohlokwa gore palamente e tšwelapele go akanya le go phasiša melao yeo e tlago fetola setšhaba le go tšwelapele go lekola le go kgonthiša boikarabelo ka ge mmušo o phethagatša taelo yeo e e amogetšego go tšwa bathong.

src_text: apart from the close proximity of st george’s cathedral and parliament, what connects these two events is that each reminds us of what brings us together as south africans: our democracy.
tgt_text: ka ntle ga go ba kgau swikgauswi le kereke ya st george’s cathedral le pala mente, seo se kopanyago ditiragalo tše tše pedi ke gore ye nngwe le ye nngwe e re gopotša seo se re kopanyago bjalo ka maafrika borwa: temokrasi ya rena.

src_text: we mourn desmond tutu because he was the spiritual father of our democracy.
tgt_text: re llela desmond tutu gobane e be e le moetapele wa semoya wa temokrasi ya rena.

src_text: we despair at the devas tation of our parliamentary buildings because they are the seat of our democracy.
tgt_text: re nyamišitšwe ke go senywa ga meago ya palamente ya rena gobane ke mošate wa temokrasi ya rena.

src_text: they are the place where our new democratic constitution was adopted just over 25 years ago, and where hundreds of trans formative laws have been passed.
tgt_text: ke lefelo la moo molaotheo wa rena wo moswa wa temokrasi o amogetšwego gona me ngwaga ya ka godingwana ga ye 25 ya go feta, le moo ma kgolokgolo a melao ya phetogo e phasišitšwego gona.

src_text: we may not always recognise it, but the fire at parliament demonstrated how strongly south africans feel about their democracy.
tgt_text: re ka no ba re sa bone selo se, eupša mollo palamenteng o laeditše ka moo maafrika borwa a boulelwago ka gona ka temokrasi ya bona.

src_text: it is a reminder also of how important it is that we work to strengthen and defend that democracy.
tgt_text: gape ke segopotšo sa ka moo go lego bohlokwa gore re šogane le go matlafatša le go šireletša temokrasi yeo.

src_text: while the parliamentary buildings have been damaged beyond use, the institution of parliament continues its work in the service of the people.
tgt_text: mola meago ya palamente e senyegile moo e lego gore e ka se šomišwe, sehlongwa sa palamente se tšwetšapele mošomo wa sona wa go šomela batho.

src_text: this is an important reminder that our democratic institutions are not defined by the buildings that house them, but by the work they do and by the confidence that the people have in them.
tgt_text: se ke segopotšo se bohlokwa sa gore di hlongwa tša rena tša temokrasi ga di hlalošwe go ya ka meago yeo di lego ka gare ga yona, eupša ka mošomo wo di o dirago le ka boitshepho bjo batho ba nago nabjo go yona.

src_text: this is true of all the institutions of our democracy.
tgt_text: se ke nnete go dihlongwa ka moka tša temokrasi ya rena.

src_text: just as the fire in parliament was finally being extinguished, acting chief justice raymond zondo submitted the first part of the report of the commission of inquiry into state capture.
tgt_text: mafelelong ge mollo palamenteng o sa tšwa go tingwa, moahlodimogolo wa motšwaoswere raymond zondo ke ge a lokolla karolo ya mathomo ya pego ya khomišene ya dinyakišišo ka go gogwa ga mmušo ka nko.

src_text: this part of the report details how several public institutions were infiltrated, looted and severely damaged.
tgt_text: karolo ye ya pego e hla losa ka moo dihlongwa tša setšhaba tše mmalwa di bego di tseneletšwe, di thopetšwe dithoto le go senywa wo šoro.

src_text: these include stateowned enterprises like south african airways, the government communication and information system and the south african revenue service.
tgt_text: tše di akaretša kgwebo ya go laolwa ke mmušo go swana le ditirelophofo tša afrika borwa, lekala la dikgokagano tša mmušo le mekgwa ya tshedimošo le lekala la tirelo ya metšhelo ya afrika borwa.

src_text: this part of the report paints a deeply disturbing picture of how key instituti ons of our democracy were compromised and undermined with criminal intent.
tgt_text: karolo ye ya pego e fa seswantšho sa go tshwenya kudu sa ka moo dihlongwa tše bohlokwa tša temokrasi di šaeditšwego le go nyatšwa ka maikemišetšo a bosenyi.

src_text: not only were significant amounts of money stolen, but these institutions were not able to properly fulfil the functions for which they were established.
tgt_text: ga se fela palo ye kgolo ya tšhelete ye e utswitšwego, eupša di hlongwa tše di be di sa kgone go dira ka tshwanelo mešomo ya tšona yeo di hlomilwego ka lebaka la yona.

src_text: the findings and recommendations of the zondo commission will help the country to rebuild these institutions and to hold those responsible to account.
tgt_text: dikutullo le ditšhišinyo tša khomišene ya zondo di tla thuša naga go agaleswa dihlongwa tše le go rweša boikarabelo bao ba nago le maikarabelo.

src_text: we must ensure that we use them to safeguard these institutions into the future so that they may never be captured again.
tgt_text: re swanetše go khonthiša gore re di šomiša go šireletša dihlongwa gore le ka moso di se ke tša tsoga di thopilwe gape.

src_text: we must safeguard against any and all efforts to diminish our hardwon democracy – whether these efforts take the form of corruption in stateowned enterprises, the subversion of our law enforcement agencies, the sabotage of our economic infrastructure, or attacks on the independence and integrity of our judiciary.
tgt_text: re swanetše go lwa le twantšho efe goba efe le maiteko ka moka a go tekatekiša temokrasi ya rena ya go hwetšwa boima – ge eba maiteko a a tšea sebopego sa bomenemene ka dikgwebong tša go laolwa ke mmušo, go phuhlamiša dietšentshi tša rena tša phethagatšo ya molao, go senya ka boomo mananeokgoparara a rena a ikonomi, goba go hlasela bolokologi le tlhompho ya boahlodi bja rena.

src_text: we need to protect our constitution, our democratic state and the electoral process from anyone who wants to weaken our democracy and deny the south african people of their hardwon freedom.
tgt_text: re nyaka go šireletša mola otheo wa rena, pušo ya rena ya temokrasi le tshepedišo ya dikgetho go tšwa go mang le mang yoo a nyakago go tekatekiša temokrasi ya rena le go tima batho ba afrika borwa tokologo ya bona ye e hweditšwego ka boima.

src_text: there are many challenges that we must confront as we work to rebuild and recover from the effects of the covid19 pandemic.
tgt_text: go na le mathata a mantši ao re swanetšego go a lebantšha ge re ntše re šogana le go agaleswa le go tsogagape go tšwa dikhuetšong tša leuba la covid19.

src_text: as we do so, let us draw strength and encouragement from our deep dedication to our democracy and our common desire to build a nation that is united, free and equal.
tgt_text: bjalo ka ge re dira bjalo, a re tšee maatla le tlhohleletšo go tšwa go boineelo bja go tsenelela go temokrasi ya rena le tumo ya rena ya go swana ya go aga naga yeo e nago le botee, tokologo le tekatekano.

src_text: i wish you all the best for the year ahead.
tgt_text: go šoma mmogo go matlafatša temokrasi vukuzenzele unnamed bjalo ka ge afrika borwa e tsene ngwa geng wo moswa, re be re lebane le ditiragalo tše pedi tše kgolo tšeo di re gopoditšego, ka ditsela tša go fapana, seo se re ko panyago bjalo ka batho.

src_text: covid19 corruption perpetrators brought to book vukuzenzele unnamed individuals and companies who were involved in corruption relating to the gov ernment’s procurement of coronavirus disease (covid19) goods and services are being held accountable for their actions.
tgt_text: badirabosenyi ba bomenetša mabapi le covid19 ba golegilwe vukuzenzele unnamed batho le dikhamphani tšeo di bego di kgatha tema ka bomenetšeng bja go amana le dithentara tša mmušo tša mabapi le ditlabelo le ditirelo tša bolwetši bja coronavirus (covid19) ba rwešwa maikarabelo go ditiro tša bona.

src_text: the special investigation unit’s (siu) final report on its probe into allegations relating to any misuse of covid19 funds, across all spheres of government and the private sector was recently authorised for release to the public by president cyril ramaphosa.
tgt_text: pego ya mafelelo ya lekala la dinyakišišo tšeo di ikgethilego (siu) ka ga dinyakišišo tša lona mabapi le dipelaelo ka ga tšhomišobošaedi efe goba efe ya ditšhelete tša covid19, go ralala le makala a mmušo le a phraebete ka moka e sa tšwa go dumelelwa ke mopresidente cyril ramaphosa gore e lokollwe e fiwe setšhaba.

src_text: the report is an important step in the fight against corruption and maladministration in the public and private sectors, he said.
tgt_text: pego ye ke kgato ye bohlokwa ka ntweng kgahlanong le bomenetša le tšhomišobošaedi ya ditšhelete ka lekaleng la mmušo le la phraebete, a realo.

src_text: in july 2020, president ramaphosa authorised the investigation by the siu.
tgt_text: ka mosegamanye 2020, mopresidente ramaphosa o ile a dumelela gore siu e dire dinyakišišo.

src_text: at the time, he gave his commitment that if the siu found evidence that a criminal offence had been committed, it would be obliged to refer the evidence to the national prosecuting authority (npa).
tgt_text: ka yona nako yeo, o ile a tshepiša gore ge siu e hweditše bohlatse bja gore molato wa bosenyi o dirilwe, e tla gapeletšega go romela bohlatse bjoo go tirelotaolo ya bosekiši ya bosetšhaba (npa).

src_text: the siu was also aut horised to institute civil proceedings for the recovery of any damages or losses incurred by the state.
tgt_text: siu e ile ya fiwa maatla a go phethagatša ditshepedišo tša melato ya bosenyi gore go hwetšwe ditšhelete go ditshenyo goba go ditahlegelo tšeo di hweditšwego ke mmušo.

src_text: report findings the siu investigated 5 467 contracts awarded to 3 066 service providers, worth a total of r14.3 billion.
tgt_text: tšeo pego e di utollotšego siu e nyakišišitše dikonteraka tše 5 467 tšeo di abetšwego baabi ba ditirelo ba 3 066, tše di bitšago palomoka ya r14.3 pilione.

src_text: the investigation into 4 549 contracts have been finalised, and 2 803 of these were found to be irregular.
tgt_text: dinyakišišo mabapi le dikonteraka tše 4 549 di phethilwe, gomme tše 2 803 tša tšona di hweditšwe di se molaong.

src_text: this amounts to 62% of the finalised investigations.
tgt_text: se se fihla go 62% ya dinyakišišo tše di phethilwego.

src_text: "this investigation targeted individuals and institutions who believed they could exploit a moment of national vulnerability to enrich themselves and those with whom they colluded to abuse public resources," the president said.
tgt_text: "dinyakišišo tše di be di nepišitše batho le dihlongwa tšeo di bego di dumela gore di ka šomiša bošaedi seemo sa bosetšhaba sa go ba kotsing ka nepo ya go ikhumiša le go homiša bao ba dirišanago le bona go šomiša ditšhelete tša mmušo bošaedi," mopre sidente a realo.

src_text: he added it was unacceptable that so many contracts associated with saving lives and protecting livelihoods were irregular, unlawful or fraudulent.
tgt_text: o tlaleleditše ka gore ga go amogelege gore diko nteraka tše ntši ka tsela ye tšeo di amanago le go phološa maphelo le go šireletša go iphediša ga batho di ka be di abilwe ka fao go sa amogelegego, di se molaong goba di le tša bomenetša.

src_text: "this investigation demonstrates our determination to root out corruption and to deal with perpetrators," said president ramaphosa.
tgt_text: "dinyakišišo tše di bontšha boikgafo bja rena bja go tumola bomenetša ka medu le go šomana le badirabosenyi," gwa bolela mopresidente ramaphosa.

src_text: the final report details matters that the siu has referred to the npa, departments and entities in the public sector and other parties.
tgt_text: pego ya mafelelo e bolela ka botlalo mabapi le melato yeo siu e e rometšego go npa, go dikgoro tša mmušo le go dihlongwa ka lekaleng la mmušo le go batšeakarolo ba bangwe.

src_text: the npa will finalise the process of bringing wrongdoers to book and addressing weaknesses identified by the siu investigation, the president explained.
tgt_text: npa e tla pheta tshepedišo ye ya go golega badirabosenyi le go rarolla mafokodi ao a bonwego ke dinyakišišo tša siu, mopre sidente a hlaloša bjalo.

src_text: action taken since the start of the investigation, the siu, working with other agencies, has made the following progress: 45 matters, with a combined value of r2.1 billion, have been enrolled with the special tribunal on corruption, fraud and illicit money flows.
tgt_text: kgato ye e tšerwego go tloga mola go thomišwago ka dinyakišišo, siu, ka go šomišana le ditheo tše dingwe, e bile le kgatelopele ye e latelago: melato ye 45, ya boleng bjo bo kopantšwego bja r2.1 pilione, e ngwadišitšwe le kgorotsheko ye e kgethegilego ya melato ya tša bomenetša, tsogolekobong le ditshepedišo tša ditšhelete ka fao go sego molaong.

src_text: the special tribunal has a statutory mandate to recover public funds stolen through corruption, fraud and illicit money flows, and take civil action against perpetrators; 224 cases have been referred for disciplinary action against officials in government departments or entities; 386 cases have been referred to the npa, and three have been referred for executive action; 330 cases have been referred for administrative action, which includes blacklisting (not being able to do work for gov ernment).
tgt_text: kgoro tsheko ye e kgethegilego e filwe mošomo wa semolao wa go hwetša ditšhelete tša mmušo tšeo di utswitšwego ka tsela ya ditiro tša bomenetša, tsogolekobong le ditshepedišo tša ditšhelete ka fao go sego molaong, le go phethagatša magato a tshekišo kgahlanong le badirabosenyi; melato ye 224 e rometšwe gore go tšewe magato a kgalemo kgahlanong le bahlankedi ba mmušo goba ba dihlongwa tše; melato ye 386 e rometšwe go npa, gomme ye meraro e rometšwe gore e tšeelwe sepheto ke kabinete; melato ye 330 e rometšwe gore e tšeelwe sepheto ke bolaodi ba ka mešomong, go akaretšwa go magato a dikiletšo (gore badirabosenyi ba se kgone go šomela mmušo).

src_text: according to the report, a total of r551.5 million (value of cash and assets) is to be recovered, while r34.2 million has been recovered to date.
tgt_text: go ya ka pego ye, palomoka ya r551.5 milione (ya boleng bja kheše le dithoto) e tlo hwetšwa, mola r34.2 milione yona e šetše e hweditšwe go fihla mo lebakeng le.

src_text: the investigation prevented a r114.2 million loss, and set contracts aside valued at r170.4 million.
tgt_text: dinyakišišo tše di thibetše tahlegelo ya r114.2 milione, gomme tša emiša dikonteraka tša boleng bja r170.4 milione.

src_text: the siu expects these matters to be completed between march and april 2022, before the submission of a supplementary report to the president at the end of june.
tgt_text: siu e emetše gore melato ye e phethwe magareng ga hla kola le moranang 2022, pele ga ge go ka romelwa pego ya tlaleletšo go mopresidente mafelelong a phupu.

src_text: the report does not include details of ongoing investigations into allega tions received by the siu after the deadline set for the final report.
tgt_text: pego ye ga e akaretše dintlha tša dinyakišišo tše di tšwelago pele ka ga dipelaelo tše di amogetšwego ke siu ka morago ga letšatši la mafelelo leo le bego le beetšwe pego ya mafelelo.

src_text: these include investigations into 476 service providers, linked to 964 contracts, valued at more than r961.6 million.
tgt_text: tšona di akaretša dinyakišišo ka ga baabaditirelo ba 476, bao ba amegago dikoterakeng tše 964, tša boleng bja go feta r961.6 milione.

src_text: the outcomes of these investigations, the presidency said, will also be provided in the june report.
tgt_text: dipoelo tša dinyakišišo tše, kantoro ya mopresidente ya realo, le tšona di tla fiwa ka pegong ya phupu.

src_text: the president thanked the siu for the work done in the past 18 months, and also whistleblowers and other witnesses who provided information to investigators.
tgt_text: badirabosenyi ba bomenetša mabapi le covid19 ba golegilwe vukuzenzele unnamed batho le dikhamphani tšeo di bego di kgatha tema ka bomenetšeng bja go amana le dithentara tša mmušo tša mabapi le ditlabelo le ditirelo tša bolwetši bja coronavirus (covid19) ba rwešwa maikarabelo go ditiro tša bona.

src_text: cach connects students with learning opportunities silusapho nyanda young people who have not yet secured spots at higher education institutions can turn to the central application clearing house (cach) system for help.
tgt_text: cach e kgokaganya baithuti le dibaka tša go ithuta silusapho nyanda bafsa bao ba sego ba hlwa ba hwetša dikgoba ka dihlongweng tša thuto ya godimo ba ka kgopela thušo go lefelo la go thuša barutwana bao ba hlaetšwego ke dikgoba ditheong tša thuto ya godingwana (cach).

src_text: cach is an online government service managed by the department of higher education and training (dhet).
tgt_text: cach ke tirelo ya inthaneteng ya mmušo yeo e laolwago ke kgoro ya thuto le tlhahlo tša godingwana (dhet).

src_text: the service helps those who need access to university, technical and vocational education and training (tvet) colleges and skills development opportunities.
tgt_text: e thuša bao ba nyakago go fihlelela dithuto tša yunibesithi, tša dikholetšhe tša thuto le tlhahlo tša sethekniki le tša matsogo tša godingwana (tvet) le bao ba nyakago go fihlelela dibaka tša tlhabollo ya mabokgoni.

src_text: "cach services have been available from 24 january 2022, and will close on 31 march, to assist those who need to enter tertiary education but face challenges with getting space," says minister of higher education and training dr blade nzimande.
tgt_text: "ditirelo tša cach di thomile go hwetšagala go thoma ka la 24 pherekgong 2022 gomme di tla tswalelwa ka la 31 mopitlo go thuša bao ba nyakago go tsenela dithuto tša godingwana eupša ba lebane le ditlhohlo tša go hwetša sekgoba," gwa bolela tona ya thuto le tlhahlo tša godingwana ngaka blade nzimande.

src_text: cach can help those who applied for admission to a university or a college on time in 2021, but were not offered a place in a programme of their choice.
tgt_text: cach e ka thuša bao ba dirilego dikgopelo tša se kgoba ka yunibesithing goba ka kholetšheng ka 2021 eupša ba se ba fiwa sekgoba ka thutong yeo ba e kgethilego.

src_text: the dhet explained that this usually happens when the applicant does not meet the necessary requirements or the institution has reached its limit on the number of students it can enrol.
tgt_text: dhet e hlalošitše gore se ka tlwaelo se direga ge modiradikgopelo a sa fihlelele dinyakwa tša maleba goba ge sehlongwa sa thuto se fihlile magomong a palo ya baithuti bao e ka kgonago go ba ngwadiša.

src_text: cach can also help those who applied to a higher learning institution and were accepted, but now want to change their courses.
tgt_text: cach e ka thuša gape bao ba dirilego dikgopelo go sehlongwa sa thuto ya godingwana gomme ba amogetšwe, eupša bjale ba nyaka go fetoša thuto yeo ba nyakago go e dira.

src_text: cach will refer individuals to career development services and where possible, provide an opportunity for them to be considered for spaces still available at universities, tvet colleges or sector education and training authority (seta) learnerships, without having to travel to any institution.
tgt_text: cach e tla lebiša bakgopedi go ditirelo tša go ba hlahla ka tsebo ya dirutwa tša mešomo ka go fapana gomme fao go kgonagalago, ya ba fa sebaka sa gore ba fiwe dikgoba tšeo di sa lego gona ka diyunibesithing le ka dikholetšheng tša tvet goba le ka dikgobeng tša go ithutela mešomo tša ka bolaoding bja lekala la thuto le tlhahlo (seta), ka ntle le gore ba ye sehlongweng sefe goba sefe.

src_text: all public universities, tvet colleges and setas can access the cach database to search for individuals who meet the criteria for available spaces.
tgt_text: diyunibesithi tša mmušo ka moka, dikholetšhe tša tvet le diseta di ka kgona go fihlelela tshedimošo ye e bolo kilwego ya cach go nyaka batho bao ba fihlelelago dinyakwa tša dikgoba tšeo di sa lego gona.

src_text: "institutions select individuals from the cach database and make direct contact with those they have selected," says dhet spokesperson ishmael mnisi.
tgt_text: "dihlongwa tša thuto le tlhahlo di kgetha batho go tšwa go tshedimošo ye e bolokilwego go cach gomme tša ikgokaganya le bao ba kgethilwego thwii," gwa bolela seboleledi sa dhet ishmael mnisi.

src_text: applicants who sign up for cach must submit their details, including their preferred fields of study.
tgt_text: badiradikgopelo bao ba ingwadišetšago cach ba swanetše go romela dintlha tša bona, go akaretšwa dirutwa tšeo ba batlago go ithutela tšona.

src_text: applicants have options to accept or reject study offers on the cach system.
tgt_text: badiradikgopelo ba na le kgetho ya go amogela goba go gana dikgoba tša go ithuta tšeo di lego go lenaneo la cach.

src_text: institutions of higher learning will only be able to access applicants’ information from cach once applicants have signed up and uploaded their grade 12 results.
tgt_text: dihlongwa tša thuto ya godingwana le tšona di tla kgona go fihlelela tshedimošo ya badiradikgopelo go cach, ge badiradikgopelo ba šetše ba ingwadišitše ebile ba loutile dipoelo tša bona tša marematlou.

src_text: mnisi says cach also helps prospective students who are undecided about career choices by referring them to dhet’s khetha career development service.
tgt_text: cach e kgokaganya baithuti le dibaka tša go ithuta silusapho nyanda bafsa bao ba sego ba hlwa ba hwetša dikgoba ka dihlongweng tša thuto ya godimo ba ka kgopela thušo go lefelo la go thuša barutwana bao ba hlaetšwego ke dikgoba ditheong tša thuto ya godingwana (cach).

src_text: sona 2022: bettering lives and livelihoods vukuzenzele unnamed government is committed to putting people first, and has given itself 100 days to finalise a plan to involve all sectors of society in growing south africa’s economy, creating jobs and combating hunger.
tgt_text: sona 2022: go kaonafatša maphelo vukuzenzele unnamed mmušo o ikgafetše go bea batho pele, gomme o iphile matšatši a lekgolo go phetha leano la go akaretša makala ka moka a setšhaba mo kgodišong ya ikonomi ya afrika borwa, go hlola mešomo le go fetšiša tlala.

src_text: this was emphasised by president cyril ramaphosa in his 2022 state of the nation address.
tgt_text: se se gateletšwe ke mopresidente cyril ramaphosa nakong ya polelo ya maemo a setšhaba ya 2022.

src_text: "this work will build on the foundation of the economic reconstruction and recovery plan, which remains our common programme to rebuild the economy," he said.
tgt_text: "mošomo wo o tla dirwa motheong wa leano la mpshafatšo le tsošološo ya ikonomi, leo le tšwelago pele go ba lenaneo la rena la go aga ikonomi leswa," a realo.

src_text: the president said government’s priorities are overcoming the coronavirus disease (covid19) pandemic, building infrastructure, increasing local production, creating jobs and addressing the energy crisis.
tgt_text: ge a be a bolela le setšhaba, mopresidente o rile ditlapele tša mmušo ke go fenya leuba la bolwetši bja kokwanahloko ya khorona (covid19), go aga mananeokgoparara, go oketša tšweletšo ka mo nageng go hlola mešomo le go šomana le mathata a go amana le mohlagase.

src_text: "if there is one thing we all agree on, it is that the present situation – of deep poverty, unemployment and inequality – is unacceptable and unsustainable."
tgt_text: "ge eba go na le selo se tee seo re dumelelanago ka sona ke gore seemo sa gabjale – sa bohloki bjoo bo ikepetšego, tlhokego ya mešomo le go se lekalekane – ga se amogelege ebile ga se sa swanela go tšwela pele.

src_text: creating jobs last year, the unemployment rate reached its highest recorded level of 34.9% in the third quarter, following the financial devastation caused by covid19.
tgt_text: go hlola mešomongwageng woo o fetilego kotareng ya go feta, palo ya tlhokego ya mešomo e fihleletše seemo sa godimodimo kudu mo 34.9% ya badudi ba sa šomego ka baka la masetlapelo a go amana le tša ditšhelete ao a hlotšwego ke covid19.

src_text: "we all know that government does not create jobs.
tgt_text: "ka moka re a tseba gore mmušo ga o hlole mešomo.

src_text: business creates jobs.
tgt_text: kgwebo ke yona e hlolago mešomo.

src_text: the key task of government is to create the conditions that will enable the private sector – both big and small – to emerge, to grow, to access new markets, to create new products, and to hire more employees," he said.
tgt_text: mošomomogolo wa mmušo ke go tla ka mabaka ao a tla kgontšhago makala a poraefete – bobedi le legolo le le lennyane – go tšwelela, go gola, go fihlelela mebaraka e meswa, go hlama ditšweletšwa tše diswa, le go thwala bašomi ba bantšhi," a realo.

src_text: around 80% of employed people work in the private sector.
tgt_text: batho bao ba ka bago dipersente tše masomeseswai bao ba šomago, ba šoma ka lekaleng la poraefete.

src_text: the president said government will introduce a new loan guarantee scheme to help small businesses recover.
tgt_text: mopresidente o rile mmušo o tla tsebagatša sekhwama sa kadimišo ya mašeleng go thuša dikgwebo tše nnyane go tsoga.

src_text: the presidential employment stimulus programme, which has already supported over 850 000 employment opportunities, will be stepped up.
tgt_text: lenaneo la tsošološo ya mešomo ka mopresidente, leo le šetšego le thekgile menyetla ya mešomo e 850 000, le tla oketšwa.

src_text: most of the beneficiaries were young people; over 60% were women.
tgt_text: bontšhi bja bao ba holegilego e be e le baswa, gomme ba go feta dipersente tše masometshela e be e le basadi.

src_text: the employment stimulus will enable the department of home affairs to recruit 10 000 unemployed youth for the digitisation of paper records, and the social employment fund will create another 50 000 work opportunities.
tgt_text: tsošološo ya mešomo e tla kgontšha kgoro ya tša selegae go thwala baswa ba 10 000 bao ba sa šomego go yo fetolela ditokomane tša pampiri go ba tša ditšithale, gomme sekhwama sa mešomo ya leago se tla hlola menyetla e mengwe gape e 50 000. kgoro ya thuto ya godimo le tlhahlo e tla fa dialoga tše 10 000 tša thuto le tlhahlo ya mešomo ya diatla menyetla ya mešomo go tloga ka moranang 2022. websaete ya sayouth.

src_text: the department of higher education and training will place 10 000 unemployed technical and vocational education and training graduates in workplaces from april 2022. the sayouth.
tgt_text: mobi, yeo e diretšwego go thuša baswa bao ba nyakago mešomo le go fihlelela me nyetla le thekgo, gabjale e na le baswa ba go feta dimilione tše 2.3 bao ba ingwadišitšego.

src_text: mobi platform, which helps young work seekers to access opportunities and support, now has over 2.3 million youth registered.
tgt_text: mo go bona, ba go feta 600 000 ba šetše ba hweditše menyetla ya mešomo.

src_text: of these, over 600 000 have been placed into employment opportunities.
tgt_text: "tirelo ya baswa ya bosetšhaba e tla thwala sehlopha sa yona sa mathomo sa baswa ba 50 000 mo ngwageng wo, e hlolele baswa menyetla ya gore ba tšee karolo ditšhabeng tša bobona, e hlabolle mabokgoni a bona le gore ba thwalege.

src_text: "a revitalised national youth service will recruit its first cohort of 50 000 young people during the next year [2023], creating opportunities for young people to contribute to their communities, develop their skills and grow their employability."
tgt_text: mphiwafela wa srd o tšwela pele mphiwafela wa kimollo ya tša leago (srd) go covid19, woo o thušitšego batho ba go feta dimilione tše 10 bao ba sa šomego, o okeleditšwe nako go fihla ngwageng o tlago – go fihla mafelelong a kgwedi ya hlakola 2023. go tlaleletša seo, mmušo le bašomimmogo le ona o tla lebelela ditsela tšeo ka tšona o ka tšwelago pele go thuša batho bao ba nago le mathata a ditšhelete ka mokgwa woo elego gore o ka se imele naga ge nako e dutše e eya.

src_text: srd grant continuesthe covid19 social relief of distress (srd) grant, which has helped over 10 million unemployed people, has been extended for another year – to the end of march 2023. in addition, government and its partners will look at ways to continue to support people in financial distress in a manner that is affordable to the country over the long term.
tgt_text: go hwetša naga mmušo o tšwela pele ka taba ya pušetšo ya naga gomme o letetše go fetišwa ga molaokakanywa wa pušetšo ngwageng wo.

src_text: access to land government is moving ahead with land reform and anticipates the approval of the expropriation bill this year.
tgt_text: go hlangwa ga setheo sa tlhabollo ya temo le pušetšo ya naga le gona go tla phethwa ngwageng wo.

src_text: the establishment of the agriculture and land reform development agency will also be finalised this year.
tgt_text: "kgoro ya mešomo ya setšhaba le mananeokgoparara e tla phetha go fetišetšwa ga dihekthara tše 14 000 tša naga ya mmušo go setheo sa tlhabollo ya dintlo," mopresidente a realo.

src_text: "the department of public works and infrastructure will finalise the transfer of 14 000 hectares of state land to the housing development agency," the president said.
tgt_text: o tlaleleditše ka gore go na le naga yeo e lekanego yeo e lemegago go thekga dimilione tša balemipotlana bao ba tšwelelago ba dikgogo, leruo, dienywa le merogo.

src_text: he added that there is enough arable land to support millions of thriving smallscale farmers in poultry, livestock, fruit and vegetables.
tgt_text: balemi ba go feta ba 100 000 ba šetše ba amogetše dibaotšhara tša go ba thuša go oketša tšweletšo, gomme lenaneo leo le tla katološwa gore le fihlelele balemi ka bontšhi.

src_text: already, over 100 000 farmers have received input vouchers to expand their production and the programme will be expanded to reach more farmers.
tgt_text: bomenetša le bosenyi go tloga tlhamong ya komišene ya mabapi le go gogwa ga mmušo ka nko go ya go dinyakišišo tša mabapi le dikonteraka tša go reka tša go amana le covid19, mopresidente ramaphosa o tloga a sa metše mare ge go etla tabeng ya go fediša bomenetša.

src_text: corruption and crime from instituting the commission of inquiry into state capture, to investigating covid19related procurement contracts, president ramaphosa is leaving no stone unturned when it comes to ending corruption.
tgt_text: "maitekelo a rena a go tsošološa ikonomi a ka se atlege ge re ka se lwe le go keka ga bomenetša ka mešegofela.

src_text: "none of our efforts to revive our economy will succeed if we do not tackle the scourge of corruption once and for all," the president said.
tgt_text: pele ga la 30 phupu, mopresidente o tla ala leano la go šoma karabelong ya ditigelo tša go tla ka komišene.

src_text: by no later than 30 june 2022, he will present a plan of action in response to the commission’s recommendations.
tgt_text: o hlalositše gore ditheo tša mmušo tšeo di fapafapanego di šoma mmogo go šupa bao ba senyago, di ba fe kotlo, le go lefiša tšhelete ya mmušo yeo e utswitšwego.

src_text: he explained that various government agencies were working together to identify wrongdoers, punish them, and to get looted state money refunded.
tgt_text: polokego le tšhireletšo di tla matlafatšwa ka go thwala maphodisa a 12 000 le go hlama leswa diforamo tša sephodisa tša setšhaba.

src_text: safety and security will be strengthened through the recruitment of 12 000 police personnel and the reestablishment of community policing forums.
tgt_text: go lwa le gbvf mmušo o tla tšwela pele gape go matlafatša ntwa kgahlanong le tlaišo ya bong le polao ya basadi (gbvf) ngwageng wo ka go phethagatša leano la bosetšhaba la ditharollo go gbvf.

src_text: fighting gbvf government will also continue to intensify the fight against genderbased violence and femicide (gbvf) this year, through the implementation of the national strategic plan on gbvf.
tgt_text: melao e meswa e šetše e šoma go matlafatša lekala la tša toka le go thekga bao ba phologilego tlaišo.

src_text: three new laws are already working to strengthen the criminal justice system and support survivors.
tgt_text: "phethagatšo ya melao ye e bohlokwa go netefatša gore melato e rarollwa ka katlego, gore baphologi ba šireleditšwe le gore go ba le dithibelo tšeo di šomago ka go phethagala.

src_text: "the implementation of this legislation will go a long way to ensuring that cases are successfully prosecuted, that survivors are protected and that there are more effective deterrents in place."
tgt_text: wo mongwe wa melao e meswa yeo mopresidente ramaphosa a bego a bolela ka yona ke molaophetošwa wa tša bosenyi le merero yeo e amanago le bjona woo o šireletšago batho bao ba lego kotsing ya go ka tlaišwa gape.

src_text: one of the new laws that president ramaphosa was referring to is the criminal and related matters amendment act which protects the vulnerable from secondary victimisation.
tgt_text: molao wo o dumelela dikgorotsheko go thwala banamodi bao ka bona ngwana, mogolofadi goba motšofadi a ka lekolwago ka gona nakong ya tsheko.

src_text: this act allows the courts to appoint intermediaries through which a minor, a disabled person or an elderly person can be examined in proceedings.
tgt_text: mopresidente o be gape a bolela ka molaophetošwa o moswa wa bosenyi (melato ya go amana le thobalano le merero yeo e amanago le yona) woo o dirago gore e be molato go šomišwa bošaedi le go goketšwa ka tša thobalano ga batho bao ba nago le bogolofadi bja monagano.

src_text: the president was also referring to the new criminal law (sexual offences and related matters) amendment act which outlaws sexual exploitation and grooming of persons with mental disabilities.
tgt_text: molao wo o bolela gape gore melato ya go amana le thobalano kgahlanong le batho bao ba nago le bogolofadi bja monagano e swanetše e ngwadišwe ka lenaneong la bosetšhaba la melato ya thobalano (nrso).

src_text: this act also states that sexual offences against persons who are mentally disabled must be recorded in the national register of sex offenders.
tgt_text: molaophetošwa wa dikgaruru tša ka gae o lebelela mararankodi ao a lego gona ka dikgarurung tša dikamano tša ka gae.

src_text: the domestic violence amendment act takes account of some of the complexities in violent domestic relationships.
tgt_text: molao o dumelela tsela ya go humana mangwalo a ditaelo tša tšhireletšo, le go nabiša maemo ao lengwalo la taelo ya tšhireletšo le ka kgopelwago ka gona.

src_text: the act allows for the process of obtaining protection orders, and broadened the circumstances under which a protection order can be applied for.
tgt_text: sona 2022: go kaonafatša maphelo vukuzenzele unnamed mmušo o ikgafetše go bea batho pele, gomme o iphile matšatši a lekgolo go phetha leano la go akaretša makala ka moka a setšhaba mo kgodišong ya ikonomi ya afrika borwa, go hlola mešomo le go fetšiša tlala.

src_text: end of state of disaster in sight for sa vukuzenzele unnamed president cyril ramaphosa recently announced in his 2022 state of the nation address (sona) that government plans to scrap the national state of disaster as the coun try enters a new phase in the management of the coronavirus disease (covid19) pandemic.
tgt_text: go fedišwa ga seemo sa masetlapelo ka afrika borwa go bonala go le kgauswi vukuzenzele unnamed mopresidente cyril ramaphosa o sa tšwa go bolela nakong ya polelo ya maemo a setšhaba (sona) ya 2022 gore mmušo o beakanya go fediša seemo sa masetlapelo sa bosetšhaba ka ge naga e tsena legatong le leswa taolong ya leuba la bolwetši bja kokwanahloko ya khoro na (covid19).

src_text: "it is our intention to end the national state of disaster as soon as we have finalised other measures under the national health act and other legislation to contain the pandemic," said the president.
tgt_text: "ke maikemišetšo a rena go fediša seemo sa masetlapelo sa bosetšhaba ge re se no fetša go tla ka mekgwa e mengwe ka tlase ga molao wa maphelo wa bosetšhaba le melao e mengwe ya go re kgontšha go laola leuba le," gwa realo mopresidente.

src_text: on 15 march 2020, president ramaphosa declared the national state of disaster in terms of the disaster management act and announced a range of measures to contain the covid19 outbreak.
tgt_text: ka la 15 hlakola 2020, mopresidente ramaphosa o ile a goeletša nako ya seemo sa masetlapelo sa bosetšhaba go ya le ka molao wa taolo ya mase tlapelo gomme a tsebiša le mekgwa ya go fapafapana ya go laola go phulega ga covid19.

src_text: president ramaphosa said nearly all restrictions on economic and social activity have already been lifted, which is largely thanks to the vaccination rollout programme.
tgt_text: mopresidente ramaphosa o rile dikiletšo go tša ikonomi le leago di nyakile di fedišitšwe ka moka, gomme seo se hlotšwe ke go abja ga meento.

src_text: he reminded citizens that vaccines are the best defence against illness, death and covid19, which has claimed close to 100 000 lives locally.
tgt_text: o gopoditše badudi gore meento ke yona mokgwa wo mokaonekaone kgahlanong le go lwala, lehu le covid19 yeo e bolailego batho ba palo ya go batamela 100 000 ka mo nageng.

src_text: "i've always said from a personal point of view, had i have not been vaccinated, in december when i contracted covid19, i probably will not be standing here," he reflected.
tgt_text: "ke phela ke bolela ke re ge nkabe ke se ka entelwa ge ke be ke fetelwa ke covid19 ka kgwedi ya manthole, mohlomongwe nkabe ke se ka ema mo lehono," a realo.

src_text: the president took the time to urge south africans to take the lifesaving jab and continue to observe basic health measures and remain vigilant.
tgt_text: mopresidente o tšeere nako go hlohleletša maafrika borwa go hlabelwa moento o wa go boloka maphelo, le go tšwela pele go latela mekgwa ya motheo ya go itšhireletša ba be ba dule ba ntšhitše mahlo dinameng.

src_text: "we will be able to get on with our lives, even with the virus in our midst," he said, adding that the pandemic has exacerbated the divide between those who are employed and those who are jobless.
tgt_text: "re tla kgona go tšwela pele ka bophelo le ge kokwanahloko e sa le gona," a realo, ebile a tlaleletša ka gore leuba le hlotše karoganyo e kgolo gareng ga bao ba šomago le bao ba sa šomego.

src_text: solidarity fund president ramaphosa announced that the solidarity fund has raised r3.4 billion from more than 300 000 south africans and companies, while more than 400 individuals and 100 companies volunteered their time and services.
tgt_text: sekhwama sa solidarity mopresidente ramaphosa o tsebišitše gore sekhwama sa solidarity se kgobokeditše tšhelete ya go lekana dibilione tša diranta tše 3.4 yeo e lego meneelo ya go feta ye 300 000 go tšwa go maafrika borwa le dikhamphani, mola batho ba go feta 400 le dikhamphani tša go feta 100 di ithaopile go thuša ka ditirelo tša tšona.

src_text: "the fund has played a pivotal role in supporting the national health response and alleviating the humanitarian crisis that confronted our country and our people.
tgt_text: "sekhwama se ralokile karolo e bohlokwa thekgo ng ya karabelo ya tša maphelo ya bosetšhaba le go fediša masetlapelo ao a wetšego batho le naga ya borena."

src_text: "he thanked everyone who contributed to the fund, including some members of parliament, and other initiatives to support those affected by the pandemic.
tgt_text: o lebogile batho ka moka bao ba tsentšhitšego mašeleng ka sekhwameng, go balwa le ba bangwe ba maloko a palamente, mmogo le mananeo a mangwe a go thekga bao ba amilwego ke leuba.

src_text: the president also paid tribute to the many healthcare and frontline workers who play a key role in the fight against covid19.
tgt_text: mopresidente o ile gape a lebiša ditebogo go bašomedi ba tša maphelo le ba tša ditirelo tše bohlokwa ba bantšhi bao ba ralokago karolo e bohlokwa ntweng kgahlanong le covid19.

src_text: "the nation owes a great debt of gratitude to the dedicated health workers and to other frontline staff who put their own health and lives at risk to care for the ill and the vulnerable during this period," he said.
tgt_text: "setšhaba se tloga se leboga kudu bašomedi ba tša maphelo mmogo le bašomedi ba bangwe ba ditirelo tše bohlokwa bao ba beilego maphelo a bona kotsing ba hlokometše bao ba lwalago le bao ba lego kotsing mo nakong ye," a realo.

tgt_text: go fedišwa ga seemo sa masetlapelo ka afrika borwa go bonala go le kgauswi vukuzenzele unnamed mopresidente cyril ramaphosa o sa tšwa go bolela nakong ya polelo ya maemo a setšhaba (sona) ya 2022 gore mmušo o beakanya go fediša seemo sa masetlapelo sa bosetšhaba ka ge naga e tsena legatong le leswa taolong ya leuba la bolwetši bja kokwanahloko ya khoro na (covid19).

src_text: special tribunal is showing that crime does not pay vukuzenzele unnamed during the recent presidential imbizo in mahikeng, several citizens raised concerns about the pace of the fight against corruption.
tgt_text: kgorotsheko ya go ikgetha e bontšha gore bosenyi ga bo hole ka selo allison cooper malobanyana nakong ya imbizo ya mopresidente go la mafikeng, badudi ba mmalwa ba tsebišitše dihlobaelo tša bona mabapi le lebelo le twantšho ya bomenemene e sepelago ka lona.

src_text: they told me what i have heard in many other communities across the country: that the perpetrators of such acts are known, not least because they flaunt the proceeds of their crimes.
tgt_text: ba mpoditše seo ke setšego ke se kwele mo ditšhabeng tše dingwe tše ntši go kgabaganya naga: gore basenyi ba ditiro tše bjalo ba a tsebja, kudu ka lebaka la gore ba kgantšha ditseno tša bona tša bohodu.

src_text: but the arm of the law is long.
tgt_text: eupša letsogo la molao ke le letelele.

src_text: those who have stolen from the state may believe they have gotten away with it.
tgt_text: bao ba utsweditšego mmušo ba ka bona tše nkego ba phomeletše.

src_text: but their deeds will eventually catch up with them, whoever they are, and whatever position they may hold.
tgt_text: eupša ditiro tša bona mafelelong di tla tšwela nyanyeng, ka ntle le go šetša gore ke bomang, le gore maemo a bona ke afe.

src_text: they will learn that crime does not pay.
tgt_text: ba tla tseba gore bosenyi ga bo hole ka selo.

src_text: in this regard, one of our most effective weapons in the fight against corruption and state capture is the special tribunal of the special investigating unit (siu), which i established in 2019. it adjudicates on matters that the siu institutes for civil litigation after it has concluded its investigations.
tgt_text: go sa le bjalo, se sengwe sa dibetša tša rena tša go šoma botse tša go lwantšha bomenemene le go gogwa ga mmušo ka nko ke kgorotsheko ya go ikgetha ya lekala la dinyakišišo la go ikgetha (siu), yeo e hlomilwego ka 2019. e ahlola ditaba tšeo siu e di begago gore di sekišwe ka kgorotsheko ka morago ga go fetša ka dinyakišišo.

src_text: the special tribunal was set up to speed up litigation.
tgt_text: kgorotsheko ya go ikgetha e hlomilwe go akgofiša tshekišo.

src_text: this approach has made it possible for public funds and state assets lost to corrupt acts to be recovered faster, avoiding delays in the high courts, where the siu has to wait its turn together with other litigants.
tgt_text: tsela ye e kgontšhitše gore ditšhelete tša setšhaba le dithoto tša mmušo tšeo di lahlegilego ka lebaka la ditiro tša bomenemene di bušwe ka lebelo, go efoga dititelego ka dikgorotshe kong tša godimo, fao siu e swanelago go letela nako ya yona gotee le bangongoregi ba bangwe.

src_text: the siu can request preservation orders and the freezing of assets to prevent further losses to the state.
tgt_text: siu e ka kgopela ditaelo tša thibelo le go thibela gore dithoto di se timelele go thibela ditahlegelo tše dingwe mmušong.

src_text: this is important when considering that per petrators who are under suspicion often go to great lengths to move around, hide or dispose of proceeds of corruption.
tgt_text: se se bohlokwa ge go šetšwa gore basenyi bao ba belae lwago gantši ba leka ka maatla go tloša, go khutiša goba go lahla ditseno tša bomenemene.

src_text: there can be no doubt the special tribunal has been a game changer.
tgt_text: ga go na pelaelo ya gore kgorotsheko ya go ikgetha e fetotše dilo.

src_text: since its establishment, the tribunal has recovered around r8.6 billion from unlawful contracts.
tgt_text: go tloga mola ya hlomiwago, kgorotsheko e dirile gore tšhelete ya go balelwa go r8.6 bilione e bušwe go tšwa go dikonteraka tše di sego molaong.

src_text: for any fight against corruption to be deemed effective, it is not sufficient that perpetrators are pro secuted.
tgt_text: gore twantšho ye nngwe le ye nngwe ya bomenemene e atlege, ga se go lekane gore basenyi ba sekišwe fela.

src_text: the proceeds of their crimes must be recovered.
tgt_text: ditseno tša bona tša bosenyi di swanetše go bušwa.

src_text: this money belongs to citizens and should be used to meet their needs.
tgt_text: tšhelete ye ke ya badudi gomme e swanetše go šomišwa go kgotsofatša dinyakwa tša bona.

src_text: the special tribunal recently ordered two construction companies to return the profits they earned from r40 million in contracts to erect the beit bridge border fence.
tgt_text: malobanyana kgoro tsheko ya go ikgetha e laetše dikhaphani tše pedi tša go aga go buša dipoelo tšeo di di amogetšego go tšwa go r40 milione ya konteraka ya go aga legora la mollwane wa beit bridge.

src_text: this followed an investigation by the siu that uncovered a number of irregularities, including a prepayment to the companies by the department of public works and infrastructure.
tgt_text: se se tla morago ga nyakišišo ya go dirwa ke siu yeo e utulotšego manyofonyofo a mmalwa, go akaretšwa go lefelwa pele ga dikhamphani ka kgoro ya mešomo ya setšhaba le mananeokgoparara.

src_text: over the past few weeks alone, the tribunal has reviewed and set aside more than r100 million worth of irregular and unlawful contracts arising from covidrelated pro curement.
tgt_text: mo dibekeng tše mmalwa tša go feta fela, kgorotsheko ya go ikgetha e sekasekile le go beela thoko dikonteraka tše di sego molaong le tša manyofonyofo tše di balelwago ka godimo ga r100 milione tša theko ya dithoto ya go amana le covid19.

src_text: the special tribunal has also been successful in getting back money from senior executives in stateowned enterprises who conducted irregular business activities.
tgt_text: kgorotsheko ya go ikgetha gape e atlegile ka go buša tšhelete ya go tšwa go bahlankedibagolophethiši ka dikgwebong tša go ba ka fase ga mmušo bao ba dirilego manyofonyofo kgwebong.

src_text: for example, last year a former transnet executive was ordered to pay r26 million he received as a shareholder of a firm of consulting engineers contracted to transnet while he was a fulltime employee.
tgt_text: mohlala, ngwaga wa go feta mohlankediphethiši wa peleng wa transnet o laetšwe go lefa r26 milione ye a e amogetšego bjalo ka mongdišere wa feme ya boraintšeneere ba go eletša ba ba tsenetšego konteraka le transnet mola a be a le mošomi wa moyagoile.

src_text: the siu has in a number of cases approached the tribunal to delay the payment of pension benefits, pending the outcome of its investigations, to public servants implicated in financial irregularities or fruitless and wasteful expenditure.
tgt_text: siu mo melatong ya go balega e ile go kgoro tsheko ya go ikgetha go ditela tefelo ya dikholego tša phenšene, go sa letetšwe dipoelo tša dinyakišišo tša yona, tša bašomi ba mmušo ba ba amegago ka gare ga manyofonyofo a ditšhelete goba tshenyo ya ditšhelete.

src_text: the cases before the special tribunal show that much work still needs to be done to strengthen governance and management across all arms of the state.
tgt_text: melato ye e lego pele ga kgorotsheko ya go ikgetha e laetša gore mošomo wo montši o sa ntše o nyaka go dirwa go matlafatša pušo le bolaodi go kgabaganya makala ka moka a mmušo.

src_text: they point to serious lapses on the part of accounting officers and failures to adhere to laws and regulations governing procurement i have said before that winning the war on cor ruption will be difficult, and that it will take time to unravel the vast webs of patronage that had become entrenched.
tgt_text: ba laetša diphošo tše kgolo ka lehlakoreng la bahlankedi ba tšhupamatlotlo le go palelwa go latela melao le melawana ya dithendara ya go laola theko ya dithoto le ditirelo.

src_text: i have also maintained that we must fight private sector corruption with equal vigour, because for every public sector employee willing to be bribed, there is a business person willing to pay a bribe.
tgt_text: nkile ka bolela gore go fenya ntwa ya bomenemene go tla ba boima, le gore go tla tšea nako go hlahlamolla digongwana tše kgolo tša tšhomišano tše di tseneletšego.

src_text: these corrupt relationships have eroded the capacity of the state to deliver on its mandate.
tgt_text: ke tšwetšepele go bolela gore re swanetše go lwantšha bomenemene bja lekala la poraebete ka mafolofolo a go lekana le a re a šomišago lekaleng la mmušo, gobane go mošomi wo mongwe le wo mongwe wa mmušo yoo a nyakang pipamolomo, go na le rakgwebo yoo a nyakang go mo lefa pipamolomo yeo.

src_text: they have set back the state’s efforts to provide decent healthcare, to deliver clean water, and to ensure a consistent supply of power to communities and businesses.
tgt_text: dikamano tše tša bomenemene di fokoditše bokgoni bja mmušo bja go phethagatša thomo ya wona.

src_text: but, as the special tribunal has demonstrated, we are steadily turning the tide.
tgt_text: di bušeditše morago maiteko a mmušo a go aba tlhokomelo ya maphelo ya go ba le tlhompho, a go aba meetse a go hlweka, le a go kgonthiša kabelo ya go se kgaotše ya mohlagase go ditšhaba le dikgwebo.

src_text: not only are perpetrators being arrested and taken to court; they are also having to forfeit the proceeds of their crimes.
tgt_text: eupša, bjalo ka ge kgorotsheko ya go ikgetha e laeditše, ganyanega nyane re fetoša maemo.

src_text: there is still a long way to go, and there is a huge amount of stolen public funds that still need to be recovered.
tgt_text: ga se fela gore basenyi ba a swarwa le go išwa kgorotsheko; gape ba swanela go lahlegelwa ke ditseno tša bona tša bosenyi.

src_text: but the siu and the special tribunal have made a good start, and i am confident of many more successes in the months and years ahead.
tgt_text: kgorotsheko ya go ikgetha e bontšha gore bosenyi ga bo hole ka selo allison cooper malobanyana nakong ya imbizo ya mopresidente go la mafikeng, badudi ba mmalwa ba tsebišitše dihlobaelo tša bona mabapi le lebelo le twantšho ya bomenemene e sepelago ka lona.

src_text: food at school ensures children don’t go hungry vukuzenzele unnamed over nine million children receive a nutritious meal at school thanks to government’s national school nutrition programme (nsnp), which was introduced in 1994. the programme aims to improve children’s ability to learn, by reducing malnutrition and hunger and improving school attendance, especially at disadvantaged schools.
tgt_text: phepo ya dijo mo dikolong e netefatša gore bana ga ba phele ka tlala vukuzenzele unnamed bana bao ba ka fetago dimilione tše senyane ba amogela dijo tša phepo dikolong gomme se ke ka lebaka la lenaneo la bosetšhaba la phepo ya bana ba dikolo (nsnp), leo le tsebagaditšwego ka ngwaga wa 1994. lenaneo le le ikemišeditše go kaonafatša bokgoni bja bana bja go ithuta, ka go fokotša phepompe le tlala le go kaonafatša go tsena sekolo ga bana, kudukudu ka dikolong tšeo di hlokišitšwego menyetla.

src_text: "the programme is critical for furthering learners’ constitutional rights to basic nutrition and basic education," explains deputy minister of basic education dr reginah mhaule.
tgt_text: "lenaneo le le bohlokwa go tšwetša pele ditokelo tša baithuti tša molaotheo go phepo ya motheo le go thuto ya motheo," gwa hlaloša motlatšatona wa thuto ya motheo ngaka reginah mhaule.

src_text: as a result of the nsnp, more children are attending school on time and more regularly, and their concentration in class has improved.
tgt_text: ka lebaka la nsnp, bana ba bantši ba tla sekolong ka nako ebile ba tla ka mehla, gomme go theeletša ga bona ka mephatong go kaonafetše.

src_text: according to the department of basic education (dbe), learners are taught good eating and lifestyle habits.
tgt_text: go ya ka kgoro ya thuto ya motheo (dbe), bana ba rutwa ka ga mekgwa ye mekaone ya go ja le ya mekgwa ya bophelo.

src_text: schools are also encouraged to set up their own food gardens to supplement the nsnp menu.
tgt_text: dikolo di hlohleletšwa go hloma dirapana tša tšona tša dijo gore di kgone go tlaleletša tša lenaneo la dijo la nsnp.

src_text: learners, teachers and parents are taught grow their own food.
tgt_text: baithuti, barutiši le batswadi ba rutwa go tšweletša dijo tša bona ka dirapaneng.

src_text: nsnp awards thabang primary school in bethlehem, free state, is one of the schools that benefits from the nsnp.
tgt_text: difoka tša nsnp sekolo sa phoraemari sa thabang ka bethlehem, forei setata, ke se sengwe sa dikolo tše di holegago go nsnp.

src_text: the school recently won the nsnp best school award.
tgt_text: sekolo se se sa tšwa go thopa sefoka sa sekolo se sekaone sa go sepediša lenaneo la nsnp.

src_text: the awards celebrate schools’ nutrition programmes by looking at their hygiene and safety practices, nutritious meals, food gardens and nutrition education.
tgt_text: difoka tše di keteka mananeo a phepo a dikolong ka go lebeledišiša ditiro tša ona tša pabalelo ya maphelo le tša polokego, dijo tša phepo, dirapana tša dijo le thuto ka ga phepo.

src_text: "i am extremely grateful that the school won the award," says seyanokeng sejake, the thabang pri mary principal for the past 24 years.
tgt_text: "ke thabile kudu ge sekolo se se thopile sefoka," gwa bolela seyanokeng sejake, yo a nago le sebaka sa mengwaga ye 24 e le hlogo ya sekolo sa phoraemari sa thabang.

src_text: thabang primary school has been running its nutrition programme since 1994. today, it ensures that its 1 065 learners receive a healthy breakfast daily from a local business.
tgt_text: sekolo sa phoraemari sa thabang se thomile go sepetša lenaneo la sona la phepo go tloga ka 1994. lehono, se netefatša gore baithuti ba sona ba 1 065 ba hwetša dijo tša mesong tša phepo letšatši le lengwe le le lengwe tše di rekwago dikgwebong tša mo motseng.

src_text: the food is cooked by unemployed members of the community, who are appointed by the school governing body (sgb).
tgt_text: dijo di apewa ke maloko a setšhaba ao a sa šomego, bao ba thwalwago ke lekgotlataolo la sekolo (sgb).

src_text: "our six employed voluntary food handlers (vfh) make the food provided by the department of basic education through the allocation of funds to the school," says sejake.
tgt_text: dijo tšeo di abilwego ke kgoro ya thuto ka go abela sekolo se ditšhelete di apea ke baapei ba dijo ba tshela bao ba thwetšwego ka go ithaopa (vfh)," gwa bolela sejake.

src_text: they vfhs each receive a stipend for preparing the food.
tgt_text: yo mongwe le yo mongwe wa bašomedi ba divfh o hwetša letsenonyana le lennyane go mo leboga ka mošomo wa gagwe wa go apea dijo.

src_text: thabang primary school took top honours at the awards due to the hard work and commitment of its sgb, management team and functional nsnp com mittee, says sejake.
tgt_text: sekolo sa phoraemari sa thabang se amogetše tlhompho ye kgolo ka moletlong wa kabo ya difoka ka lebaka la ge se šomile kudu gomme se gape ke ka lebaka la boikgafo bja sgb ya sona, sehlopha sa taolo le komiti ya nsnp ye e šomago gabotse, gwa bolela sejake.

src_text: "punctuality is the order of the day.
tgt_text: "go tsena ka nako ke seo se dirwago letšatši le lengwe le le lengwe.

src_text: we don’t allow absenteeism, without a valid reason, and we have no dropouts.
tgt_text: ga re dumelele gore baithuti ba se tle sekolong ka ntle le lebaka leo le kwagalago, ebile ga re na le bao ba tlogelago dithuto pele ba ka di pheta.

src_text: our learners’ concentration and general performance have also improved," she adds.
tgt_text: go theeletša ka šedi ga baithuti ba rena le go šoma gabotse mešomong ya bona ka moka ya sekolo le gona go kaonafetše," a tlaleletša ka go realo.

src_text: as the prize for winning the award is a stateoftheart kitchen built by the tiger brands foundation, the school’s nutrition programme is set to become even better.
tgt_text: ka ge mpho ya ge re thopile sefoka e le khitšhi ya maemo a godimo ye e agilwego ke tiger brands foundation, lenaneo la phepo la sekolo se le tlo kaonafala le go feta.

src_text: the school also ensures that there are enough food supplies which are managed properly, to ensure there is always food for the programme.
tgt_text: sekolo se netefatša gape gore go na le kabo ya dijo ye e lekanego yeo e laolwago gabotse, go netefatša gore go dula go na le dijo ka mo lenaneong le.

src_text: "for example, we have a food garden that supplies vegetables to supplement the nsnp allocation," explains sejake.
tgt_text: "go fa mohlala, re na le serapana sa dijo seo se abago merogo go tlaleletša dijo tša nsnp," gwa hlaloša sejake.

src_text: award winners in the best schools category, grootdrink intermediate, in the mgcawu district in the northern cape, took second place and aaron gqedu primary school, in nelson mandela bay in the eastern cape, came third.
tgt_text: bathopadifoka ka go legoro la dikolo tše kaone, sekolo sa grootdrink intermediate, ka seleteng sa mgcawu district ka kapa leboa, se hweditše maemo a bobedi; gomme sekolo sa phoraemari sa aaron gqedu, ka nelson mandela bay ka kapa bohlabela, se hweditše maemo a boraro.

src_text: they will receive kitchen equipment from the depart ment of basic education.
tgt_text: di tlo hwetša ditlabelo tša ka khitšhing go tšwa go kgoro ya thuto ya motheo.

src_text: the best district award was won by umzinyathi (kwazulunatal).
tgt_text: sefoka se sekaone sa ka seleteng se thopilwe ke umzinyathi (kwazulunatal).

src_text: the zf mgcawu district (northern cape) came second and metro north (western cape) came third.
tgt_text: selete sa zf mgcawu (ka kapa leboa) se hweditše maemo a bobedi gomme sa metro north (ka kapa bodikela) sona se hweditše mae mo a boraro.

src_text: each district won office and computer equipment.
tgt_text: selete se sengwe le se sengwe se thopile ditlabelo tša ka ofising le tša dikhomphutha.

src_text: in 2020/21, the nsnp provided meals to children at 21 189 schools.
tgt_text: phepo ya dijo mo dikolong e netefatša gore bana ga ba phele ka tlala vukuzenzele unnamed bana bao ba ka fetago dimilione tše senyane ba amogela dijo tša phepo dikolong gomme se ke ka lebaka la lenaneo la bosetšhaba la phepo ya bana ba dikolo (nsnp), leo le tsebagaditšwego ka ngwaga wa 1994. lenaneo le le ikemišeditše go kaonafatša bokgoni bja bana bja go ithuta, ka go fokotša phepompe le tlala le go kaonafatša go tsena sekolo ga bana, kudukudu ka dikolong tšeo di hlokišitšwego menyetla.

src_text: keep children safe online vukuzenzele unnamed with the world increasingly moving online, it’s important for children to take advantage these opportunities while also staying safe.
tgt_text: dirang gore bana ba bolokege inthaneteng vukuzenzele unnamed ka ge lefase le tšwela pele go diriša inthanete kudu, go bohlokwa gore bana ba šomiše dibaka tše gomme ba dire bjalo ba itlhokometše.

src_text: the government communication and information system (gcis) and digify africa recently hosted a webinar with media monitoring africa (mma) and the film and publication board (fpb) to teach children, educators, parents and the public about how to be responsible online.
tgt_text: tshepetšo ya dikgokagano le tshedimošo ya mmušo (gcis) le digify africa di sa tšwa go swara wekešopo ya inthaneteng le media monitoring africa (mma) le lekgotla la difilimi le diphatlalatšo (fpb) go ruta bana, barutiši, batswadi le setšhaba mabapi le ka fao ba ka rwalago maitemogelo mabapi le inthanete.

src_text: phakamile khumalo, the programme manager of public and media skills development at mma, said seven out of 10 children who answered questions as part of the sa kids online study said they used the internet without their parents’ permission.
tgt_text: phakamile khumalo, molaodi wa mananeo wa tlhabollo ya setšhaba le mabokgoni a tša kgašo ka mma, o boletše gore bana ba šupa go ba 10 bao ba arabilego dipotšišo bjalo ka karolo ya dinyakišišo tša sa kids online ba boletše gore ba šomiša inthanete ka ntle le tumelelo ya batswadi ba bona.

src_text: only four out of 10 children said they have some sort of information about online safety.
tgt_text: ke fela ba bane go bana ba 10 bao ba boletšego gore ba na le tshedimošonyana mabapi le polokego inthaneteng.

src_text: this shows that children need skills and resources to help them use the internet safely.
